loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy bales of clothes to add to her stock

loans.name: Besta

texts.en: Besta is currently in the business of selling simsim, fish and onions. She is 24 years old, married, and has 3 children, none of whom goes to school.  Besta asked for a loan to stock more simsim, fish and onions. She hopes to build a big house with extra profits from her business in the future.

loans.use: To stock more simsim (sesame seed), fish and onions.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is 59 years old, married, and the father of three children.  He has been practicing dairy farming for ten years.  He has managed to raise his children with his income.  Two are now independent.  He joined Faulu Kenya so that he could access financial resources easily.  He also gets business ideas from his group members in Faulu Kenya.  He hopes to become a largescale farmer in the future.  He has requested 60,000 kes to buy a dairy cow.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Soem

texts.en: Soem R., age 41, lives in the province of Kompong Tom, which is the best area for farming. Soem R. is a married woman who is devoted to her three children, one of whom is a student.  The other two are sewing workers in a factory.  Soem R. and her husband work together in the same business, as salt and potato traders in a mobile unit. The family typically generates revenue of US$8 each day, which helps them live a comfortable life. Soem R. would like a loan in order to purchase a piece of land in good condition for a farming.  She will rent out this land to farmers for a fee.

loans.use: To purchase a piece of land.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a freezer for his butcher shop business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy two bulls for fattening.

loans.name: Airforce Group

texts.en:
Theresia J., who is in her mid-thirties, is married, with two children.  She has run her own pharmacy shop for three years.  She works from 9.00am to 10.00pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.  

This will be Theresia's first Motisha loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. A Motisha loan is a product offered by Tujijenge Tanzania.  It allows borrowers with good credit ratings to pay back their original loans faster and receive extra money before their original loan term has ended. She hopes to obtain a loan to buy more medicines for her pharmacy.

Theresia will share this loan with her loan group,  Airforce, which has a total of 11 members.  The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

In the picture, Theresia is wearing blue, first on the left, front row.

loans.use: To buy more medicines for the pharmacy.

loans.name: Emiliya

texts.en: Emiliya is in a business selling beans, onions, simsim and peas. She is 30 years old, married to a businessman, and has 9 children.  Seven of the children go to school. Emiliya asked for a loan to stock more beans, onions, simsim and peas . She hopes to expand her business and pay her children's school fees with extra profits in the future.

loans.use: To stock more beans, onions, simsim(sesame seed), and peas to sell.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en: Michael is 36 years old and is married, with two children.  For ten years, he has been selling vehicle spare parts.  He has employed two people to help him in his tasks.  He also does poultry farming to boost his income.  Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has developed a culture of saving.  He will be able to reinvest in his business.  He hopes to own real estate in the future.  He has requested  50,000 Kes to buy a gearbox and crank shafts.

loans.use: To buy spare parts

loans.name: Soem

texts.en: Soem R. is a 28-year-old married woman who lives in the province of Kompong Tom. Soem R. and her husband make a living by growing a rice crop. This young couple has two children who are in school.  Soem R.'s crop is not growing well because it needs more fertilizer.  She has decided to seek a loan to buy sacks of fertilizer for her crops to grow better. With the rest of the loan, she will invest in planting potatoes.

loans.use: To buy sacks of fertilizer for her crops.

loans.name: Mr. Ban Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Ban is a village bank leader who has been selected by the twelve people who make up a village bank loan.   Each person will use his/her portion for different purposes to improve their family's standard of living. 

Ban and his wife are farmers who own a 1.5-hectare plot of land, where they grow both rice and vegetables to sell.  Besides farming, he is a chef.   He wants to start a new business, but his savings are not enough to support his family.   Ban is asking for a loan to add to his savings to buy a cow. He has children who are married who live on their own.  He has a grandchild living with him.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase bundles of maize flour, sugar and cooking oil.

loans.name: Heida

texts.en: Heida is currently in the business of selling beans, onions, and fish. She is 24 years old, married to a businessman, and has three children, two of whom go to school. Heida borrowed a loan to stock more beans, onions, and fish to sell. She hopes to expand her business with extra profits in the future.

loans.use: To stock more beans, onions, and fish to sell

loans.name: Darisuren

texts.en: Darisuren is 54 years old and lives with her husband and two children in the province of Tuv in Mongolia. All of her children got married, and she lives with her husband in a rented house. She began a cosmetic retail business in 2008. Currently she also operates a beauty salon, which she started in 2010, in addition to her cosmetics sales business. Her business has expanded slightly, and she is training six people who will have stable jobs in her beauty salon after graduation. She wants to enlarge her beauty salon and expand her cosmetics sales business. Darisuren is a hardworking and modest person. She is requesting a 2,500,000 MNT loan in order to purchase cosmetics and necessary tools for her beauty salon.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics and necessary tools

loans.name: Margaret Wanyofu

texts.en:
Margaret N. is 43 years old and married to Josiah Odhiambo, who contributes to the family income. She has four children, ages 19, 11, 10, and 5. She sells fish to her customers in Makongeni in Thika-Town. She has been in this business for a period of five years, with an income of 8,500 KES per month.

She has never borrowed from any other MFI, and this is her first loan from KADET LTD. She intends to use the loan to buy more fish to sell to her customers. 

She hopes to grow her business and become a leading fish seller and distribute to other food stores.

loans.use: To buy more fish to sell

loans.name: George

texts.en: George is 35 years old, married, and has four children who are in school. He sells fish so as to earn a living. He was previously doing carpentry for a living. He has been running his business for 15 years and has employed two people. He hopes to establish other businesses in the future. Being a member of Faulu Kenya, he is able to save his money and also get loans. Hence, he has requested 50,000 KES to stock more fish.

loans.use: To buy more fish

loans.name: Chantsal

texts.en: Chantsal, 56, is married and lives with her husband and daughter in the province of Tuv in Mongolia. They live in a ger, a Mongolian nomadic tent home, on a small plot of land that they own. Her husband and daughter are self-employed. Chantsal operates a cafeteria which is located in an office building. She has her regular customers, and her income is very stable, since her cafeteria is located in a building where there are many offices.  She is requesting a loan of 400,000 MNT to buy new kitchen tools and equipment for her cafeteria.

loans.use: To buy new kitchen tools

loans.name: Lilias

texts.en: A. is currently in the business of selling clothes. She is 35 years old and married to a farmer with six children. Four of them go to school. A. took out a loan to stock more clothes to sell. She hopes to expand her business with the extra profits in the future.

loans.use: To stock more clothes to sell

loans.name: Veronicah

texts.en: Veronicah is a married lady with a six-year-old child. She runs a salon so as to earn her daily bread. It's been 15 years since she started the business. Since then her business has been growing and this is not without the support from Faulu Kenya. She hopes to set up a beauty parlor in the future. She is asking for a loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings to buy hair shampoo, hair oil and hair chemicals.

loans.use: To buy hair shampoo, hair oil and hair chemicals

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, five crates of soda and boxes of washing detergents

loans.name: Ochirsuuri

texts.en: Ochirsuuri, 26, is married and lives with his wife and two children in the Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. They live in a ger (a traditional Mongolian tent) on a small plot of land that they have owned for the past four years. They have a decent standard of living. They used to live in the countryside and owned some livestock before they came to the town in order to send their children to school. Ochirsuuri began making woodcraft items in 2007. He makes wooden products including home furniture and ger structural parts at home and sells them at a local market. Now he has several regular customers and his business has become more stable. He pays much attention to the quality of his products to attract more customers. He wants to carry on this business and expand production. He is a hard-working person with initiative who says: "I am trying to expand my business and increase my working capital. I am also planning to buy a car." He is requesting a loan of 2,200,000 MNT to purchase more timber and materials for his business.

loans.use: To purchase more timber and materials

loans.name: Norway Group

texts.en:
Bahati M., who is in her early forties, is married with one son. She has had a business selling food for one year. She works from 5am to 2pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Bahati's first loan from Tujienge Tanzania. She hopes for a loan to increase her food stocks. Her dream is to build a good house.  

Bahati will share this loan with her loan group, Norway, which has a total of 15 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

In the picture, Bahati is in yellow, first from the left.

loans.use: To increase food stocks to expand a business.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Christina

texts.en: Christina is currently in a business selling siko and kimbo (Sudanese beers), beans and small fish. She is 35 years old, married and has nine children, five of whom go to school. Christina wants a loan to stock more siko, kimbo, beans and small fish to sell. She hopes to expand her business with extra profits in the future.

loans.use: To buy more siko and kimbo (Sudanese beers), beans and small fish to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 48-year-old single woman from Lebanon. She lives with her brother. She has 20 years of experience working as a farmer. She has been running her own farm since 2000. She cultivates all type of fruits according to the season. After the death of her parents, she started to cooperate with her brother to handle the heavy life expenses. This will be her second Kiva loan.

Today, she is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva's partner, Ameen s.a.l., to purchase supplies needed for her agriculturA. work. She estimates that with the coming harvest, her profits will be increased.

loans.use: To purchase supplies for her agricultural work

loans.name: Tom

texts.en: Tom is 32 years old and married and with two children. He has a business making sun beds, chairs and tents to better his family’s living standards. He has been operating the business for six years. He has employed one person. He joined Faulu Kenya under the Unity Self Help group. Being a member of the group, he saves his money and is able to access loans from Faulu Kenya easily because the group members guarantee each other's loans.  He is asking for 40,000 KES to buy timber.

loans.use: To buy timber

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: T. is currently in a business selling simsim (sesame) and groundnuts. She is  21 years old and married with three children, one of whom goes to school. T. wants a loan to stock more simsim and groundnuts to sell. She hopes to expand her business with extra profits in the future.

loans.use: To buy more simsim and groundnuts to sell.

loans.name: Stanley Kariuki

texts.en:
Stanley Kariuki is 50 years old and married to Phidith Wanjiku, who also contributes to the family income. He has four dependent children. He has been running a knitting and wool-selling business for a period of 10 years with an income of about 25,000 KES per month.

He has never borrowed from any other MFI and this is his first loan from KADET Ltd.  He intends to use it to buy more wool and add some savings to buy a motorbike. He hopes to expand his business and improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: to buy more wool

loans.name: Job

texts.en: Job is a married man with two children.  He runs a retail shop so as to provide for his family.  He was previously in farming.  He has been engaged in the business for over two years and has been able to add stock to his business using loans from Faulu Kenya.  He hopes to grow his business into a supermarket in the future.  Job has requested 40,000 KES to buy sugar, rice and cooking fat.

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice and cooking fat

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 56-year-old married man and the father of one school-age child. He is from Lebanon. He is an experienced home painter; he has been working as a freelance home painter for almost 30 years. He is the main income provider of his family. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1000 from Kiva's partner, Ameen s.a.l., to purchase a step ladder for his painting occupation. This will be his second Kiva loan and he is very thankful for the results. In the future, he is looking to further enlarge his business operation. He hopes that the coming year will continue to bring positive growth and increased profits.

loans.use: To purchase a step ladder

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Stock more siko, simsim, beans and small fish to sell.

loans.name: Jacinta Wanjiru

texts.en:
Jacinta has practised farming in Olkalou town for the last 11 years.  She is 28 years old, married to Simon K. and they have four school-going children.

She was introduced to KADET Ltd. by her friend and this will be her first loan.  She plans to use the loan amount to buy potato seedlings and fertilizer.

In future, Jacinta hopes to buy a truck which she will be using to transport her farm produce to the marketplace.

loans.use: To buy potato seedlings and fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 21-year-old single man from Lebanon. He lives with his parents and four siblings. He has been working in a local supermarket since 2009 to earn income. With his business income, he is able to help his father with the family expenses. As is common among young Lebanese men, he is working and pursuing his education at the same time. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1000 from Kiva's partner, Ameen s.a.l., to pay for his university education fees. He is studying architecture and this is his third year. In the future, he is planning to start his career in a company and be able to help his parents more with his income.

loans.use: To pay for his university education fees

loans.name: Rajube

texts.en:
Rajube is currently in the business of selling beans, fish, onions, cooking oil, small fish and siko (a local beer).  She is 31 years old and married to a man who is in the army.  They have 6 children and one of them goes to school.

Rajube borrowed a loan to stock more beans, fish, onions, cooking oil, small fish and siko to sell. She hopes to expand her business with any extra profits in the future.

loans.use: stock more beans, fish, onions, cooking oil, small fish and siko to sell.

loans.name: Jackson Musembi

texts.en:
Jackson Musembi, 41,  has run a quarry business for 15 years, in Lukenya. He is married to Emma Mumbua, a business lady and they have four children.

He supplies stones to customers who are located in Machakos and Kitengela.  Jackson earns a profit of Kshs 12,500 per month. 

Jackson has applied for a loan to purchase another quarry site.   If the loan boosts the business, he will buy a lorry (truck) to deliver stones.

He describes himself as hardworking.

loans.use: Purchase another quarry site

loans.name: Joice

texts.en: N. sells fish.  She is 35 years old, with five children and married to a farmer.  One of their children goes to school. N. wants a loan to stock more fish to sell to customers.  She hopes to expand her business and earn extra profits.

loans.use: stock more fish to sell.

loans.name: Juliana Mueni

texts.en:
Juliana Mueni is a 51 years old farmer.  She is married to S. who contributes to the family income.  Juliana supports 10 members of her family.  Farming for over a decade, she has a monthly income of about KES. 2,000 per month. 

This is her first loan from KADET LTD.  She will buy seedlings, fertilizer and watering cans with the money.  She hopes to be a leading farmer in her area by growing different crops which will improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: Buy seedlings, fertilizer and watering cans

loans.name: Lilias

texts.en:
Lilias S. is currently in the business of selling fish. 

She is a 30-year-old widow with three children, and none of them goes to school. 

Lilias borrowed a loan to stock more fish to sell. She hopes to expand her business with extra profits in the future.

loans.use: To stock more fish to sell

loans.name: Loise Wanjiru

texts.en:
Loise Wanjiru K. has practiced farming in Olkalou for the last 10 years. She is 43 years old, single and the mother of one child.  

She was introduced to KADET Ltd. by her friend and this will be her third loan. She paid her previous loans well and in good time. She plans to use the loan amount to buy a dairy cow.

In the future, Loise hopes to diversify her sources of income and open a boutique, selling all types of clothes.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 52-year-old married man living with his wife and one child.  He is from Lebanon. He has been working in his own butchery for 15 years. He has more than 30 years of experience in this occupation. He sells a wide range of meats to customers from his community. He has been working hard to support his family. This will be his fourth Kiva loan. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1300 from Kiva's partner, Ameen s.a.l., to purchase machinery to help him cut the meat faster. He is very positive about his future plans and hopes to serve more customers and earn a higher income.

loans.use: To purchase machinery to help him cut the meat faster

loans.name: Rose Ajwang

texts.en:
Rose Ajwang O. is a  55-year-old widower from Migori town. She has four children who are all grown up and in college.

Rose has a cereals business that she has been doing for the past four years. She is applying for her fourth loan from KADET Ltd. after successfully completing the previous loans. 

Rose wants to add maize and beans to her stock using the loan that she has applied for. Her monthly income is KES 17,500.

Her desire is to see her business grow.

loans.use: To buy maize and beans to add to her stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fertilizer and potato seedlings

loans.name: Bilha Wanjiku

texts.en:
Bilha Wanjiku M. has practiced farming in Olkalou town for the last 20 years. She is 69 years old and has eight children. Her husband died.  

She was introduced to KADET Ltd. by her friend, and she paid her previous loans well and in good time. She plans to use the loan amount to buy fertilizer and potato seedlings for planting.

In the future, Bilha hopes to buy more land and build rental houses.

loans.use: To buy buy potato seedlings and fertilizer for planting

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 19-year-old single man from Lebanon. He lives with his parents and 5 siblings. He works in a small local restaurant. In parallel, he is pursuing his education at the university. With his business income, he is able to help his father with the education fees.

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to pay his university education fees. In the future, he is planning to start his career in an appropriate company where he can use his education skills.

loans.use: to pay for his university education fees

loans.name: Susan Njoki

texts.en:
Susan has sold fruits and vegetables in Olkalou for the last 10 years.  She is 38 years old and the single mother of six children.  

This will be her second loan from KADET LTD.  She paid off her previous loan of Kshs 15,000 in good time. She plans to use this loan to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell.

In the future, Susan hopes to move her business into a permanent building, and she thinks this will help her sell more fruits and vegetables.

loans.use: To buy more fruits and vegatables for sell.

loans.name: Jane Mary

texts.en:
Jane Mary is 28 years old, married to Nzine,and a mother of three children who all schooling. She has been  farming in Mutongoni for a period of two years with an income of about $75 per month.

This is her first loan from KADET LTD and she wants to use the loan to buy farm supplies such as seedlings,and fertilizer. 


She hopes to grow different crops on her farm and improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies such as seedlings& fertilizer

loans.name: Marta

texts.en: Marta is currently in a business of selling greens and tomatoes. She is 30 years old and a widow with five children, all of whom go to school. Marta took out a loan to stock more greens and tomatoes to sell. In the future, she hopes to pay her children's school fees with the extra profits from her business.

loans.use: To stock more greens and tomatoes to sell.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is currently in a business of selling siko (a traditional beer in South Sudan).  She is 39 years old, married to a policeman, and has four children who  all go to school. Rose took out a loan to stock more siko to sell. In the future she hopes to expand her business with her extra profits.

loans.use: To stock more siko (beer) to sell.

loans.name: Boniface Mwanza

texts.en:
Boniface M., who is 26 years old, operates a quarry business. He is married to Elizabeth, who is 24 years old, and together they have a daughter and a son aged four and two years respectively. He was introduced to KADET LTD by an existing customer.

Boniface’s business is located in Lukenya and it has been in operation for the last three years. The business earns him a monthly profit of about $219. He intends to use entire loan amount to purchase a stone cutting machine and blades. If the loan boosts the business, he intends to buy another quarry.

In the future, Boniface wants to have a big quarry and buy lorries for transportation of stones to the sites. He describes himself as hardworking and ambitious.

loans.use: Purchase a stone cutting machine and blades.

loans.name: Adjo  Afidekemefao

texts.fr: Madame Adjo a 3 enfants  et est  âgée  de  29 ans.  Elle  est  née  dans  la  préfecture  de Yoto  et  habite quartier  Hedzranawoé.    Pour améliorer  les  conditions  de  vie  de  ses  enfants,  elle  vend  au  marché  de Hedzranawoé  les  oignons.  Elle  cumule  7 ans  d’expérience et  s’approvisionne  au   grand  marché  de  Lomé  en  gros  et  redistribue   en  détail.   Elle  demande  un  prêt  pour acheter  5 sacs  d’oignons.
texts.en:
Madame Adjo has 3 children and is 29 years old. She was born in the Yoto prefecture and lives in the Hedzranawoé neighborhood.

In order to improve her children's standard of living, she sells onions at the Hedzranawoé market. She has 7 years of experience, and obtains her supplies from wholesalers at the grand market of Lomé. She then re-sells the onions. 

Madame Adjo is asking for a loan to buy 5 sacks of onions.

loans.use: To buy onions

loans.name: Tuta

texts.en: Tuta is currently in a business of selling tea. She is 25 years old and married with five children, three of whom go to school. Tuta borrowed a loan to stock more tea to sell. She hopes to expand her business with extra profits in the future.

loans.use: To stock more tea to sell.

loans.name: Saint Joseph Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité SAINT JOSEPH est créé le 04 décembre 2007. Il est composé de 09 femmes qui sont toutes de la même Communauté Ecclésiale. Ce sont des femmes qui se retrouve au tour des activités de leur Paroisse. Elles mènent en général le petit commerce et l'élevage de porcs. Le groupe fait partie du Banc Villageois de l'Association des femmes Catholiques de la Sainte Thérèse.

Madame ÉMILIE C. (debout à l'extrême gauche de la photo) est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 39 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants.

Elle fait du petit commerce de  biscuits et de produits laitiers. Elle pratique cette activité bien avant qu'elle n'adhère au Banc Villageois

Son nouveau crédit lui permettra de mieux développer son activité afin d'accroitre ses revenus financiers.

Son objectif est de participer à la prise en charge de la nourriture de la famille tout en renforçant son niveau d'épargne dans le Banc Villageois
texts.en:
The Saint Joseph solidarity group was created on December 4, 2007. It is composed of nine women who belong to the same church community. They see each other at parish activities. They run small businesses and raise pigs. The group is part of the Banc Villageois of the Association of Catholic Women of Sainte Thérèse.

Mrs. ÉMILIE C. (standing at the far left of the photo) is the group leader. She is 39 years old, married, and the mother of four children. She runs a small business selling biscuits and dairy products. She started this activity long before she became a member of the Banc Villageois. Her new loan will allow her to better develop her activity and boost her revenue.

Her goal is to help feed the family while increasing her savings with the Banc Villageois.

loans.use: To develop and promote her small business activity

loans.name: Christina

texts.en: K. is currently in a business of selling items like sugar. She is 35 years old and married to a businessman. She has no children. She hopes to expand her business with extra profits in the future.

loans.use: To stock more items like sugar to sell.

loans.name: Kodjo

texts.fr: Monsieur  Kodjo  a  46 ans et  père  de  2  enfants.    IL est   marié   et  habite  quartier  Attiégou.  Il  est  photographe  de  profession mais  il a associé  la  vente  des  cadres photographiques.  Il      a  commencé  son  activité  en  1994 et  a  son  atelier  à  côté du  collège  d’aéroport.  Il  achète  ces  matériaux  à Hedzranawoé.  Il  sollicite  un crédit  au  près  de  Wages  pour  se  réapprovisionner.
texts.en: Mr. Kodjo is 46 years old and the father of two children. He is married and lives in the Attiégou. He is a photographer by profession, but in addition he also sells frames for photographs. He has launched this business in 1994, and his studio is located next to the high school by the airport. He purchases his  supplies  in Hedzranawoé. He is seeking a loan from WAGES in order to replenish his stock.

loans.use: Purchasing photographic supplies

loans.name: Poni

texts.en: Poni is currently in a business of selling food in a hotel. She is 25 years old, married to a soldier, and has three children, all of whom go to school. Poni took out a loan to stock more food to sell in the hotel. In the future, she hopes to build a house for rent with extra profits from her business.

loans.use: To stock more food to sell.

loans.name: Abau

texts.en: Abau is currently in a business of selling tea. She is 18 years old and single. Abau took out a loan to stock more tea to sell. In the future, she hopes to build a house for rent with extra profits from her business.

loans.use: To stock more tea to sell.

loans.name: Poni

texts.en: R. is currently in a business of selling greens. She is 32 years old and married to a water distributor. She has four children and all of them go to school. R. took out a loan to stock more greens to sell. In the future, she hopes to build a house for rent with extra profits from her business.

loans.use: To stock more greens to sell.

loans.name: Henry

texts.en: Henry is a 36-year-old married man.  He is blessed with three children who go to school.  For a living, he sells shoes.  He has been in the business for almost four years.  He has witnessed a lot of growth in his business since he joined Faulu Kenya.  He hopes to expand his business into wholesale in the future.  He also dreams of opening other outlets for his business.  He has requested 30,000 KES to add to his stock of shoes.

loans.use: To add to his stock of shoes

loans.name: Sainte Bernadette Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité SAINTE BERNADETTE est créé le 04 décembre 2007. Il est constitué de 11 femmes qui sont de la même communauté Ecclésiale. Elles font partie du de l'association des femmes Catholiques de Saint Thérèse. Leur principale activité est le petit commerce et l'élevage de porcs

Madame AWA S. (debout à droite de la photo) est responsable du groupe. Elle est mariée et mère de 07 enfants en charge. 

Elle est détentrice d'une cantine à domicile. Elle y vend des produits alimentaires. Elle pratique cette activité depuis 04 ans.

Son nouveau crédit lui permettra de renforcer son approvisionnement en marchandises afin d'accroitre ses revenus financiers pour mieux répondre aux besoins familiaux. 

Son objectif est de soutenir son mari pour la prise en charge des besoins familiaux et le payement des frais scolaires des enfants.
texts.en: The ST BERNADETTE solidarity group was created on December 4, 2007. It consists of 11 women who are from the same church community. They belong to the Catholic Women's Association of St. Theresa. Their main activities are small businesses and raising pigs. The group members belong to the CEB of St. Theresa parish and are members of the Association of Catholic Women. They are engaged in small trade and raising pigs. The group was created on 04/12/2007. Mrs. AWA BA, standing at the right in the photo, is the leader of the group. She is married and the mother of seven dependent children.  She operates a canteen in her home where she sells food products. She has operated this business for 4 years. Her new loan will enable her to expand her inventory of merchandise so that she can increase her income to better meet the family's needs. Her goal is to help her husband take care of the family's needs and pay for the children's school fees.

loans.use: To stock up on merchandise for her canteen.

loans.name: Achan

texts.en:
Achan sells alcohol.  She is 45 years old, married, with nine children.  Four of them go to school. 

Achan needs a loan to stock more alcohol to sell.  She hopes to build a house to rent to others, with the extra profits from her business.

loans.use: stock more alcohol to sell.

loans.name: Eliud

texts.en:
Eliud is 30 years old, married and blessed with a three-year-old child.   He sells second-hand clothes and vehicle spare parts to earn a living.  He has been in business for seven years and has two employees on his payroll.

He hopes to add more stock to sell to increase his earnings.   Eliud is asking for a loan of 30,000 Kes to buy more clothes and spare parts.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and spare parts

loans.name: Mayeser

texts.en:
Mayeser H. is currently in the business of selling charcoal. She is 25 years old and married with three children. Two of them go to school. 

H. borrowed a loan to stock more charcoal to sell. She hopes to pay her children in school with extra profits from her business in the future.

loans.use: To stock more charcoal to sell

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter N. K. is 30 years old, married and the father of one. 

He sells vehicle spare parts for a living. He also does poultry farming for extra income.  

He has been able to grow his business through Faulu Kenya because he has learned new business ideas. He has also been saving his money with a group in Faulu Kenya.  

He hopes to open another branch for his business. He has requested 20,000 KES to buy more spare parts.

loans.use: To buy more spare parts

loans.name: Tehmina

texts.en:
Tehmina G. is 36 years old. She lives in Vanadzor city with her husband and her two children, who attend school.
 
Tehmina has engaged in the clothes trading business for over seven years. She rents a stall where she trades blouses, sweaters, dresses, tracksuits, jackets, etc. 

Tehmina buys merchandise from Yerevan twice or thrice a month and sells it in Vanadzor city, and thus she solves part of her family's needs. 

Tehmina is seeking an 800,000 AMD loan to buy spring season clothes to resell.

loans.use: To buy spring season clothes to resell

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy W. G. is 28 years old and the mother of two. Being the breadwinner in her family, she works hard in her tailoring business. She is able to provide basic needs for her family including educating her children.  

She has been trained in business management by Faulu Kenya and this has helped her to improve her business. She hopes to open a boutique in the future.  

She has requested 20,000 KES to buy a sewing machine.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Hozana Development Group-Kayunga

texts.en:
Ruth T., 45, is a member of this Hozana Development Group-Kayunga loan. She has been plying her retail shop business in Msotoka-Kayunga district for 15 years. Ruth was all this while also engaged in an agricultural business. This business has been growing steadily owing to her diligence, tenacity and perseverance.

Ruth, a happy go lucky, amiable and high-spirited mother of five, says she is going to use this Kiva loan to purchase more general merchandise retail stock to resell.

loans.use: To purchase more general merchandise retail stock to resell

loans.name: Anyeri

texts.en: Anyeri is currently in the business of selling fish. She is 45 years old, married, with 3 children and all of them go to school. Anyeri borrowed a loan to stock more fish to sell. She hopes to pay for her children's school fees with the extra profits from her business in the future.

loans.use: To stock more fish to sell

loans.name: Mere Theresa Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité MÈRE THERESA est créé le 15 décembre 2009 au 5ème cycle du Banc Villageois. Il est composé de 11 femmes qui sont de la même communauté Ecclésiale. Leur activité c'est le petit commerce, l'élevage de porcs. Le groupe fait partie du Banc Villageois des femmes Catholiques de Sainte Thérèse.

Madame GHISLAINE N. (debout à droite de la photo) est responsable du groupe. Elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants. Elle a aussi la charge de trois autres personne de sa belle famille.

Elle fait un petit commerce de chaussures et d'écharpes. Elle s'approvisionne à Dakar (capitale du Sénégal) pour revendre dans son quartier.

Son objectif est d'appuyer son mari dans la gestion de la famille (par exemple la nourriture, la sante. Elle veut aussi renforcer son épargne pour faire des investissements pour sa famille.
texts.en: The MOTHER THERESA solidarity group was created  on December 15, 2009 during the 5th cycle of the Banc Villageois. It is composed of 11 women who are from the same church community. They are engaged in small businesses and raising pigs. The group belongs to the Banc Villageois of St. Theresa Catholic Women. Mrs. GHISLAINE N., standing at the right in the photo, is the leader of the group. She is married and the mother of three children. She is also responsible for three other in-laws. She has a small business selling shoes and scarves. She gets her supplies in Dakar (Senegal's capital) to sell in her neighborhood. Her goal is to help her husband take care of the family (for example, food and health care). She also wants to bolster her savings to make investments for her family.

loans.use: To buy shoes and scarves

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 29-year-old single man living with his parents and three siblings. He is from Lebanon. He has built up a good experience working in floor covering for 7 years. And in 2005, he started working with multiple construction projects on a freelance basis. This man helps his father to cover the family expenses.

 Today, he is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.al to increase his business capital and invest in purchasing a paving cutter and other new tools needed in order to continue expansion of his business and to further increase his productivity. He expects that his business will continue to be successful in the coming year.

loans.use: purchasing paving cutter and other new tools

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “PATRON SAN SEBASTIAN”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac, provincia de Cusco, Departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Nancy; La socia tiene 46 años de edad, la socia es casada,  la socia tiene 4  hijos y ella es profesora de profesión, la socia trabaja en el poblado de Ocongate a 3 horas y media de la ciudad del Cusco. La socia viaja los domingos por la noche a Ocongate  y retorna los días viernes  por la tarde, ella es docente de primaria y está a cargo de toda la primaria de una escuela fiscal en el poblado, la socia desea el crédito para poder refaccionar su vivienda, en estos meses la lluvia a remojado los cimientos y también las tejas han cedido, ahora que la socia se encuentra de vacaciones escolares, ella desea refaccionar su vivienda antes de volver al trabajo y no tener tiempo, ella desea dejar bien su vivienda para que sus hijos que están estudiando en el colegio y en la universidad no estén afligidos por esto. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la refacción de su vivienda.

La socia está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Nancy is a member of the community bank "Patron San Sebastian", located in the Huanchac district in the province of Cusco.  She is 46 years old, married, has four children, and works as a teacher.  She works in the town of Ocongate, about three and a half hours from the city of Cusco.  She travels to Ocongate on Sunday nights and returns on Friday afternoons.  She teaches primary school and is also in charge of the whole primary school in a public school in the town.  

She is asking for this loan to renovate her home.  In the last few months, the rain has soaked the foundation and the tiles have worn down.  It is now school vacation time, so Nancy would like to remodel her home before she returns to work and no longer has time.  She would like to leave her home nice so that her children who are in high school and college won't be affected badly by it.  Nancy is asking for this loan to invest in the renovation of her home.

She is happy with the loan given and she promises to make all of her payments on time.

loans.use: Home renovations: improve the foundation and replace worn tiles

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 29-year-old married woman living with her husband and two young children. She is from Lebanon. She has been working as a tailor out of her house since 2004. She is well known by the members of her town and she has a good business reputation. She cooperates with her husband to satisfy the family's needs.

Today, she is requesting to borrow $700 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to invest in purchasing new textile collections in addition of tailoring tools to increase her sales and thus her income. This will be her third Kiva loan.

loans.use: purchasing new textiles and tailoring tools

loans.name: Monica

texts.en: Monica is 34 years old, married and has three school-aged children.  She sells vegetables and fruits to earn a living.  She has seen a lot of improvement in her business since she joined Faulu Kenya.  This is because she previously used a loan from Faulu Kenya to boost her business.  She is looking forward to stabilizing her business, and she has requested another loan of 20,000 kes to buy potatoes and onions.

loans.use: To buy potatoes and onions

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 51-year-old married man and has 3 children. He is from Lebanon. He has been working in car painting since 1995. He has chosen this occupation because it is a good business market. His work consists in repainting cars and delivering them to customers with excellent outside looks. He is thankful for his business income because he is able to provide a good living conditions to his family in addition to paying for his children's schooling. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $2000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to renew his tools and improve his business. He is confident that his work will continue to be successful in the future.

loans.use: to renew his tools

loans.name: Benson

texts.en: Benson is 34 years old, married and a father of one.  For four years, he has been selling roasted maize.  Previously, he farmed.  He joined Double Vision group in Faulu Kenya after being introduced by a friend.  Since then, he has improved his business and living standards.  He has been guaranteed a loan of 20,000 kes by his group members.  With the loan, he will buy additional maize for roasting.

loans.use: To buy more maize for roasting

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “PATRON SAN SEBASTIAN”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac, provincia de Cusco, Departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Maribel; La socia tiene 33 años de edad, la socia es casada,  la socia tiene 1 hijo de 5 años de edad; la socia es representante de ventas, trabaja en la empresa Henkel Peruana, La socia en esta ocasión invertirá el préstamo en mejorar su vivienda, ella desea comprar algunos muebles y también nos comenta que le gusta formar parte de este grupo y tiene grandes amigos y amigas dentro de este y es un grupo bien organizado y con muchas ganas de salir adelante y crecer. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en su vivienda.

La socia está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Maribel is a member of the community bank "Patron San Sebastian", located in the Huanchac district in the province and department of Cusco.  She is 33 years old, married, and has one child who is five years old.  She works as a sales representative at Henkel Peruana.  

She will invest this loan in improving her home.  She would like to purchase more furniture.  She also commented that she likes to be part of this group because she has many good friends and it is a well organized group that is interested in getting ahead and growing.  Maribel is asking for this loan to invest in her home.

Maribel is happy with the loan provided and promises to make all of her payments on time.

loans.use: Purchase furniture to improve her home

loans.name: Sainte Jeanne D'arc Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité SAINTE JEANNE D'ARC est créé le 15 juillet 2010 au 6ème cycle du Banc Villageois. Il est composé de 10 femmes qui sont de la même communauté Ecclésiale. L'activité principale du groupe est le petit commerce et l'élevage de porcs/ Le groupe fait partie du Banc Villageois des femmes catholiques de Sainte Thérèse. 

Madame Élisabeth S. (debout à l'extrême gauche de la photo, emmitouflée d'un pagne) est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 40 ans. Elle est veuve et mère de 06 enfants. Elle a aussi la charge de trois enfants de son frère.

Elle fait du petit commerce d'huile de palme et de beignets. Elle mène cette activité depuis longtemps, bien avant qu'elle ne soit membre du groupe. 

Son nouveau crédit lui permettra d'augmenter son niveau de production en renforçant son activité

Son objectif est de prendre en charge les besoins de sa progéniture et ceux des enfants qui lui sont confiés. Et de renforcer son niveau d'épargne dans le Banc Villageois
texts.en:
The SAINTE JEANNE D'ARC solidarity group was created on July 15, 2010 in the 6th cycle of the Banc Villageois of the Catholic Women of Sainte Thérèse, to which it belongs. It is composed of ten women from the same church community. The group's main activities are small trade and raising pigs. 

Mrs. Élizabeth S. (standing at the far left of the picture and wrapped in a pagne) is the leader of the group. She is 40 years old, a widow, and the mother of six children. She is also responsible for three other children entrusted to her care by her brother. She sells palm oil and beignets. She started this activity long before she became a member of the solidarity group. 

Her new loan will allow her to boost production by strengthening her business. Her goals are to provide for all the children in her care, and to increase her savings at the Banc Villageois.

loans.use: Buying palm oil and flour to make beignets

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 19-year-old single woman living with her parents. She is from Lebanon. She has been working as a beautician since 2008. Her business is based out of her home and she also works as a traveling beautician. Her work is very important because she helps her mother with the family expenses. 

Today, she is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to invest in more materials for her work; she will purchase a new cosmetics collection. In the future, she is planning to open a formal beauty salon in order to expand her business level.

loans.use: purchase new cosmetics collection

loans.name: Carlos Gonzalo

texts.es:
Carlos Gonzalo B. F. es un joven de 23 años que vive con su Madre en la zona Oeste de la ciudad de Cochabamba.  En el Barrio conocido como Capacachi. Carlos es Bachiller y actualmente estudia para tripulante de vuelo. Carlos es soltero. Como manera de poder pagarse los cursos para tripulante de vuelo Carlos se dedica a la compra y venta de repuestos de Computadora esta actividad la inicio como hobby y ahora son más de 3 años que realiza la misma.

Carlos necesita el crédito Capital de Operación para Comercio y de esta manera poder comprar mayor cantidad de repuestos ya que la Demanda para los mismos está muy elevada porque es mucha más común ahora que una gran mayoría tenga computadora. Carlos desea poder finalizar su carrera como tripulante de Vuelo que es su mayor sueño y luego ganar lo suficiente para poder mantener tanto a su persona como a su Mama.
texts.en:
Carlos Gonzalo B. F. is 23 years old, and lives with his mother in the western area of the city of Cochabamba in the neighborhood known as Capacachi.  Carlos has a bachelor's degree and is currently studying to be a flight crew member.    He is single.  In order to pay for his flight crew courses, Carlos buys and sells spare computer parts.  He began doing this as a hobby and has been doing it for three years.

Carlos is asking for this loan to use as operating capital for his business so that he can purchase a larger quantity of computer parts.  The demand for parts is very high because it more common for a majority of people to own a computer. 

Carlos wants to finish his studies to become a flight crew member because it is his dream and he would be able to earn enough money to support himself and his mother.

loans.use: Purchase computer parts

loans.name: Elijah

texts.en: Elijah is 37 years old and married with two children. He runs a hardware shop and also does poultry farming to earn more income. His business is only one year old. Elijah hopes to grow his business ten times bigger. He is also determined to set up other outlets for his business. He is asking for a loan of 20,000 KES to buy nails and wheelbarrows.

loans.use: To buy nails and wheelbarrows

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 20-year-old single woman from Lebanon. She lives with her parents and four siblings. She has been running a clothing store since 2009. She also sells accessories from her store. Her business income is vital to support her family. 

Today, she is requesting a loan of $1200 from Kiva's partner, Ameen s.a.l., to expand her store’s inventory. She says that the loan will help her diversify her merchandise selection. In the future, she is hoping to also sell shoes from her store. Currently, she mostly sells clothes.

loans.use: To expand her store’s inventory

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is 38 years old, married and a father of four. He has operated a matatu (van) transport business for two years and employs one person. He also does farming to earn extra income. John hopes to own two more vans in five years' time. He joined Kiva partner, Faulu Kenya, to easily access financial resources. He has therefore requested a loan of 20,000 KES to repair his van.

loans.use: To repair his van

loans.name: Maria Jesusa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “PATRON SAN SEBASTIAN”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito D. Huanchac, provincia D. Cusco, Departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Maria; La socia tiene 1956 años D. edad, la socia es casada,  la socia tiene 4 hijos y todos son independientes, la socia antes se dedicaba al cuidado D. su nieto y ahora ella y su familia incursionaran el un nuevo proyecto, ellos comprarán pollos 200 apara empezar e iniciaran la crianza D. estas aves D. corral, la socia tiene mucha fe en que todo le irá muy bien y pronto estarán aumentando más pollos y así creciendo el negocio familiar, la socia conocedora D. la crianza D. pequeñas aves D. corral, sabe y tiene la pasión para hacerlo y apoyar a la familia en este proyecto, La socia desea invertir el préstamo en la compra D. pollos. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra D. 200 pollos.

La socia está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the “PATRON SAN SEBASTIAN communal bank. The bank is located in the Huanchac district, Cusco province and department. 

The member‘s name is Maria. She is 54 years old, married and she has four independent children. In the past, Maria took care of her grandson. Now she and her family want to start a new project. They will buy 200 chickens to start breeding poultry.  Maria has lots of faith in this project and soon they will add more chickens in order to expand the family business. The member is the expert on the small birds. She knows how to take care of them and she has the passion for this and for supporting her family in this project. Maria wants to invest the money in the purchase of chickens. She is requesting the loan to invest in the purchase of 200 chickens. 

The member is happy about the granted loan and she promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase 200 chickens

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 47-year-old married man and the father of five school-age children. He has been working as a mechanic for the past 10 years. In 2005, he opened his own car repair shop and he is specialized in repairing vehicle’s bodies and engines. He is the only income source for his family. He has taken advantage of a first Kiva loan and he has been a reliable client paying on his scheduled dates. 

Today, he is requesting to a loan of $2000 from Kiva's partner, Ameen s.a.l,. to purchase additional tools for his business. In the future, he is planning to open a bigger store to trade and sell car spare parts.

loans.use: To purchase additional tools for his business

loans.name: El Triunfo Group

texts.es:
El grupo el Triunfo lo conforman tres féminas trabajadoras una de ellas es Josefa Dolores Lopez Muños  de 33 años quien se dedica a la realización y venta de nacatamales y pan. Ella al inicio no sabía cómo realizar los nacatamales pero poco a poco fue aprendiendo.
L. con el crédito comprara materiales ya que con lo que realiza no ha justa para la demanda que tiene.
Los otros integrantes de grupo son Olga María G. quien desde hace 20 años se dedica a la venta de leña y carne rubro en el que está iniciando y Isabel G. se dedica al comercio de leña y Tortilla.
texts.en:
The group "El Triunfo" [The Triumph] is made up of three hardworking women.  One of them is Josefa Dolores Lopez Muños, 33 years old, who sells nacatamales and bread.   When she began, she didn't know how to make nacatamales, but she learned as she went.  

Ms. Lopez will use the loan to buy ingredients, since what she has doesn't meet the demand.  

The other members of the group are Olga Maria G., who for 20 years has sold firewood and meat.  In the same line of work, Isabel G. is beginning to sell firewood and tortillas.

loans.use: Pork, corn

loans.name: Claudia Margarita

texts.es: La Señora Claudia Margarita tiene 28 años. Es madre de 2 hijos y están bajo su cargo. La actividad económica es la venta de cosméticos. Hace más de 4 años que se dedica a este negocio. Claudia es una persona muy responsable y siempre ha cumplido con la obligación de madre, la vivienda de Claudia es la más humilde de su comunidad. Es por eso que decide incursionar en este negocio para mejorar las condiciones de vida para su familia. El dinero que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de perfumes, cremas y cosméticos. El sueño más grande de Claudia es mejorar la condición económica de su familia y salir adelante con su negocio.
texts.en:
Claudia Margarita is 28 years old and has two children.  She has worked selling cosmetics for more than four years.  Claudia is a very responsible person and she has always met her obligations as a mother.  Claudia's home is the most humble in the community.  She decided to start this business to improve the living conditions of her family.  

She is asking for this loan to purchase perfumes, creams, and cosmetics.  

Claudia's dream is to improve the economic condition of her family and succeed with her business.

loans.use: Purchase perfumes, creams, and cosmetics.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “PATRON SAN SEBASTIAN”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito D. Huanchac, provincia D. Cusco, Departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Ana; La socia tiene 52 años D. edad, la socia es casada,  la socia tiene 4 hijos, la socia tiene una tienda D. venta D. ropa para bebes en el centro comercial Cusco, la socia venD. todo el ajuar para bebes, desD. cunas, ropones, juguetes, cubiertos, zapatos, chupones, casacas, álbum D. fotos, edredones, almohaditas, lámparas, cómodas, y todo lo relacionado al bebes y niños entre los primeros años D. sus vidas. La socia trabaja con el crédito D. los bancos comunales invirtiéndolos en capital D. trabajo, ella viaja a Lima la capital del Perú a traer novedades y también va a diferentes departamentos para poder traer regalos y accesorios para bebes y niños, la socia  se mantiene siempre actualizada con la ropa para bebes y es muy divertido y lindo recorrer su tienda y ver cada detalle. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra D. ropa para bebes.

La socia está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The loan recipient belongs to the village bank "Patron San Sebastian".  The bank is located in the district of Huanchac, in the province and department of Cusco.  

Ana is 52 years old, married with 4 children.  She has a store where she sells baby clothes in the business district in Cusco.  She sells all kinds of furnishings for babies including cribs, dressers, toys, quilts, shoes, bottles, jackets, photo albums, comforters, pillows, lamps, and everything related to babies and children in their first years of life.  She invests the loans from the village banks in work capital.  She travels to Lima, the capital of Peru, to bring back items and she also goes to different states to be able to bring gifts and accessories for infants and children.  She always has the latest baby clothes and it's a lot of fun to look through her store and note all the details.  She would like to use this loan to buy baby clothes. 

The recipient is happy with the loan she has been presented and promises to make the payments in the established time frame.

loans.use: To buy baby clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase new tools and a painting compressor

loans.name: Los Plata Group

texts.es:
El grupo los P. lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras una de ellas es la señora María Lourdes S. P. de 28 años quien desde muy pequeña junto con su mamá se dedica al comercio de candelas y veladoras por más de 12 años.   
Ella tiene la meta de terminar su carrera en Caja y Finanzas y poder terminar su cuarto por lo que ya compro los materiales pero necesita ahorrar para poder poner la mano de obra. 

Los otros integrantes son Reynaldo José P. de 70 años quien compra y vende ganado desde hace 36 años y Olga María P. quien vende de todo un poco.
texts.en:
The Los P. group is made up of three hard-working and enterprising people.  One of them is María Lourdes S. P., who is 28 years old.  Since she was a young girl, she has worked with her mother selling candles.  She has been doing this for more than 12 years.  

Her goals are to finish her degree in finance and be able to finish her room.  She has already purchased the materials but now needs to save for the labor costs.  

The other members of the group are Reynaldo José P., who is 70 years old and has bought and sold cattle for 36 years, and Olga María Baltodano who sells a little of everything.

loans.use: To Purchase Candles

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase cosmetics

loans.name: María Tomasa

texts.es:
María Tomasa P. es una mujer trabajadora, esforzada y emprendedora quien se dedica a la compra y venta de frutas y verduras. Ella inicio hace 25 años vendiendo naranjas y unos cuantos limones ahora tiene mejor surtido su negocio y cuenta con una trabajadora.
Ella tiene cinco hijos de 28, 22, 14, 12 y 6 años de los cuales los menores están a su cargo.
texts.en:
María Tomasa P. is a hard-working and enterprising woman who works buying and selling fruits and vegetables.  She began her business 25 years ago, selling oranges and lemons.  Now she has a larger stock and has a worker.

She has five children who are 6, 12, 14, 22, and 28 years old.  The young ones are in her care.

loans.use: Purchase fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Eulalia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “PATRON SAN SEBASTIAN”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac, provincia de Cusco, Departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Eulalia; La socia tiene 41 años de edad, la socia es casada, la socia tiene 3 hijos (22,15,9); la socia trabaja realizando manualidades en el barrio de magisterio, el pertenece a  una casa taller en la cual realizan trabajos en base a tejidos en palitos y crochet, la socia también realiza trabajos en macramé, específicamente todo tipo de adornos y carteras. La socia desea comprar materiales y vender sus trabajos, ella desea a futuro independizarse y mostrar sus trabajos en ferias y que sus ingresos sean mayores para seguir apoyando a su familia. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de materiales para realizar trabajos en macramé y tejidos.

La socia está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank "Patrón San Sebastian", which is located in the Huanchac district, Cusco province, Cusco department.

The member is Eulalia, who is 41 years old and married with 3 children, who are 9, 15, and 22 years old.  She works making handcrafts in the Magisterio neighborhood.  She belongs to a workshop in which she makes items that are knitted on small sticks or crocheted.  She also does macramé work, specifically all kinds of decorations and bags.  She wants to buy materials and sell her items.  She wants to become independent in the future and show her items in fairs, and she wants her income to increase in order to continue supporting the family.  She is asking for the loan to invest in the purchase of materials to make macramé and knitted items.

She is happy with the loan granted to her and she is committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To purchase materials to make macramé and knitted items.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan is 31 years old, married and has two children aged seven and ten. She has been running a posho mill business for three years and employs one person to help her in her tasks. She was previously running a salon business. As a member of Kiva partner, Faulu Kenya, she has been trained in good customer care and as a result is able to attract more customers to her business. Susan is determined to grow her business so that she can earn a better income. She has requested a loan of 80,000 KES to buy maize.

loans.use: To buy maize

loans.name: Sorie

texts.en: This is 29-year-old Sorie. He is single, and has one child aged three. In 2008, Sorie established a provisions and drinks business. He says "I don't have to depend on anybody for assistance" as he believes that his business is the only way for him to earn money to develop his family. Sorie opens his business throughout the week and spends about 11 hours working in his business every day. He is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 SLL to buy more provisions such as milk, sugar, sardines, margarine and drinks. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately 400,000 SLL. In the future, Sorie plans to expand from a retail store to a wholesale store. He hope to give his child a sound education. Sorie thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more provisions for his shop

loans.name: Gbomuma Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Gbomuma” group. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Waterloo, a small town in western Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from Kiva partner, SMT. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve their standard of living.
The leader of this group is Fatmata K.. Fatmata was born in Kono, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. Currently, she is residing in Waterloo together with her husband and five children. Her husband is a security guard and her children are attending school. For 12 years now, Fatmata has been selling flour, groundnuts and caustic soda. She has requested a loan in order to expand her business by buying the above mentioned items in large quantities to add to her business.
Also shown on the left of the photo is loan officer Edna B. Conteh, handing over the loan to the borrowers.

loans.use: To buy flour, groundnuts and caustic soda in large quantities to add to her business

loans.name: Digno

texts.es: Digno José tiene 62 años, su actividad es la venta de mariscos. Hace más de 10 años. El es un hombre muy trabajador y responsable pues sabe que tiene hacerse cargo de sus 2 hijos menores de edad a su cargo. Por lo que además también sale a vender a la calle sus productos, el siempre está pendiente por proporcionarle a sus clientes lo que ellos le solicitan. Este negocio lo aprendió por su propia cuenta y fue por ahorros que tenía conservado que poco a poco fue ofreciendo. Es por eso que solicita este crédito para la compra de materia prima y ofrecer variedad.
texts.en: Digno José is 62 years old.  He has been in the business of selling seafood for over 10 years.  He is a hard-working and responsible man because he knows that he has to take care of the two minor children in his charge.  So he sells his products out on the street where he is always waiting to provide his customers with what they request.  He learned the business on his own and savings he had made it possible for him to gradually offer seafood to sell.  For this reason, he is requesting this loan to buy raw materials and offer a wider variety to his customers.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” JUNTAS Y UNIDAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Luisa; la socia tiene 43 años de edad, casada y tiene 3 hijos; la socia se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza como cremas, colonias, perfumes entre otros ella trabaja con las líneas Avon, Esika y Unique, la socia lleva ya un buen tiempo en este negocio el cual le trae satisfacciones tanto económicas como personales, la socia es una persona bien alegre y con muchas ganas de salir adelante.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de más productos para así tener más variedad que ofrecer a sus clientes.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Luisa is a member of the community bank "Juntas y Unidas" [Together and United], located in the Cusco district in the province and department of Cusco.  

She is 43 years old, married, and has three children.  She works selling beauty products like creams, colognes, and perfumes.  She works with brands like Avon, Esika, and Unique.  She has had a good time with this business, which has provided both personal and economic satisfaction for her.  She is a happy person with a drive to succeed.

Luisa is asking for this loan to purchase more products in order to have more variety to offer her customers.  

She is happy with the loan provided and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: Purchase beauty products like creams, colognes, and perfumes

loans.name: Yarling

texts.es:
Yarling del Rosario A. es una mujer trabajadora, esforzada y emprendedora quien se dedica al comercio de ropa de diferentes estilos en camisas, blusas, pantalones, Capri, chores… etc. en lo que invertirá el crédito.
Ella tiene tres hijos  dos gemelas de 19 años quienes están en la universidad y un niño de 11 que está en primaria. Su mayor sueño es que sus hijos salgan adelante y prosperar.
texts.en: Yarling del Rosario A. is a hardworking, entrepreneurial woman who sells different styles of clothing such as shirts, blouses, pants, capris, shorts, etc., which she will use the loan to buy.  She has three children, two 19-year-old twin girls who are in college, and one 11-year-old boy who is in primary school.  Her greatest dream is that her children move forward and prosper.

loans.use: For clothing

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” JUNTAS Y UNIDAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito D. Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia D. Cusco y departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Gregoria; la socia tiene 64 años D. edad, casada y tiene 4 hijos; la socia se dedica  al negocio D. tienda D. abarrotes ella venD. productos D. primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar y leche también venD. otro tipo D. productos como gaseosas, fideos, golosinas y mas, la socia lleva años en este negocio y se siente feliz ya que mediante este negocio ella saca a su familia adelante.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra D. mas productos para su tienda D. abarrotes.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos D. su cuota.
texts.en:
Gregoria is a member of the community bank "Juntas y Unidas" [Together and United], located in the Cusco district in the province and department of Cusco.

Gregoria is 64 years old, married, and has four children.  She owns a grocery store.  She sells necessities like rice, sugar, and milk.  She also sells other types of products like drinks, pasta, candies, and more.  She has had this store for many years, and she feels happy that it has helped her family succeed.  

She is asking for this loan to purchase more products for her grocery store.

She is happy with the loan provided and she promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: Purchase more products for her grocery store

loans.name: Primitivo

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “JUNTAS Y UNIDAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Primitivo; el tiene 52 años de edad y es casado y tiene 5 hijos; el socio alterna sus actividades diarias brindando el servicio de taxi el trabaja de lunes a domingo por las mañanas y tardes a veces sale por las noches pero son muy raras las veces que sale a esa hora, esta es la única actividad que realiza el socio por el momento y de esta forma el socio saca a su familia adelante.

El socio solicita el préstamo para la compra de llantas para su taxi.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos
texts.en:
Primitivo is a member of the communal bank Juntas Y Unidas (Together and United), located in the district of  Cusco, in the province of Cusco, Department of Cusco.  He is 52 years old, married, and has 5 children.

He works as a taxi driver from Monday to Sunday.  He alternates his activities daily, from working in the morning to working in the afternoon.  He also sometimes works at nights, though this is rare.  This is his only source of income at the moment, and the means by which he keeps his family ahead.

He is requesting the loan to buy tires for his taxi.  He promises to make all of the loan payments.

loans.use: To buy tires for his taxi.

loans.name: Kargbo Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “K.” group. They are small scale businesswomen based in Waterloo, a small town in Western Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve on their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Memuna K.. Memuna was born in the village of Sengo, but she is currently residing in Waterloo, together with her husband and five children. Her husband is a businessman, two of her children are attending primary school, and two are in secondary school. For twelve years now, Memuna has been selling firewood and charcoal. With this loan, she will buy firewood and charcoal in larger quantities to resell. 


(Pictured in the left of the photo is loan officer Edna B. Conteh, handing over the loan to the borrowers)

loans.use: To buy firewood and charcoal in larger quantities to sell

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” JUNTAS Y UNIDAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Victoria; la socia tiene 59 años de edad, soltera y tiene 4 hijos; la socia se dedica  al negocio de venta de cosméticos ella vende productos de belleza como perfumes, colonias, cremas entre otros mas, a la vez la socia teje a mano chompas para niños y adultos, la socia es una persona bien alegre y con muchas ganas de salir adelante.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de más productos de belleza y comprar hilos, lana de diferentes colores entre otros más.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Victoria is a member of the community bank "Juntas y Unidas" [Together and United], located in the Cusco district in the province and department of Cusco.

Victoria is 59 years old, single, and has four children.  She sells cosmetics.  She sells beauty products like perfumes, colognes, creams, and other products.  She also hand-knits sweaters for children and adults.  She is a happy person with a drive to succeed.

She is asking for this loan to purchase more beauty products and also to purchase thread and yarn in different colors.

She is happy with the loan provided and promises to make all of her payments on time.

loans.use: Purchase beauty products for a cosmetics sales business and yarn and thread for a knitting business.

loans.name: Dry Fish Sellers Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Dry Fish Sellers” group. They are small scale businesswomen based in Waterloo, a small town in Western Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve on their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Aminata L..  Aminata was born in Kenema, a city in Eastern Sierra Leone.  However, she is currently residing in Waterloo together with her husband and three children. Her husband is a soldier and her children are attending primary school. For twenty-two years now, Aminata has been selling palm-oil, margi (flavoring), onions, ogeri, etc. With this loan, she will buy the above mentioned items at wholesale prices to add to her business.

loans.use: To buy palm-oil, margi, onions, ogeri, etc. at wholesale prices

loans.name: Maria Norma

texts.es:
María tiene 34 años de edad, es casada y reside junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos en el caserío San Martín a 15 km del distrito de Tambogrande, un distrito agrícola que se encuentra situado en la región Piura, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la preparación y venta de comida. Ella prepara alimentos en su domicilio y los ofrece en venta a sus vecinos y personas que vienen a trabajar en la zona los días sábados, domingos y lunes, adicionalmente vende cerveza y chicha de jora los fines de semana. El negocio tiene una antigüedad de tres años, es de mucha ayuda para su familia, ya que por medio de este se encarga de ayudar al sostenimiento de su economía diaria.

María desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de insumos como harina, maíz, etc para elaborar la chicha de jora ya que la demanda por su negocio ha aumentado. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles con los cuales piensa lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
María is 34 years old.  She is married and lives with her husband and two children in the San Martín neighborhood 15km from the Tambogrande district, an agricultural area located in the Piura region, more than four hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital of the Lambayeque region.

Her business is preparing and selling food.  She prepares food at her home and sells it to her neighbors and people who come to the area to work on Saturdays, Sundays, and Mondays.  She also sells beer and chicha de jora (a fermented beverage made from corn) on the weekends.  The business is three years old, and it helps her family a lot, since through it she helps take care of the family's daily financial needs. 

María wants to increase her business with the purchase of supplies such as flour, corn, etc., to make the chicha de jora, since demand for her business has increased.  For this reason, she decided to ask Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1500 nuevos soles, with which she can achieve her goal.

loans.use: Purchase of supplies to make her products.

loans.name: Nuevo Horizonte Group

texts.es:
El grupo Nuevo Horizonte está conformado por tres personas trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras una de ellas es la señora Adriana de 38 años propietaria de un taller de costura. En 1993 con una máquina de coser inicio su taller en el que solo realizaba camisas y chores en la actualidad junto a su marido quien es sastre se especializaron en pantalones, faldas y camisas, cuenta con 5 máquinas de coser y con la ayuda de sus hijos mayores.
Ella tiene cuatro hijos de 19, 18, 17 y 15 años de los cuales los dos menores estudian. 
Los otros integrantes son María de 60 años quien tiene una pequeña venta y realiza nacatamales y José Marí de 58 años es agricultor y se dedica a la compra y venta de frutas.
texts.en:
The Nuevo Horizone (New Horizon) group is comprised of three hard-working, dedicated, and enterprising people.  

Adriana is one of them.  She is the 38 year old owner of a seamstress shop.  She started her shop in 1993 with one sewing machine.  She only made shirts and shorts.  Now, she works with her husband who is a tailor.  They specialize in pants, skirts, and shirts.  They have five sewing machines, and their older children help them.  She has four children; ages 19, 18, 17, and 15.  The two youngest go to school.

Another member is María.  She is 60 years old, and she has a small business selling “nacatamales” (steamed meat and vegetable pastry, cooked in banana or maize leaves).  The other member is 58 year old José Marío.  He is a farmer, and he buys and sells fruits.

loans.use: Fabric

loans.name: Ninoska Elena

texts.es: Ninoska Elena tiene 47 años, este es el primer financiamiento que ha solicitado con Fundación pues por la responsabilidad del pago de sus cuotas. Esta emprendedora Señora tiene más 3 años de tener este negocio, ella se dedica a la venta de nacatamales y los derivados del cerdo, ella tiene muchos clientes que le solicitan una gran variedad de productos. Actualmente solicita este crédito para la compra de cerdos pues tiene que recorrer diferentes lugares. Su deseo es mejorar la calidad de sus productos.
texts.en:
Ninoska Elena is 47 years old and this is her first loan with the Foundation for the responsibility for the payment of her installments.  She is enterprising.  She has had her business for more than three years.  She sells tamales and other pork products.  She has many customers who order a variety of products.

She is asking for this loan to purchase pigs since she has to travel to different places.  She wants to improve the quality of her products.

loans.use: Purchase pigs

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.es: María de los Ángeles se dedica a una pulpería. Tiene más de 11 años en este negocio, pues no ha sido la primera vez que solicita estos financiamientos. Con la buena administración que obtiene ha podido salir adelante. Tiene una gran variedad de clientes que le solicitan diferentes productos, Maria recorre ciertos mercados para llevar los productos. es con este medio de vida que ha podido proporcionarle a sus 4 hijos lo necesario. El financiamiento es para la compra de golosinas, refrescos, pan, detergente, granos básicos entre otros.
texts.en:
María de los Ángeles runs a small convenience store.  She has been doing this for more than 11 years, and this is not the first time that she has requested a loan.  With the good administration that she gets, she has been able to move ahead.  She has a great variety of customers that ask for different products.  Maria goes to certain markets to bring back the requested products.  Through this way of life, she has been able to give her 4 children what they need.  

This loan is to buy snacks, sodas, bread, laundry detergent, basic grains and other such things.

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: God Bless Group

texts.en:
Mariatu K. is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Mariatu was born in Waterloo,a small town near Freetown. She is married to a gardener and the couple has three children who are attending primary school.
