For twenty-three years now, Mariatu has been selling palm-oil, pepper, garden eggs (similar to eggplant), etc. 

This is the first loan that Mariatu and her group members have applied for from SMT/Kiva. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions. Mariatu will use her share of the loan (500,000 SLL) to expand her business. She will buy palm-oil, pepper, garden eggs and more at wholesale prices to add to her current stock. 

(Also included in the left of the photo is loan officer Edna B. Conteh, handing over the loan to the borrowers).

loans.use: To buy palm-oil, pepper, garden eggs(eggplant), etc. at wholesale prices

loans.name: Pedro Celestino

texts.es: El Señor Pedro Celestino tiene 52 años. Su actividad económica es la venta y compra de ganado. El negocio consiste en comprar y vender ganado, el realiza sus compras en comunidades por lo que es aquí donde le resulta mucho más favorable para proporcionarle a su familia el pan de cada día. Los financiamientos siempre han sido utilizados para invertirlos en su negocio. Sus inicios se dan por no tener ingresos suficientes y así poco a poco fue logrando comprar vacas, toros y ternero y tener su propio negocio. La situación más difícil es que no tenía suficiente animales para ofrecer pero con loa financiamientos salió adelante. El financiamiento que actualmente solicita es para la compra de más ganado. Su deseo es expandir su negocio para salir adelante.
texts.en: Pedro Celestino is 52 years old.  He has a business buying and selling livestock.  He makes his purchases in communities where get gets the most favorable prices, so that he can provide for the daily needs of his family.  The loans that he has taken have always been used to invest in his business.  At the beginning he did not have enough income, but gradually he was able to buy cows, bulls and calves and have his own business.  The most difficult situation was when he didn't have enough animals to sell, but with the financings he was able to overcome this problem and get ahead.  The loan that he currently requests will be used to buy more livestock.  His wish is to expand his business so that he can improve his economic situation.

loans.use: working capital to buy livestock

loans.name: Real Friends Group

texts.en:
Jeneba A. is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Jeneba was born in Kenema, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. Jeneba’s husband is retired and her three children attend primary school. Jeneba sells soft drinks, gara lappers (locally dyed clothes) and charcoal. She has been running this business for six years now. 

This is the first loan that Jeneba and her group members have applied for from SMT/Kiva. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions. Jeneba will use her share of the loan (500,000 SLL) to expand her business. She will buy the above mentioned items in large quantities to add to her business. 

(Also included at the left of the photo is loan officer Edna B. Conteh, handing over the loan to the borrowers).

loans.use: Buys soft drinks, gara lappers (dyed clothes) and charcoal

loans.name: Karin Pilar

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” JUNTAS Y UNIDAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Karin Pilar; la socia tiene 36 años de edad, casada y tiene 2 hijos; la socia se dedica la venta de material de construcción como ladrillos entre otros más, la socia lleva ya un buen tiempo en este negocio ella trabaja conjuntamente con su esposo, la socia es una persona bien alegre y con muchas ganas de salir adelante.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de más material de construcción para su negocio.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Karin Pilar is a member of the community bank "Juntas y Unidas" [Together and United], located in the Cusco district in the province and department of Cusco.

Karin Pilar is 36 years old, married, and has two children.  She sells construction materials, like bricks and other items.  She has worked at this business for a long time, and she works with her husband.  She is a happy person with a drive to succeed.

She is asking for this loan to purchase more construction materials for her business.

She is happy with the loan provided and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: Purchase construction materials

loans.name: Njong

texts.en:
G. was born in 1960. She is married and has four children. She has struggled with hardship in her life. Growing up, her family was very poor and could neither pay for her education nor send her to learn a trade. The situation became worse when her father, who worked odd jobs to support the family, passed away. G. was married young and has spent most of her life farming. 

In 2009 she became a member of GHAPE and was trained on how to manage a loan and a business. She has been able to manage a single loan and has learned how to sell palm oil; raise animals such as pigs and fowl; and farm crops such as cassava. The profits from these loans were used to educate her children, buy clothing for the family, and provide for the basic household needs like fish and magi (a flavor cube used in all Cameroonian cooking).

Given this loan, G. plans to expand all her activities: farming cassava, raising pigs and fowl, and buying and selling palm oil. She says her business is going to succeed because she has been farming since the age of five when her parents began to teach her.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To expand agricultural business

loans.name: Nerida

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” JUNTAS Y UNIDAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Nerida; la socia tiene 39 años de edad, casada y tiene 3 hijos; la socia se dedica  a la venta de artesanía como chompas, gorros, guantes, pantalones, polos entre otros más, la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual se encuentra ubicado en el centro del cusco en una de las av. Mas importantes como es la Av.Sol, la socia está contenta con este negocio ya que mediante este ella saca su familia adelante.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de más mercadería para su negocio y así tener más variedad de productos que ofrecer a sus clientes.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Nerida is a member of the “Juntas y Unidas” (Together and United) communal bank.  The bank is located in the Cusco district, Cusco province, Cusco department.

Nerida is 39 years old, married, and has three children.  She sells hand-made items like sweaters, hats, gloves, pants, polo style shirts, and many others.  She has been in this business for years.  The business is located on one of the most important avenues, like Avenida Sol, in the center of Cusco.  She is happy with the business because it is through the business that she gets her family ahead.

She is requesting a loan to buy more merchandise for her business.  That way she will have a greater variety of products to offer her customers.  She is happy about the loan, and she pledges to make her payments on time.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise in order to have a greater variety to offer her customers

loans.name: Aidalina Esmeralda

texts.es:
Aidalina Esmeralda M. es una mujer trabajadora, esforzada y emprendedora quien tiene una repostería desde hace varios años. Ella realiza desde tortas, pasteles, bocadillos, pan, pico etc. 
M. con el crédito comprará un horno más grande que les permitirá realizar mejor su trabajo en especial los pasteles.
texts.en:
Aidalina Esmeralda M. is a hard-working and enterprising woman who has owned a bakery for a few years.  She makes cakes, pastries, sandwiches, bread, and other items.

With this loan, Aidalina would like to purchase a larger oven that will allow her to do her work better.

loans.use: To buy an oven

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” JUNTAS Y UNIDAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Luz Marina; la socia tiene 39 años de edad, casada y tiene 3 hijos; la socia se dedica  al negocio de turismo ella tiene ya hace varios años atrás su Agencia de Viajes el cual brinda el servicio de Turismo de Aventura brindando las siguientes rutas : Camino Inca, Salkantay, Choquequirao entre otras rutas más, la socia es una persona bien alegre y entusiasta, mediante su empresa la socia saca a su familia adelante y esto es algo que le hace sentir bien ya que su familia es el motivo que ella tiene para seguir adelante.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la renovación de nuevos equipos de aventura.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the “Juntas y Unidas” [Together and United] communal bank. The bank is located in the district of Cusco, which belongs to the province of Cusco and the the department of Cusco. 

The member is Luz Marina. She is 39 years old, is married, and has 3 children. She works in tourism and has had her own travel agency for several years. Her travel agency provides adventure tourism service on the following routes: the Inca Trail, Salkantay, and Choquequirao, among others. Luz Marina is very cheerful and enthusiastic. This business allows her to provide for her family, which makes her feel good because her family is her motivation. 

She is requesting the loan to purchase new adventure equipment. She is very pleased by the loan and she promises to make her repayments

loans.use: To purchase new adventure tourism equipment

loans.name: Hope To God 1V Group

texts.en:
Mabinty K. is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Mabinty was born in the village of Foredugu. She is married to a driver and the couple has two children. Mabinty has had many years of experience in selling cooked rice. 

This is the first loan that she and her group members have applied for from SMT/Kiva. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions. Mabinty will use her share of the loan (500,000 SLL) to expand her cooked rice business. She will buy cooking materials like rice, palm-oil, onions, tomatoes, etc. in large quantities.

(Also included on the left of the photo is loan officer Edna B. Conteh, handing over the loan to the borrowers).

loans.use: To buy rice, palm-oil, onions, tomatoes, etc. in large quantities

loans.name: Rosario Angela

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “PATRON SAN SEBASTIAN”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac, provincia de Cusco, Departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Rosario; La socia tiene 60 años de edad, la socia es casada, la socia tiene 1 hijo; la socia tiene una agencia de viajes y ella se dedica a administrar su negocio, la agencia de la socia se llama Inversiones Viset Perú; la socia también alterna su trabajo y se dedica a la venta de ropa, la socia saca el préstamo para invertir en la compra de ropa para la venta.

La socia está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Rosario is a member of the community bank "Patron San Sebastian", located in the Huanchac district in the province and department of Cusco.  

Rosario is 60 years old, married, and has one child.  She owns a travel agency and she works to run her business.  Her travel agency is called Viset Perú.  In addition to the travel agency, she also sells clothing.  

She is asking for this loan in order to purchase clothing to sell.

She is happy with the loan provided and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: Purchase clothing to sell

loans.name: Raúl Harold

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “JUNTAS Y UNIDAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Raúl Harold; el tiene 38 años de edad y es casado y tiene 2 hijos; el socio tiene 2 negocios uno de ellos es un cabina de internet que está abierto todo el día de lunes a domingo el socio trabaja conjuntamente con su esposa, a la vez el socio cuenta con un carro que brinda el servicio de movilidad escolar el socio cuenta con la ayuda de una persona para realizar esta actividad, el socio es una persona bien alegre y con muchas ganas de seguir adelante por su familia.

El socio solicita el préstamo para el mantenimiento de sus computadoras y para comprar algunos accesorios para su carro.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos
texts.en:
Raul Harold is a member of the "Juntas y Unidas" ("Together and united") communal bank, located in the district of Cusco, in the province of Cusco, department of Cusco.

Raul is 38 years old, married with 2 children. He runs two business. The first one is an internet booth that's open all day from Monday to Sunday where he works alongside his wife. He also has a car with which he runs a school transportation service. He has one person helping him with this activity. He is a happy person eager to support his family. 

The member is requesting a loan for the maintenance of his computers and to buy some accessories for his car. 

He is happy with the loan and is committed to repaying it as agreed.

loans.use: Computer maintenance and purchase of car accessories.

loans.name: Sara

texts.es:
Sara Isabel Z. Gonzales es una mujer trabajadora, esforzada y emprendedora de 54 años quien tiene un negocio de venta de materiales de construcción, arreó de materiales y servicio de cisterna desde hace 10 años. El negocio se ubica en San Judas, Managua.
Ella con el crédito lo ocupara para legalizar una camioneta que acaba de adquirir.
texts.en:
Sara Isabel Z. Gonzales is a hard working 54 year old entrepreneur.  She owns a business which sells construction materials, transports materials, and offers a cistern service.  The business is about ten years old and is located in San Judas, Managua.

She will use the loan to register a recently purchased truck.

loans.use: To register a truck.

loans.name: Justa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” JUNTAS Y UNIDAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Justa; la socia tiene 42 años de edad, casada y tiene 2 hijos; la socia se dedica  al negocio de venta de productos de belleza como cremas, perfumes, colonias, entre otros más, la socia trabaja como consultora de belleza de la línea Esika, ella lleva años en este negocio el cual le trae satisfacciones tanto personales como económicas, la socia es una persona bien alegre y con muchas ganas de salir adelante ya que mediante este trabajo la socia saca a su familia adelante.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de más productos y así tener más variedad que ofrecer a sus clientes.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Justa is a member of the "Juntas y Unidas" (Together and United) community bank which is located in Cusco district, in the province and department of the same name.

Justa is 42 years old, married, and has 2 children.  Her business is selling beauty products such as creams, perfumes, colognes, etc.  She works as a beauty consultant for Esika.  She has been in this business for years and it brings her both personal and financial satisfaction.  Justa is a very cheerful person who has a great desire to get ahead in life.  Through her work, she gets her family ahead.

Justa is requesting this loan to buy more products so that she has a wider variety of goods to offer her customers.  She is happy to be receiving the loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: To buy more products so that she has a wider variety of goods to offer her customers.

loans.name: Always Good Group

texts.en:
Meet with members of the “Always Good” group from Waterloo, a small town in western Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, to apply for a loan of SLL 3,800,000 for the entire group. With the help of this loan they will expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. 

Mariama J. is the leader of this group. A native of Waterloo, Mariama is married and has 5 children who are attending primary and secondary schools. For the past 6 years, Mariama has been selling charcoal and fire-wood. With her share of this loan, she will buy charcoal and fire-wood in large quantities to add to her current stock. 
 
(Also included on the left of the photo, is loan officer Edna B. Conteh, handing over the loan to the borrowers)

loans.use: To Buy charcoal and fire-wood in large quantity to add to her current stock

loans.name: Elsa Maria

texts.es:
Elsa madre soltera, sus hijos son independientes y le ayudan con algunos gasto del hogar, desde hace un tiempo inicio su propio negocio y fue con ayuda de lo préstamo en la financiera que logro establecer su pulpería, se le presenta dificultades cuando se enferma se mira obligada a cerrar.
Sus planes son aumentar las ventas mediantes la inversión de nuevos y variados productos.
Con el préstamo comprara mercadería variedad como: golosina, refrescó, lácteo, jabón de lavar, abarrotes, granos básicos entre otros productos.
Agradece a la financiara por el apoyo al desarrollo de su negocio y cambiar su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Elsa is a single mother.  Her children are independent and help her with some household expenses.  She started her own business some time ago.  With the help of a loan she managed to set up a grocery store.  However, it is difficult when she becomes sick because then she has to close her store.

Elsa's plans are to increase her sales by investing in new and varied products.  She will use this loan to buy a variety of merchandise including candies, soft drinks, dairy products, washing powder, groceries and basic grains.  She is grateful to the financial institution for the support they have provided to her in making progress in her business and changing her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “PATRON SAN SEBASTIAN”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac, provincia de Cusco, Departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Josefina; La socia tiene 58 años de edad, la socia es casada, la socia tiene 1 hijo independiente; la socia tiene su agencia de viajes y turismo llamada Haes, esta agencia queda en la av. Sol, la socia trabaja administrando su agencia y viendo directamente todo el manejo de la misma, la socia invertirá el préstamo en la compra de útiles de escritorio, y en la agencia de viajes, ella hará unos prepagos y una vez que le giren el dinero ella cancelara los tickets. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en su agencia de viajes y turismo.

 La socia está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Josefina is a member of the "PATRON SAN SEBASTIAN" community bank which is located in Huanchac district, in Cusco province, in Cusco department.

Josefina is 58 years old, married, and has one child who lives independently.  She owns a travel and tourism agency called Haes which is located in Avenida Sol.  She runs her agency and directly oversees its management.  She will invest her loan in buying stationery supplies.  In her travel agency she will make some prepayments and once they send her the money she will cancel the tickets.  She is requesting this loan to invest in her travel and tourism agency.

Josefina is happy to be receiving this loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: To invest in her travel and tourism agency.

loans.name: Salud Y Vida Group

texts.es:
El grupo Salud y Vida está conformado por tres mujeres trabajadoras una de ellas es Juana Aracely H. desde hace 16 años inicio su pulpería con una pequeña mesa la cual dice conserva como reliquia. Ella decidió tener su negocio propio para poder dedicarles más tiempo a sus hijos.
La otras integrantes son Mireya O. M. quien vende ropa desde loa edad de 13 años primero le ayudaba a su madre  y desde hace 30 años vende de manera independiente y Marbelly Gómez tiene una pequeña venta.
texts.en:
The 'Salud y Vida' (Health and Life) group is made up of three hard-working women.  One of them is Juana Aracely H..  16 years ago, Juana set up a grocery store with just a small table that she tells us she still keeps as a reminder of that time.  She decided to set up her own business so that she could spend more time looking after her children.

The second member of the group is Mireya O. M. who has been selling clothes since she was 13 years old.  She started out helping her mother and has now been working for herself for the past 30 years.  The third member is Marbelly Gómez who has a small sales business.

loans.use: To buy basic grains

loans.name: Telma

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” JUNTAS Y UNIDAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Telma; la socia tiene 51 años de edad, separada y tiene 5 hijos; la socia se dedica  al negocio de venta de productos de belleza como cremas, perfumes, colonias, entre otros más, la socia trabaja como consultora de belleza de las líneas Natura,Dupre y Leonissa ,lleva años en este negocio el cual le trae satisfacciones tanto personales como económicas, a la vez la socia vende desayunos de forma ambulatoria todas las mañanas ,la socia es una persona bien alegre y con muchas ganas de salir adelante ya que mediante este trabajo la socia saca a su familia adelante.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de más productos y así tener más variedad que ofrecer a sus clientes y para comprar algunos insumos para los desayunos que hace.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Telma is a member of the 'Juntas y Unidas' (Together and United) community bank which is located in Cusco district, in the province and department of the same name.

Telma is 51 years old, separated, and has 5 children.  Her business is selling beauty products such as creams, perfumes, colognes, etc.  She works as a beauty consultant for Natura, Dupre and Leonissa.  She has been in this business for years and it brings her both personal and financial satisfaction.  Telma also sells breakfasts as an itinerant street vendor every morning.  She is a very cheerful person who has a great desire to get ahead in life.  Through her work she manages to get her family ahead.

Telma is requesting this loan to buy more products so that she has a greater variety of goods to offer her customers.  She also wants to buy some supplies for the breakfasts that she makes.

Telma is happy to be receiving this loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: To buy more products so that she has a greater variety of goods to offer her customers.  To buy some supplies for the breakfasts that she makes.

loans.name: No Weapon Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very please to present to you members of the “No Weapon” group. These are small scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders, to request a loan of SLL 3,700,000.00 for the entire group, in order to invest in their respective businesses. 

Tity B. is the leader of this group. Tity is married with 2 children who attend primary school. Tity sells body lotion, toothpaste, soap, Vaseline, etc. and has been doing this business for 9 years. With the help of this loan, Tity will invest in her business by buying stocks of good in large quantities, to add to her inventory at the store.  

(Also included on the left of the photo, is loan officer Edna B. C., handing over the loan to the borrowers).

loans.use: Buy body lotion, toothpaste, soap, Vaseline, etc. in large quantities to add to her current stock of goods

loans.name: Las Tres Marías Group

texts.es:
El grupo las 3 Marías está conformado por tres personas trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras una de ellas es María Mercedes L. de 55 años quien se dedica al comercio de ropa usada desde hace tres años. Ella trabaja con sus hijos y dos vendedoras quienes se encargan en distribuir l ropa. Su mayor meta es tener una gran tienda de ropa usada.
Las otras dos integrantes son María de los Ángeles H. vende prenda desde hace 4 años y María Elena Leyla vende nacatamales y cobertores…etc.
texts.en:
The 'las 3 Marías' (Three Marías) group is made up of three hard-working, motivated and enterprising women.  One of them is 55 year-old María Mercedes L. who has been selling used clothes for three years.  She works with her children and two saleswomen who take care of distributing the clothes. Her biggest goal is to own a large, used-clothes store.

The other two members of the group are María de los Ángeles H., who has been selling clothes for 4 years, and María Elena Leyla who sells tamales and bedspreads, etc.

loans.use: To buy bundles of clothes

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “PATRON SAN SEBASTIAN”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac, provincia de Cusco, Departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Alicia; La socia tiene 23 años de edad, la socia es conviviente, la socia tiene 1 hijo de 1 año; la socia se dedica a cuidar a su hijito mientras su conyugue trabaja como guía local en la explanada de Sacsayhuaman, ellos también tienen caballos que los alquilan a los turistas para hacer un tour guiado por los complejos arqueológicos de Sacsayhuaman, Qenqo, Pucapucara, Tambomachay; la socia apoya y ayuda a su conyugue con el cuidado, alimento y crianza de los caballos, ella también se encarga de dar la información del servicio, La socia desea el crédito para algo personal. Ella irá pagando sus cuotas con los ingresos de la renta del tour a caballo. La socia requiere el préstamo para uso personal.

La socia está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Alicia is a member of the “PATRON SAN SEBASTIAN” community bank which is located in Huanchac district, in Cusco province and department.

Alicia is 23 years old.  She lives with her partner and has a one-year-old son.  Alicia looks after her little boy while her partner works as a local guide at la explanada de Sacsayhuaman.  They also own horses that they hire out to tourists so that they can enjoy guided tours of the Sacsayhuaman, Qengo, Pucapucara and Tambomachay archaeological complexes.  Alicia supports and helps her partner in caring for, feeding and raising the horses.  She also takes care of providing information about their service.

Alicia would like this loan for something personal.  She will make her loan repayments with the income she makes from her horse tours.  She requires the loan for personal use.

Alicia is happy to be receiving her loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: For personal use

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Gloria Esperanza C. es una mujer trabajadora, esforzada, jovial y emprendedora originaria de Managua. Esta señora de 66 años desde muy joven se ha salido a ganarse el pan de cada día y hace dos años que tiene una pequeña venta.
Ella con el crédito comprara arroz, azúcar, café, aceite…etc.
texts.en: Gloria Esperanza C. is a hard-working, pleasant, and enterprising woman from Managua.  She is 66 years old and from a very young age has gone out each day to earn her daily bread.  For the past two years she has had a small store.  She will use the loan money to buy rice, sugar, oil, etc.

loans.use: Basic grains

loans.name: Lorenzo

texts.es:
Lorenzo soltero, tiene dos hijos a los cuales los tiene estudiando, hombre trabajador, responsable tiene su negocio de venta de perfumes, talcos, colonias para caballeros, y todo encargo de productos que su clientes requieran. 
Lo inicio con fondos propios desde hace un tiempo es el medio con que sustenta a su familia ya que la situación de encontrar trabajo esta escaso por tal empezó a comercializar producto de variedad.
Con el préstamo compra productos como. Perfumes, colonias, cremas, talcos, desodorantes, prendas de caballero, damas y niños para mantener en existencia en el momento que el cliente busque el producto. Gracias por la oportunidad de fortalecer su negoció mediante el préstamo y aumentar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Lorenzo is single and he has two children, both of whom are in school. He is a hardworking and responsible man. He has a perfume business and he sells perfumes, talc, gentlemen's colognes, and any products that his customers request. 

He started out some time ago with his own funds and now it is the way he supports his family. It is difficult to find work which is why he started selling these types of products. 

With his loan he will purchase products such as perfumes, colognes, skin creams, talc, deodorants, and clothing for men, women, and children. This way he will have in stock whatever products his customers are looking for. He is thankful for this opportunity to strengthen his business through this loan which will help him to increase his earnings.

loans.use: to purchase various personal care products for resale

loans.name: Amparo Del Carmen

texts.es:
Amparo madre soltera, sus hijos ya son mayores de edad y le ayudan con los gastos del hogar, ella vela por que sus hijos salgan adelante. Mujer trabajadora, responsable y honesta inicio su propio negocio de ventas por catálogos y encargos fue con ahorros propios por tal compro pequeñas cantidades y poco variedad.  Por falta de financiamientos no invertía más en su negocio siendo unas de las dificultades. Sus planes son aumentar su inventarios e incrementar sus venta mediante la compra de mayores cantidades y ingresar otros productos, con el préstamo comprara: bisutería, perfumes de dama, caballero y niños, también blusas, pantalones, talco, cremas, entre otras mercadería.
Agradece a la financiera por la oportunidad de ingresar en el mundo del crédito obteniendo ganancias para ser invertido.
texts.en:
Amparo is a single mother although her children are grown and they help her with the household expenses. She prays that her children will find success. She is a hardworking woman, responsible and honest. She started her own business with her own savings selling by catalogue and taking orders. She was only able to buy in small quantities and in limited variety. Her plan is to increase her sales through the purchase of greater quantities of products and to introduce new products, including pants, talc, skin creams, and other merchandise.

She is thankful to the financial organization for the opportunity to take part in the world of personal credit in order to obtain earnings to reinvest.

loans.use: to purchase personal care products for resale

loans.name: Wilfredo Heriberto

texts.es: El Sr. Wilfredo es una persona que trabaja en una maquiladora además de contar  con un puesto de hamburguesas en su domicilio, el cual  atiende personalmente  los fines de semana en compañía de su esposa, con la venta de hamburguesas, burritos y toda la variedad de comida rápida que  ellos producen han mejorado satisfactoriamente  sus  ingresos  pero requieren de la  compra  de mercancía  para   que  este  negocio  continúe  funcionando ya  que   con los ingresos  de la maquiladora  no les  es   suficiente para  abastecerse  de materia  prima, así como también desean  incrementar  la variedad  de platillos   ofrecidos a  sus  cliente  ya  que consideran  que  de esta  manera  atraerán  a su negocio a  un mayor   numero  de personas.
texts.en: Mr. Wilfredo works at a factory and also has a hamburger stand at his home where he works on the weekends with the help of his wife.  They sell hamburgers, burritos, and all kinds of fast food that they make.  Their income has increased at a nice rate but they need to buy more supplies to stay in business because the earnings from the factory are not enough to buy high-quality supplies.  They also wish to offer a greater variety of dishes to their customers as they feel they will attract more people.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Nora Del Socorro

texts.es:
Nora del Socorro O. es una mujer trabajadora, esforzada y emprendedora de 50 años quien se dedica a la realización de fresco, sopa y verduras desde hace 4 años. Ella invertirá el crédito en verduras y frutas para su negocio.
O. tiene tres hijos de 32, 28 y 25 años quienes le ayudan.
texts.en: Nora del Socorro O. is a hard-working and enterprising 50 year old woman who has worked selling juices, soup, and vegetables for four years.  She will use the loan to buy fruit and vegetables for her business.  She has three children, ages 32, 28, and 25, who help her.

loans.use: Fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Alba Rosa

texts.es:
Alba casada su esposo trabaja como guardia de seguridad, sus hijos ya son independientes juntos tiene el proyecto de mejorar la infraestructura de su vivienda, realizando mejorar y construir la parte que sean necesaria para obtener mayor comodidad y protección. Desde hace un tiempo ella trabaja por cuenta propia en su tortillería no ha tenido dificultades, inicio con el apoyo de su madre.
El préstamo será utilizado para la compra de materiales de construcción: cemento, arena, piedra cantera, piedrín, ladrillo, bloques, alambre de amarre y otros materiales para construir un cuarto.  Obtener seguridad es la meta. Agradece por la oportunidad para mejorar su nivel de vida poco a poco.
texts.en:
Alba is married and her husband is a security guard. Her children are already independent and together they have the goal of improving their house by carrying out improvements and building a section to acquire greater comfort and safety. She has been working at her own tortilla business for some time and she has not had any difficulties. She started out with her mother's support.

This loan will be used to purchase construction materials: cement, sand, rocks, gravel, bricks, construction blocks, wire, and other materials needed to build a room. Her goal is to improve their safety. She is thankful for the opportunity to improve the quality of her life, one step at a time.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Buys drinks in bulk to add to his inventory.

loans.name: The Joy Of Cancun Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama “Alegría de Cancún” porque somos  mujeres que radicamos en Cancún con una actitud alegre como la ciudad. Está ubicado en Quintana Roo, en México. La señora Carla Elianora P. Sánchez es integrante del grupo. Tiene 26 años y estudio una carrera técnica en música. Es maestra de música. Ella se dedica a la venta de plantas de ornato. Solicita el préstamo para la compra de tierra, plantas, semillas para  el crecimiento del negocio. Sus clientes opinan que  las plantas que ella vende están bien cuidadas; su atención es amable y  piensan que la venta de plantas es una actividad generosa  con el medio ambiente. Al solicitar este préstamo se siente muy contenta por poder contribuir con los gastos de su familia y así salir adelante para llevar una vida más estable. También espera que  la gente se anime más en la compra de plantas para ayudar al medio ambiente y así tener  un mayor ingreso para apoyar a sus papas y  continuar preparándose en la música.
texts.en: The name of this group is "The Joy of Cancun" and it was named because they are a group of women who live in Cancun and who have a happy attitude, like the city. It is located in the Quintana Roo, in Mexico. Mrs. Carla Elianora P. S. is a member of the group. She is 26 years old and she studied music. She is a music teacher. She sells ornamental plants. She requests a loan to purchase potting soil, plants, and seeds to develop her business. Her clients comment that the plants that she sells are always well cared-for. Her customer service is very kind and they think that the sale of plans is a generous activity for the environment. When she requested the loan she felt very happy to be able to contribute to the family's expenses and to support herself, to have a more stable lifestyle. She also hopes that the population will increasingly seek to buy plants to help the environment. She will have a better income to help her parents and to continue studying her career in music.

loans.use: to purchase potting soil, plants, and seeds for the development of her business

loans.name: Juan Fidencio

texts.es: El Sr. Juan Fidencio Z., es empleado de una maquiladora , es padre de dos pequeños,  su casa la ha estado construyendo poco a poco, en este momento  lo  que  desean es  construir  una  recamara para  que  cuando sus   hijos crezcan tengan un poco mas  de  privacidad, es  por  ello que  al enterarse de esta institución y los apoyos que se otorgan para llevar a cabo el proyecto decidió junto con su esposa visitarnos y exponernos el proyecto de vivienda que el quiere terminar,  que en este caso solo le faltaba poner la losa de concreto en el techo y el quiere terminar antes de que inicie la época de lluvia , de  esta  manera  al  ampliar  su  domicilio sus  hijos  van a contar  con mayor  espacio para  moverse y así como también podrán comprar  muebles  que  necesitan y podrán  acomodarlos  dentro  de  su  domicilio ya  debido  al espacio  tan reducido no podía ser  esto  posible.
texts.en: Mr. Juan Fidencio Z. works at a factory and is the father of two young children.  He has been building his house little by little and currently wishes to build a bedroom so that when his children grow they will have a bit more privacy.  He and his wife decided to ask for a loan from this institution and explain their construction plan and his hopes for finishing.  The only thing he needs to do is to put a concrete slab on the roof and he wants to finish before the rainy season begins.  After adding on to the home his children will have more space to move around.  They will also be able to buy the furniture they need and they will be able to place the furniture inside their home, something they have not yet been able to do as they do not have much space.

loans.use: To build a room for concrete slabs

loans.name: Las Madres Group

texts.es:
El grupo las madres lo conforman tres mujeres trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras una de ellas es Darling del Socorro Dávila de 30 años quien se dedica al comercio de anteojos de sol y accesorios para celulares (carcasas, auriculares, etc.) Ella tiene cuatro hijos de 11, 10 y 9 amos y un bebe de 8 meses.
Las otras integrantes del grupo son Fátima del Socorro Méndez de 21años vende cosméticos y perfumes y Martha Isabel P. se dedica al comercio de películas hace 2 años.
texts.en:
The group “The Mothers” is made up of three hard-working and enterprising women.  One of them is Darling del Socorro D., 30, who has a sunglass and cell phone accessory (frames,earphones, etc.) business.  She has four children: 11, 10, 9 and an 8-month old baby.

The other members of the group are Fátima del Socorro Méndez, 21, who sells cosmetics and perfumes, and Martha Isabel P. who has had a movie rental business for the past two years.

loans.use: Sunglass and cell phone accessories

loans.name: Hosanna Jabneel

texts.es: La Sra. Hosanna y su esposo, radican en una colonia muy retirada de la ciudad , como los dos trabajan  dejan sola la casa donde habitan y aunque confían en los vecinos  no descartan la idea de que los ladrones puedan atacar su hogar en cualquier momento, es por eso que ellos han decidido construir una barda al frente del domicilio para mayor  seguridad y así tener confianza al momento en que ellos se retiran a su trabajo además de  que pronto recibirán la llegada  de  su  bebe para  el  cual  quieren  la  mayor  protección y seguridad,  para que  en un futuro  el  pueda  salir  a jugar  al patio sin ningún problema es por ello que este  crédito representa su segundo refinanciamiento y están muy contentos con esta institución ya que se sienten apoyados para poder llevar a cabo sus proyectos.
texts.en:
Señora Hosanna and her husband live in a suburb far from the city.  They both work from home and even though they trust their neighbors, they don't dismiss the idea that thieves could break into their home at any time.  For this reason they have decided to build a fence in front of their house so that  they can feel safer when they are working.  They are also expecting a baby soon and they want to protect and keep their child safe and, in the future, be able to play on the patio without any problems.  

This is their second loan and they are very happy with the institution and the support that they provide to help them carry out their projects.

loans.use: To build a fence

loans.name: Alice

texts.fr:
Cliente âgée de 44ans et mère d’un enfant, elle a sa charge 7 orphelins de  sa défunte sœur.

Elle ouvre le restaurant spécialité MABOKE en 2004 vente de poisson d'eau douce cuit dans les feuilles de maniocs a l'etoufee sur un barbecue. 
Avec le prêt qu'elle va recevoir, elle va acheter des cuvettes de poissons d'eau douce comme la silure, l'anguille et les carpes, bidon d'huile de 25l, filet d'oignon, les feuilles d'attache, poivre blanc , piment..

Ses ventes journalière sont de 30.000F a 80.000 par jour et ses clients les chauffeurs et les vendeurs du marche.

Tres entreprenante , elle veut continuer dans cet élan pour faire plus des benefices  afin de soutenir ses neveux dans leurs études et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
This customer is 44 years old and the mother of one child. She also has seven orphaned children of her deceased sister in her care. She opened a specialty restaurant named Maboke in 2004, where she serves freshwater fish steamed in manioc leaves on a barbecue.

With this loan she would like to buy freshwater fish such as catfish, eel and carp, a 25-liter jug of oil, a bag of onions, leaves for wrapping, white pepper, hot pepper… Her daily receipts range from 30,000 to 80,000 francs, and her customers are drivers and market vendors. Very enterprising, she would like to use this momentum to increase her income in order to be able to help her nephews pay for their studies and to improve the life conditions of her family.

loans.use: Purchasing freshwater fish, oil, carbon, condiments, and household items

loans.name: Vanessa Isadora

texts.es:
Vannessa casada su esposo trabaja para una empresa de electricidad, tienes dos hijos por los cuales su meta que sean profesionales. Mujer trabajadora y emprendedora inicio su negocio propio de venta de productos cosméticos, bisutería obteniendo una entrada económica extra apoyando a su esposo con los gastos del hogar. 
Con fondos propios inicio a comprar cantidades pequeñas solo por encargos. Proyección de un aumento de ventas para estos meses y a corto plazo mejora su vivienda.
El préstamo era invertido en la compra de materiales de construcción como: cemento, perlines, arena, láminas de aluminio, piedras canteras, varillas de cobres, entre otros materiales para construir un porche en su casa obteniendo comodidad.
texts.en:
Vannessa is married, and her husband works for an electricity company.  She has two children, and her goal for them is that they become professionals.

She is a hard-working and entrepreneurial woman.  She started her own business of selling cosmetic products and costume jewelry.  This gives her entry to extra financial support to help her husband with the household expenses.  

With her own funds she started to buy small quantities only by order.  Her plan is to increase sales during the coming months.  Her short term plan is to improve her house.

She used the loan to buy construction materials like cement, beams, sand, aluminum sheeting, quarry rocks, and copper rebar, among other materials.  These materials are to build a porch onto her house in order to be more comfortable.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to make improvements on her house

loans.name: Mariposas Monarcas Group

texts.es: La Sra. Georgina Danae C. M.  es  integrante  del grupo “Mariposas  Monarcas”,  vive en el estado de Quintana Roo en  playa del Carmen. En México.  Tiene 24 años de edad  término su primaria,  es ama de casa y tiene un hijo de 4 años de edad.  Solicita el préstamo para comprar más productos de belleza  y con las ventas y la ganancia que obtenga ella puede comprarle a su hijo sus útiles  escolares y lo que necesite. Sus clientes dicen  que le compran mayormente a ella  por que el precio es accesible.  Al solicitar el préstamo ella está muy feliz y contenta  porque va a invertir más productos que le generan ingresos con lo que puede ofrecerles una mejor vida a su hijo así como una carrera profesional para que salga adelante y logré lo sus sueños. Observaciones, la señora que no se ve bien se llama Maria apolonia.
texts.en:
Georgina Danae C. M. is a member of the “Mariposas Monarcas” (Monarch Butterflies) group and lives in Playa del Carmen, in the state of Quintana Roo, in Mexico.  Georgina is 24 years old and finished her elementary school education.  She is a housewife and has a 4 year-old son.

Georgina is requesting this loan to buy more beauty products.  She will use her sales and the profits she makes from them to buy her son his school supplies and other things he needs.  Georgina's customers say that they buy mainly from her because her prices are affordable.  At the time of requesting this loan, Georgina is very happy and content because she will invest in buying more products that will make her more profits.  This will enable her to offer her son a better life as well as a university-level education so that he can get ahead in life and fulfil his dreams.

nb: the lady who can't B. seen very well is called Maria Apolonia.

loans.use: to buy more beauty products

loans.name: Ta-Kuru Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the “Ta-Kuru” group from northern Sierra Leone. They run small businesses and have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, in order to seek their first loan. With this loan, they will be able to add more goods to their businesses, attract more customers, make more sales and profit and consequently improve on their living conditions. 

The leader of this group of entrepreneurs is Mariatu B.. She was born in the village of Marampa 28 years ago. She is married and has 2 children. Her husband is a trader and her children are in primary school. Mariatu has been selling cooked bulgur wheat for 5 years now.  With her share of this loan, she will buy cooking materials like bulgur wheat, oil, fish, margi, onions, etc. in order to cook a large quantity of bulgur for sale.

loans.use: Buy cooking ingredients like bulgur wheat, oil, fish, margi, onions, etc. in order to cook a large quantity of bulgur for sale

loans.name: Nana

texts.en:
This is 39 year-old Nana S.. She is married and has 2 children aged 5 and 9 years. She has 1 additional dependent, who she adopted. In 2004, Nana S. established her plastic utensils business. She began her business because she wanted to be financially self reliant.

Working 6 days a week and 9 hours a day, she earns about Le 2,800,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan of Le 4,000,000. With the loan she will purchase more plastic bowls. Nana hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 600,000. In the future, Nana S. plans to purchase enough stock to reduce frequent traveling to Guinea for purchases. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more household plastic utensils

loans.name: Las Damas 96 Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama Las Damas 96, porque se consideran unas damas de esta ciudad hermosa que está Ubicado en el estado de Quintana Roo, Cancún en México. El grupo está conformado por 12 integrantes. La señora Lidia Aurora C. E., es la presidenta del grupo. Tiene 46 años, estudio hasta el segundo grado de primaria, es ama de casa, tiene 3 hijos varones de 23, 20 y 10 años de edad. Ella se dedica a la venta y elaboración de piñatas que inicio desde hace 20 años. En el cual requiere el crédito para comprar  material para la elaboración de piñatas  y  así poder seguir con sus ventas diarias. La señora va de negocio a negocio  promoviendo las piñatas y así poder captar clientes y poder venderles las piñatas por cantidades que le soliciten de igual manera poderles dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Doña Lidia se siente muy motivada y contenta con el crédito que se le otorgo porque con este ella podrá apoyar en los gastos de su familia y poderles dar a su familia una vida de calidad. Observaciones, las señoras que no se ve bien se llama Minerva C. y Guadalupe C..
texts.en:
This group is called 'Las Damas 96' (Ladies 96) because they are women from the beautiful town of Cancún, in the State of Quintana Roo, in Mexico.  The group has 12 members.

Lidia Aurora C. E. is the group's president.  She is 46 years old and studied up to the second grade of elementary school.  She has three sons aged 23, 20 and 10.  Lidia's business is making and selling piñatas.  She started this business 20 years ago.  Lidia needs this loan to buy materials for making her piñatas so that she can continue making her daily sales.  She goes from business to business promoting her piñatas in order to attract customers and sell them piñatas in the quantity they require.  She also strives to provide her customers with a better service.

Lidia feels very motivated by the loan that she has been awarded and very happy because it will enable her to support her family's expenses and allow her to provide her family with a better quality of life.

nb: the ladies who cannot be seen very well are Minerva C. and Guadalupe C..

loans.use: to buy materials for making piñatas

loans.name: Diana Yadira

texts.es: La Sra. Diana Yadira    tiene  un  negocio, en esta  ocasión  necesita  comprar  mercancía  para  su  local ya  que  tiene  una  gran cantidad  de  pedidos  de  sus clientes y  siempre  se  a caracterizado  por  brindarles  un excelente  servicio, nos  comenta que  de  esta  manera  mejorara su  economía además  de  atraer  a un mayor  numero  de clientes  así  como  también  con estos  ingresos  podrá  ofrecerles una mejor  calidad  de   vida  a sus  tres   hijos.
texts.en: Sra. Diana Yadira manages a business.  On this occasion, she needs to buy merchandise for her shop since she has a large number of orders from her customers.  Diana is always known for providing excellent service.  She says that by working in this manner she is able to improve her finances.  Attracting a large number of customers also helps to generate income so that she can provide a better quality of life for her three children.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Olivia

texts.es: La  señora  Olivia  tiene  un  negocio  de   venta  de   baterías, en este  momento  ella   desea  comprar  baterías  para  maquinaria  pesada  ya  que  por  el  momento   solo   vende  este  producto para carros  y  camionetas,      solicita  este   crédito   ya que  representa  una   manera  en la  que   puede   generar  mayores ingresos  además  de atraer    a  un gran   numero de clientes   ya  que   este  producto  es   muy  demandado  en  su negocio.
texts.en:
Sra. Olivia has a business selling batteries. At the moment, she only sells batteries for cars and trucks, but she also wants to sell batteries for heavy machinery.

She is requesting this loan because it will help her generate more income and attract a large number of customers since her business experiences high demand for these products.

loans.use: Purchase an assortment of batteries to sell

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha Patricia G. Pérez  es una mujer trabajadora, esforzada de 37 años ella desde hace 5 años tiene una pequeña pulpería la cual inicio con la venta de chivería, además vende licor sellado. 
Ella invertirá el crédito en granos básicos, carne y licor.
texts.en:
Martha Patricia G. Pérez, age 37, is a hardworking and determined woman. She has managed a small store for five years. Martha started out selling yogurt and then liquor.

She will invest her loan in basic grains, meat, and liquor.

loans.use: Purchase basic grains, meat, and liquor to sell in her store

loans.name: Doris Tatiana

texts.es: Doris Tatiana tiene una pequeña pulpería ubicada en su casa de habitación, tiene 35 años de edad, es madre soltera y posee 3 hijos. Esta no es la primera vez que solicita créditos por lo que se siente muy agradecida con este medio de vida. De lo que obtiene de su negocio lo utiliza para comprar más mercancía y realizar su venta más días a la semana, para que mejor sea sus ingresos y con ello cubrir algunos gastos que se generan en su hogar. el crédito será invertido en la compra de granos básicos, golosinas, refrescos naturales y pan.
texts.en:
Doris Tatiana has a small store that she manages in her home. She is 35 years old and a single mother of three children. This is not the first time she has applied for loans since she is grateful that they have helped her earn a living. What she earns from her business is used to buy more merchandise so that she can generate more sales throughout the week. This enables her to improve her income and cover some of the household expenses.

The loan will be invested in the purchase of basic grains, candy, natural beverages, and bread.

loans.use: Operating capital to buy basic grains, candy, natural beverages, and bread

loans.name: Flora

texts.es:
Flora Marina P. es una fémina trabajadora, esforzada y emprendedora quien tiene una pequeña tortillería desde hace 4 años. Ella echa tortillas por las mañanas, al medio día y por las tardes ya que es un bastimento básico en la alimentación.
Ella sueña con superarse y seguir adelante.
texts.en: Flora Marina P. is a hardworking, determined, and enterprising woman.  She has managed a small business selling tortillas for the past four years.  Flora makes tortillas in the mornings, at noon, and in the afternoons since they are a basic food product.  Her dream is to succeed and move forward.

loans.use: Purchase corn

loans.name: Jovany

texts.en:
After working for years for larger janitorial companies, Claudia and Jovany realized that they had the experience, expertise, and determination they needed to go into business for themselves. What’s more, by starting their own small business, they would have the power to make their own decisions about the type of work they do and would be able to keep more of their earnings each month. 
 
Over the last three years Claudia and Jovany’s business has steadily grown to take on more cleaning contracts, thanks to their hard work and dedication to customer satisfaction. To take their business to the next level, the couple needed new equipment – but the upfront investment was more than they can afford on their own. 
 
A $5,000 microloan, the couple’s first from Opportunity Fund, will enable Claudia and Jovany to purchase a new power cleaner.  “This machine will do three jobs at once!” explained Jovany. By automating part of the cleaning process that Claudia and Jovany currently do by hand, this machine will dramatically increase their efficiency and improve the services they can offer to their clients.

loans.use: New equipment for his cleaning business

loans.name: Walter Marcelino

texts.es:
Walter, es originario de Palacaguina una pequeña  comarca del Departamento de Madriz , tiene 30 años de edad , es soltero ,  de oficio         ,tiene un hijo de 9 años el cual esta estudiando cuarto grado de primaria, lleva 5 años trabajando  el área de elaboración de puertas y ventanas de vidrio y aluminio .
Empezó en esta actividad al salir de su quinto año de la secundaria, debido a que  no tenia como pagar una carrera universitaria , tuvo que salir de Palacaguina en busca de trabajo y se fue a Estelí ,estando ahí y con ayuda de un primo logro aprender  a trabajar en un taller de vidrio y aluminio donde empezó como ayudante , a los tres años de estar en ese taller logro especializarse hasta ser el que entrenaba a otros jóvenes y adquirió mas pedidos de puertas y ventanas de vidrio al cumplir 5 años en ese taller decidió independizarse y comenzó a trabajar por si solo .  Poco a poco fue comprando herramientas de trabajo gracias a los pedidos que recibía. En este negocio solo el lo atiende cuando tiene pedidos grandes busca ayudantes para que lo ayuden a cumplir con lo pedidos que le llegan así también el mismo sale fuera de su comarca en busca de nuevos clientes. 
Solicita el crédito para compra de materia prima como aluminio, tornillo de cabezal y herramientas de trabajo. Pues le ayudaría a facilitar su trabajo en cuanto entrega de pedidos, a darle un mejor acabado a las puertas y ventanas que haces así mismo hacer nuevos clientes.
Tiene como planes futuros poder tener su propio local y ambientarlo con buenas y modernas herramientas de trabajo y poder contratar personas fijas. 
Dentro de su metas próximas esta adquirir suficientes materiales de trabajo para sacar pedidos grandes que le salgan, tener una cuenta de ahorro donde asegure una buena educación para su hijo, ya que el no pudo estudiar pero su hijo tiene la fe que el si lo lograra, también le gustaría tener su vehículo donde pueda transportar su pedidos y herramientas de trabajo para agilizarlos mas rápidamente.
texts.en:
Walter is originally from Palacaguina, a small region in the Department of Madriz. He is 30 years old, single, employed, and has a 9 year old son who is in the fourth grade. For the past five years, Walter has been making doors and windows out of glass and aluminum.

Walter started working in this trade after he completed his fifth year of secondary school since he had no other way of paying for a university degree. He left Palacaguina to find work and went to Estelí. A cousin helped him out by offering him an apprenticeship at a glass and aluminum workshop where he started out as an assistant. Three years later, he was able to teach other young people since there were more orders for doors and windows. Once he worked five years at the workshop, Walter decided to become independent and start working alone. Over time he was able to buy tools with the income from the orders he received. Whenever he receives large orders, Walter will find assistants to help him complete the work. He also travels outside of the region to look for new customers.

The loan he is requesting will be used to buy materials such as aluminum, screws, and tools for his job. This will help facilitate his work so that he can complete his orders and provide better quality finishes to the doors and windows that he produces. As a result, he will be able to attract new customers. Walter has future plans to open his own shop and furnish it with modern equipment of high quality, as well as hire permanent employees.

His immediate goals are to acquire sufficient materials to complete the large orders he has received. Walter has money saved up to secure a good education for his son since he was not able to continue his own education. He has faith that his son will be able to accomplish this. In addition, Walter would like to have a vehicle to help him deliver orders and transport equipment more quickly.

loans.use: To purchase materials and tools for making windows and doors.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
La señora Elizabeth, es socia del banco comunal Sol Naciente, del Distrito de Calleria, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 62 años de edad, madre soltera y tiene 5 hijos.
Ella se dedica a la venta de productos comestibles, esta actividad la raliza en las afueras de su domicilio y tiene la ayuda de una de sus hijas, lleva trabajando con Manuela Ramos desde hace 9 años.
Con este préstamo de  S/. 1,000.00 nuevos soles comprará 10 kilos de pescado seco, 3 kilos de fariña, 2 racimos de plátano, 2 kilos de tomate, 2 kilos de cebolla, 5 kilos de papa, 1 kilo de ajos, 1 atado de culantro de la región, 1 lata de pan, 1 lata de biscocho, 1 caja de galleta, 1 paquete de papel higiénico, ½ caja de leche chica, ½ caja de aceite, 1 caja de mantequilla.  
Con todos los préstamos que ha tenido de Manuela Ramos ha ido incrementando su pequeño negocio, las ganancias las utiliza para pagar las cuotas al banco y también le alcanza para darse unos pequeños gustos.
texts.en:
Sra. Elizabeth is a member of the Communal Bank “Sol Naciente” (Rising Sun) which is in the District of Calleria, Department of Ucayali. She is 62 years old and a single mother of five children.

Elizabeth sells food products. Her business is located just outside of her home and she has the help of one of her daughters.

Elizabeth has been working with Manuela Ramos for nine years. With this loan of 1000 PEN, she will buy 10 kilos of dried fish, 3 kilos of flour, 2 bunches of bananas, 2 kilos of tomatoes, 2 kilos of onions, 5 kilos of potatoes, 1 kilo of garlic, 1 bunch of cilantro grown in the region, 1 case of bread, 1 case of biscuits, 1 package of cookies, 1 packet of toilet paper, ½ case of milk, ½ case of oil, and 1 case of butter.

With the loans from Manuela Ramos, Elizabeth has been able to steadily increase her small business. The profits she earns are used to repay her loans to the Communal Bank and purchase a few small luxuries for herself that she can afford.

loans.use: To purchase various products for her business.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es: La joven Maria Isabel de 25 años, reside en tejera un municipio del sauce. Vive con su esposo y un hijo que depende económicamente de ella. Maria Isabel administra una pulpería hace 2 años, por iniciativa propia, trabajando de lunes a domingo, no tiene un horario de venta pues la tiene en su propia casa. Ella está solicitando un préstamo para invertir en este negocio, comprando  arroz, frijol, azúcar, aceite, sopas, verduras, pollo, bebidas entre otros que a diario vende a sus clientes. Esto le ayudara a fortalecer el negocio ya que lograra abastecerlo de todo lo necesario en el hogar, ya que son los más demandados por los clientes. Sus aspiraciones es continuar aumentando el negocio, que su hijo termine sus estudios para que opte por un futuro más estable.
texts.en:
Maria Isabel is a young woman who is 25 years of age and resides in the weaving community of El Sauce. She lives with her husband and a son who is financially dependent on her. Maria Isabel has been managing a store that she started on her own for the past two years. She works Monday through Sunday, but she does not have a set schedule since the store is in her home.

Maria Isabel is requesting a loan to invest in her business. She will buy rice, beans, sugar, oil, soups, vegetables, chicken, beverages, and other products that she sells to her customers on a daily basis. With this support, she will be able to strengthen her business and restock her inventory with all of the household necessities that her customers demand. Her aspirations include continuing to grow her business and seeing her son finish his studies so that he can have a more stable future.

loans.use: To purchase rice, beans, sugar, oil, soups, vegetables, chicken, beverages, and other products.

loans.name: Jehova Jirex Group

texts.es:
El grupo Jehova Jirex lo conforman tres mujeres trabajadoras una de ellas es la señora Lorena del Carmen S. de 55 años se dedica a la costura desde hace 3 años. Ella inicio vendiendo verduras y frutas, luego CD y ahora está en la costura.
Ella invertirá el crédito en telas y su mayor sueño es tener un taller de moda con todas las condiciones. 
Las otras integrantes del grupo son Ivania Leticia M. quien vende fritanga y María Justina Rocha quien vende comida.
texts.en:
The group “Jehova Jirex” consists of three hardworking women. One of them is Sra. Lorena del Carmen S.. She is 55 years old and has worked as a seamstress for three years. Lorena started out selling vegetables and fruits, and later CDs, but now she is a seamstress.

She will invest her loan in fabrics. Her greatest wish is to have a sewing workshop in good condition.

The other members of the group are Ivania Leticia M., who sells fried foods, and María Justina Rocha who sells food.

loans.use: Purchase fabrics

loans.name: Carla Jimena

texts.es:
La señora Carla es socia del banco comunal Las innovadoras del Distrito de Calleria, Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 34 años de edad, está casada y tiene 3 hijos menores de edad. Su esposo es policía. 
Lleva recién 2 años perteneciendo al banco comunal, hace un par de meses que alquiló dos puestos en el mercado  numero 2 de la ciudad para poner su tienda de ropas, anteriormente vendía su ropa en su propia casa.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,200.00 nuevos soles comprará 2 maniquís, ½ doc. De pantalones para damas, 6 vestidos, faldas, 10 blusas, 6 polos para damas, 6 polos para niños, 3 vestidos para fiesta.
Espera que le vaya bien y tenga para poder seguir trabajando y así dar una mejor educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Sra. Carla is a member of the Communal Bank “Las Innovadoras” (The Innovators) in the District of Calleria, Department of Ucayali. She is 34 years old, married, and has three young children. Her husband is a policeman. Carla joined the Communal Bank two years ago. Two months ago, she rented two stalls at the Number 2 Market in the city where she has established a clothing shop. Carla previously sold clothes out of her home.

With her new loan of 1200 PEN, Carla will buy two mannequins, a half dozen women’s trousers, six dresses, skirts, ten blouses, six women’s polo shirts, six children’s polo shirts, and three party dresses. Carla expects to do well and keep working so that she can provide her children a good education.

loans.use: Purchase two mannequins, a half dozen women’s trousers, six dresses, skirts, ten blouses, six women’s polo shirts, six children’s polo shirts, and three party dresses

loans.name: Los Ángeles De Charlies Group

texts.es:
El grupo los Ángeles de Charlies lo conforman tres mujeres trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras  una de ella es Karla J. de 40 años quien se dedica a la venta de comida. Ella realiza la comida, las empaca y entregara en las empresas. 
Giron tiene tres hijos de 20, 15 y 10 años por los cuales trabaja arduamente.
Las integrantes de los grupos son Gloria Q. de 31 años quien tiene una pulpería desde hace 4 años y Raquel G. de 51 años quien vende tortilla, gaseosa, licor y cerveza.
texts.en:
The Charlie's Angels group is made up of 3 hard-working, enterprising women.  One of whom is Karla J. who is 40 years old and sells food.  She makes the food, packages it, and sells it to businesses.

J. has 3 children who are 20, 15, and 10 years old, each of whom also works hard.

The other group members are Gloria Q. (31 years old) who has run a small general store for the past 4 years, and Raquel G. (51 years old) who sells tortillas, soft drinks, liquor, and beer.

loans.use: Purchase basic grains, meat, etc.

loans.name: Bertha Calderón Group

texts.es:
El grupo Bertha Calderón está conformado por tres mujeres trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras una de ellas es Karla G. de 38 años quien vende frijoles, hielo y gaseosa desde hace 2 años. Ella con crédito además de comprar productos desea invertir en sandalias.
Las otra integrantes del grupo son Mariela de los Ángeles A. Pérez quien tiene una pequeña venta de chiveria y gaseosa y Martha Lorena T. vende frijoles cocidos, leña y productos arabella.
texts.en: The Bertha Calderon group is made up of 3 hard-working, enterprising women, one of whom is Karla G. who is 38 years old and has sold beans, ice, and soft drinks for the past 2 years.  She would like to use the loan to buy other products to sell like sandals.  The other group members are Mariela de los Angeles A. Perez who runs a small general store selling food and soft drinks and Martha Lorena T. who sells beans, firewood and beauty products.

loans.use: Purchase sandals to sell

loans.name: Fortaleza Group

texts.es:
El grupo Fortaleza lo conforman tres mujeres trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras una de ellas es Juliana E. de 56 años que se dedica al comercio en general es decir vende de todo lo que le encargan. Ella tiene cinco hijos mayores e invertirá el crédito en su negocio.
Las otras integrantes son Yamileth del Socorro Velázquez de 39 años quien vende de todo un poco y Griselda del Socorro Narvaes vende cosméticos y joyas.
texts.en:
The Fortaleza group consists of 3 hard-working, enterprising women, one of whom is Juliana E. who is 56 years old and is a saleswoman.  She has 5 adult children and she plans to invest the loan in her sales business.

The other group members are Yamileth del Socorro Velazquez who is 39 years old and sells a little bit of everything and Griselda del Socorro N. who sells cosmetics and jewelry.

loans.use: Purchase various merchandise for sale

loans.name: Nestor

texts.es: Néstor tiene 31 años, su actividad económica es la compra y venta de cerdo. Esta actividad es muy popular en nuestro país, pues la mayoría de las personas tienen este medio de vida para sobrevivir. Hace más de 10 años, que se dedica a este negocio cuando dio inicio fue por su familia, pues anteriormente su mama se hacía cargo, fue así que Néstor aprendió de este negocio por tal razón él decide establecer su propio negocio en su vivienda. El solicita este financiamiento para la compra de cerdos. Desea construir 2 cuartos en su vivienda.
texts.en: Néstor is 31 years old. He buys and sells pigs. This type of business is very popular in our country, because most people utilize this as a way of surviving. He started in this business 10 years ago when he got the idea from his family . His mother used to do this, and that’s how Néstor learned the business and why he decided to establish his own business at his house. He is requesting this loan to buy to pigs. He would like to build two rooms onto his house.

loans.use: Working capital to buy pigs

loans.name: Las Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
LAS EMPRENDEDORAS” es un grupo formado por 10 socios la mayoría de ellos viven en puente piedra un lugar al norte de Lima  que se caracteriza por su gente trabajadora y emprendedora,  el Sr. Roque es una clara muestra de ello ya que por mucho tiempo se dedica al negocio de la panadería y pastelería el se dedica a preparar todo tipo de pasteles y los  reparte a sus clientes  que  ha ganado en todo este tiempo, el negocio de la panadería tiene épocas muy buenas por ejemplo en fiestas prepara  panetones y turrones lo que le deja buenas ganancias  cuando la temporada baja  se dedica  al transporte urbano ya que con sus ahorros pudo comprar una combi para hacer transporte urbano esto le permite otra entrada mas para darle lo mejor a su familia,  mas adelante quiere invertir en un negocio que aun esta en proyecto ahora  usara su préstamo para comprar insumos de panadería  como harina, azúcar y levaduras  el Sr. Roque quiere seguir avanzando y crecer en lo que a su negocio se refiere.

* El Sr.Roque es el 7mo, esta vestido con camisa a cuadros.
texts.en:
LAS EMPRENDEDORAS is a group made up of 10 members.  The majority of them live in Puente Piedra, a district to the north of Lima that is characterized by its hard-working and enterprising people.  

Senor Roque is a good example since he spends most of his time working in his bakery and pastry shop.  Here he prepares all types of pastries that he sells to the customers that he has earned over time.  The bakery has good times.   For example, for parties he prepares panetones [a type of sweet bread] and turrones [a traditional Peruvian dessert] which bring in a decent income.  During the low season he works in urban transportation because with his savings he was able to buy a combi (microbus).  This gives him access to another way to make money so that he can give his family the best.  Later he wants to invest in another business that is still in the early draft stages.  Right now he will use the loan to purchase items for his bakery such as flour, sugar and yeast.  

Señor Roque wants to continue advancing and growing his current business.  *Señor Roque is the seventh person in the picture and is wearing the plaid shirt.

loans.use: To purchase flour, sugar and yeast

loans.name: Las Exitosas Group

texts.es:
Sandra se siente muy feliz porque pudo concretar  lo que tanto ansiaba tener su propio negocio   fue su hermana quien la animo a realizar su sueño, después de verla  trabajar en las calles informalmente  lo cual implicaba dejar a sus hijos  solos y muchos riesgos en las calles,  es así que empezaron  habilitando un lugar  en su misma casa  para poner el negocio   en su bazar  ofrecen todo tipo de prendas de vestir y accesorios para damas, niños y caballeros . Por la variedad que ofrecen y la facilidad de pago  han logrado ganar clientela y esperan seguir creciendo, en la actualidad esta inmersa en la campaña escolar, su préstamo lo va a invertir en la compra de uniformes escolares como chompas, camisas, blusas, medias, pantalones y faldas.  Para mas adelante esta pensando incorporar  la venta de zapatos, gracias a su trabajo es que ella puede ayudar  en la manutención del hogar, por otro lado pertenecer al grupo” LAS EXITOSAS”  le da la oportunidad de seguir creciendo actualmente es la secretaria del grupo que esta formado por  07 socias.

  * Sandra es la tercera de las paradas.
texts.en:
Sandra feels very happy for finally obtaining what she always longed for: her own business.  Her sister encouraged her to fulfill her dreams after seeing her work informally selling items in the streets which forced her to leave her children and run the risk of working in the streets.  They began making the arrangement to run a small store out of their own home; they offer all types of clothing and accessories for men, women and children.  Due to the variety of goods they offer and the good prices, they have earned a loyal clientele and they hope to continue growing.  Right now, the school year is beginning so she needs this loan to buy school uniforms like sweaters, shirts, blouses, socks, pants and skirts.  In the future, she would like to begin selling shoes.  Thanks to the earnings from her store, she helps to pay for the household expenses.  She belongs to and is the secretary of the Las Exitosas group, made up of 7 women.

* Sandra is the 3 woman standing

loans.use: COMPRA DE UNIFORMES ESCOLARES

loans.name: Rene

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “PATRON SAN SEBASTIAN”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac, provincia de Cusco, Departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr: Rene; El socio tiene 48 años de edad, el socio es casado, el socio trabaja en el I.N.C (Instituto Nacional de Cultura), y también tiene un taller de carpintería, el socio tiene este taller porque es su pasión; el socio tiene 2 hijos; el socio desea en esta oportunidad el crédito para invertir  en la carpintería y poder comprar una maquinaria para la carpintería. el socio requiere el préstamo para uso personal.

El socio está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Rene belongs to the Patron San Sebastian village bank, located in the Huanchac district of Cusco, Peru.

Rene is 48 years old, married, and works in the National Institute of Culture; he also runs a small carpentry shop which is his passion.  He has 2 children.  He would like to use this loan to invest in his carpentry workshop and buy machinery for it.  This is for her own personal use.

He is happy for the opportunity to receive this loan and he promises to make his payments on time.

loans.use: Personal use

loans.name: Bolivia Group

texts.es:
El Banco comunal BOLIVIA, en su Secuencia 13, está formado por 10 clientes, la mayoría D. las socias pertenecen a la Zona D. Pampahasi, que están ubicados por los alrededores D. la oficina D. Emprender las socias se dedican a la venta D. diversos productos como ser, D. ropa, carteras, cosméticos, venta D. comida. En la secuencia anterior todas cancelaron a excepción D. dos socias que pagaron con sus ahorros debido que 
Yolanda  Socia que asume el cargo D. presidenta del banco, se dedica a la venta D. pescado en la misma zona  cuenta esta actividad hace 10 años, el préstamo esta destinado a incrementar su capital, comprando productos para su venta. Casada con el señor Néstor tiene tres hijos. Asimismo, la socia Yolanda nos cuenta que, cuando ingreso a Emprender el muro D. su casa se estaba por caer, y con los créditos D. emprender realizo el arreglo D. su vivienda el cual ella esta agradecida.
Es una D. las representantes en su banco comunal, que ha sido elegida para el cargo por su  responsabilidad que ha demostrado dentro del banco como garante y como compañera D. grupo. 
Nadia, es elegida como tesorera, se dedica a la confección y venta D. ropa. El préstamo esta destinado para incrementar su capital. Soltera tiene un hijo, vive con sus familiares en la zona D. Pampahasi. Su meta es tener su propia microempresa y realizar sus ventas al por mayor.
 Juan es elegido como tesorero  es una persona bastante responsable  ayuda a su madre con los gastos D. la casa  el trabaja el es un joven soltero  trabaja como chofer con la movilidad D. su mama con el dinero del credito realizara el mantenimiento D. su movilidad.
Todas las socias son personas responsables y trabajadoras que en muchos casos sacan adelante a sus familias solas, están agradecidos con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
The Bolivia village bank is in its 13 phase and is maD. up of 10 partners.  Most of the partners live in the Pampahasi area which is located close to the Emprender office.  The partners sell varoius products such as clothing, wallets, cosmetics, food, etc.  In the prior phase, all of the members paid back their debt except for 2 who paid with their savings.  Yolanda has become the new president of the group; she has sold fish in the area for the past 10 years.  The loan will be used to increase their working capital, buying more products for them to sell.  Yolanda is married to Nestor with whom she has 3 children.  When she started working with Emprender, the walls of her home were about to fall down, but with the loans she received, she was able to fix her home and she is grateful for that.

She was elected president because she has shown responsibility in the group as both the treasurer and a group member.
