Nadia has been elected treasurer; she works making and selling clothing.  She will use the loan to increase her working capital.  She is single but has a son; she lives with her relatives in the Pampahasi area.  Her goal is to run her own small business and become a wholesaler.

Juan was also elected treasurer and is a very responsible person; he helps his mother with the household expenses.  He works driving the car that his mother owns.  He will use money from the loan to do maintenance on the car.

All the group members are very responsible people who work hard; many of them are the only source of income for their families.  They are grateful for the support they are receiving.

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Carla

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “PATRON SAN SEBASTIAN”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac, provincia de Cusco, Departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Carla; La socia tiene 45 años de edad, la socia es casada, la socia trabaja  en el gobierno regional como personal administrativo y paralelamente a esto ella vende los productos de la empresa Omnilife, ella nos comenta que dicha empresa es de salud y y producen sustancias alimenticias, la socia nos comenta que los productos de esta empresa son muy cotizados por el público, la socia desea el crédito para invertir en la compra de productos de esta empresa y seguir vendiendo.

La socia está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Carla belongs to the “Patron San Sebastian” Communal Bank, which is located in the district of Huanchac, in the province of Cusco, in the department of Cusco.
Carla is 45 years old, married and works for the regional government as an administrative assistant. She also sells products made by Omnilife, a health food company that makes nutritional supplements. Carla says that the company’s products are very popular. She wants the loan to buy Omnilife products for her to continue selling.
She is happy with the provided loan and is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: Purchase of nutritional supplements

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “PATRON SAN SEBASTIAN”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac, provincia de Cusco, Departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Ana; La socia tiene 47 años de edad, la socia es casada,  y tiene 2 hijos; la socia administra un hospedaje llamado Mamaqueta, este hospedaje es de su madre y ella lo administra, el hospedaje se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Abancay en el distrito de Cachora a unas horas del complejo arqueológico de Choquequirao; en plena ceja de selva; la socia y su mamá son las encargadas y dueñas de este hospedaje, ellas aprovechan esta época de lluvias para remodelar todo el hospedaje y comenzar la temporada en el mes de abril. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la remodelación de hospedaje.

La socia está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Ana is a member of the “PATRON SAN SEBASTIAN” community bank which is located in Huanchac district, in Cusco province, in Cusco department.

Ana is 47 years old, married, and has 2 children.  Her business is a guest house called 'Mamaqueta'.  It belongs to her mother and she runs it.  The guest house is located in Abancay province, in Cachora district, some hours from the archaeological complex of Choquequirao, in the middle of the jungle.  Ana and her mom are in charge of this guest house and they own it.  They are taking advantage of the rainy season to remodel their guest house so that they can start the season in April.  

Ana is requesting this loan to invest in remodeling her guest house.  She is happy to be receiving her loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: To invest in remodeling her guest house

loans.name: Mujeres De Chilcatotoras (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Mujeres de Chilcatotoras esta conformado por 12 mujeres que en su mayoría se dedican al trabajo en el campo como la agricultura y ganadería, trabajos que les permiten estar cerca de sus hijos para cuidarlos y también aportan a la economía de sus hogares. Viven por la comunidad de Chilcatotoras que  pertenece a la parroquia de Tarqui, parroquia es de clima frió y se caracteriza por ser una zona ganadera y agrícola, su gente es muy amable y carismática. 

La Señora. Carmen Rocío L. vive por la comunidad de Chilcatotoras, se encuentra en su tercer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y fue  invitada por una amiga.
Tiene 20 años de edad, vive en unión libre y ha concebido 2 hijos de 2 y 1 año de edad. Su esposo labora en la construcción como albañil, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven en casa de su mamá compartiendo los gastos.
La Señora. Carmen Rocío se dedica al cuidado de sus hijos que aun están pequeños, a los quehaceres de su hogar y a la cría de animales como: borregos y cuyes a los que los vende cuando tiene alguna necesidad económica.
El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de cuyes para continuar con este negocio. Su meta es tener su casa propia para vivir con su familia.

La Señora. Susana Angelica G. vive por la comunidad de Chilcatotoras, tiene 27 de años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijos de 6 y 4 años de edad, su primer hijo estudia en una escuelita de la comunidad. Su esposo labora como albañil y con el trabajo conyugal han construido su casa propia.
Doña Susana Angelica se encuentra en su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue invitada por una amiga. Se dedica a la cría de animales como: gallinas, chanchos y ganado, la leche que obtiene de sus vacas vende a los carros lecheros que hay por el sector, esta actividad la desempeña hace 4 años.
El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de abono para fertilizar sus potreros. Su meta es terminar  su casa ya que aun le faltan algunos arreglos.
texts.en:
The 'Mujeres de Chilcatotoras' (Women of Chilcatotoras) community bank is made up of 12 women who mainly work in agriculture and livestock raising.  These jobs allow them to be near their children, in order to look after them and contribute to their family finances.  They live in the community of Chilcatotoras, in the parish of Taqui.  This parish has a cold climate and is known as an area that is dedicated to agriculture and livestock raising.  The people are kind and charismatic.

Carmen Rocío L. lives in the community of Chilcatotoras.  This is the third loan that she has accessed through her community bank.  She was invited to join the community bank by her friend.

Carmen is 20 years old.  She lives with her partner and has 2 children aged 2 and 1.  Her husband works in the construction industry as a bricklayer.  They don't own their own home but live in her mom's house, sharing expenses.

Carmen Rocío looks after her children who are still young.  She also takes care of her household chores and raises animals such as lambs and guinea pigs.  She sells these animals when she has a financial need to do so.

Carmen Rocío will invest her loan money in buying guinea pigs in order to continue in her business.  Her goal is to own her own home to live in together with her family.

Susana Angelica G. lives in the community of Chilcatotoras.  She is 27 years old, married, and has 2 children aged 6 and 4.  Her eldest child attends the local elementary school.  Her husband works as a construction worker and together they have managed to build their own home.  

Susana Angelica is taking her first loan through her community bank.  She was invited to join by a friend.  Her business is raising animals such as hens, pigs and cattle.  She sells the milk that she obtains from her cows to milk floats in the area.  She has been in this business for 4 years.  She will invest her loan money in buying manure to fertilize her pastures.  Her goal is to finish building her home since she still has some work to carry out.

loans.use: To buy guinea pigs and manure.

loans.name: Mirella Marina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “PATRON SAN SEBASTIAN”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac, provincia de Cusco, Departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Mirella; La socia tiene 37 años de edad, la socia es soltera,  y tiene 2 hijos (el menor de 6 años de edad);  la socia es arquitecta de profesión y realiza diversos proyectos, ella desea invertir el préstamo de este banco en la compra de maquinas y de papel, ella desea hacer los planos y diseños y para lo cual requiere una máquina y papeles en diferentes tamaños. La socia invertirá el préstamo en la compra de una máquin y papeles.

La socia está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Mirella is a member of the “PATRON SAN SEBASTIAN” community bank which is located in Huanchac district, in Cusco province, in Cusco department.

Mirella is 37 years old, single, and has two children (her youngest is 6 years old).  She is an architect by profession and carries out a number of projects.  She would like to invest her loan in buying machines and paper.  She would like to make plans and designs, for which she needs a machine and different sizes of paper.  She will invest her loan in buying a machine and papers.

Mirella is happy to be receiving her loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: To buy a machine and papers

loans.name: Alfredo Sandro

texts.es: El señor Alfredo, se dedica al transporte en radio taxi, es una persona joven, tiene dos hijos mellizos, la esposa tiene la venta de carne, y por el momento se encuentra de viaje, ambos son parientes de un cliente antiguo y bueno, el joven invertirá en la compra de repuestos, como llantas y radio de comunicación para su transporte, ellos viven por la zona de peña azul, es una pareja joven y responsable que trabajan mucho por el bienestar de su hijo, su deseo del Sr. Alfredo desea poder comprarse su casita y así brindar mayor comodidad a su familia, esta agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Alfredo works for a radio taxi business.  He is a young man with twin children.  His wife sells meat and, at the moment, she is traveling.  They are both relatives of a respectable, long-standing client.  This young man will invest his loan in buying spare parts such as tires and a two-way radio for his vehicle.  Alfredo and his wife live in Peña Azul.  They are a young and responsible couple who work hard for the well-being of their children.  Alfredo's wish is to be able to buy his own house and thereby provide his family with better comfort.  He is grateful to the institution for the support with which they have provided him.

loans.use: To buy spare parts

loans.name: Maria Del Socorro

texts.es:
María del Socorro tiene 45 años de edad, es casada y reside junto a su esposo y sus hijos en el caserío Hualtaco a 10 km del distrito de Tambogrande, un distrito agrícola que se encuentra situado en la región Piura, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Ella cuenta con un pequeño establecimiento en su domicilio donde ofrece diversas golosinas a sus clientes y vecinos. El negocio cuenta con muy buena acogida desde hace cuatro años, sobretodo porque se encuentra ubicado en una zona céntrica. Adicionalmente comercializa productos de belleza por catálogo entre los clientes que llegan a su tienda. El negocio le hace sentir bastante activa y con las ganancias que obtiene se encarga de sacar adelante a su familia.

María del Socorro desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más productos (golosinas y productos de belleza). Por ello ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
María del Socorro is 45 years old. She is married and lives with her husband and children in the town of Hualtaco, 10 kilometers from the district of Tambogrande. It is an agricultural region that is located in the region of Piura, more than four hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the region of Lambayeque.

She has a small business in her house where she sells a variety of the sweets to her customers and neighbors. The business has had a good client base for four years because it is located in a central area. She also sells beauty products from catalogs to the customers who come to her store. The business makes her feel very active and with her earnings, she supports her family.

María del Socorro would like to expand her business by buying more products (sweets and beauty products). To do this, she has requested a loan of PEN 1,000.00 from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: To buy more beauty products and sweets for her business.

loans.name: Yanis Del Carmen

texts.es:
En el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Mujeres Organizadas. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños y que son reconocidos en todo el país.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora Yanis, ella tiene 46 años de edad, está casada y tiene una hija de 14 años que es su vida y a la cual cuida mucho, ella está en tercer año de colegio. Su marido es comerciante. Ella es fundadora del Banco Comunal y está muy contenta ya que gracias a los créditos a podido aumentar su negocio.

Ella y su marido trabajan en la venta de frutas y legumbres, tienen un puesto en el mercado de Tarqui en Manta, trabajan todos los días, el desde las 5am hasta las 16h00 y ella llega un poco más tarde luego que su hija se va al colegio y solo trabaja hasta el medio día ya que su hija requiere de muchos cuidados, su mercadería la compran a comerciantes mayoristas que venden en el mercado y ciertos productos los llevan desde Rocafuerte.

Este crédito es para seguir invirtiendo en su negocio comprando frutas y legumbres. Sus sueños son tener una tienda en su casa y ver que su hija sea una gran profesional.
texts.en:
The members of the "Mujeres Organizadas" ["Organized Women"] Communal Bank meet every 15 days in the canton of Rocafuerte. It is a place known for the delicious sweets that locals prepare, which are known throughout the country.

This is where we find Ms. Yanis. She is 46 years old, married, and has one 14 year-old daughter who is her life. Her daughter is in her third year of high school and Yanis cares for her very much. Yanis' husband is a merchant. She is the founder of her communal bank and is very happy that, thanks to the loans she has received, she has been able to expand her business.

She and her husband work selling fruits and vegetables. They have a stand in the Tarqui Market in Manta and work every day. He works from 5 AM until 4PM and she starts a little later, when her daughter leaves for school, and only works until midday so that she can take care of her daughter. They buy their merchandise from wholesale merchants that sell in the market and they bring some products from Rocafuerte.

This loan will be used to continue investing in their business of buying fruits and vegetables. Yanis' dreams are to have a store in her house and to see her daughter become a great professional.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Emilia Apolonia

texts.es:
Emilia de 59 años, es una mujer trabajadora que realiza manualidades a base de fomix, papeles, y otras herramientas. 

Tiene muchas aspiraciones con su negocio ya que desea seguir trabajando haciendo manualidades. Vende a un costo bajo muñecos con fomix, cartulina etc. Trabaja desde las 07h00am hasta las 22h00pm todos los días. En el futuro tiene muchas metas pero por ahora quiere continuar con su negocio comprando con el préstamo fomix, pinturas y materiales.
texts.en:
Emilia is a 59 year-old, hard-working woman who makes crafts using fomix, paper and other tools.

One day she hopes to  have her own business because she would like to continue in this line of work.  She sells dolls made from fomix and cardboard paper at very low prices.  She works from 7:00 a.m. to 10:00 p.m. every day.  She has many goals for the future but for now wants to continue with her activity by using the loan to buy fomix, paint and materials.

loans.use: To buy Fomix and paint

loans.name: Lady Vanessa

texts.es:
En el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Mujeres Organizadas. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños y que son reconocidos en todo el país.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora Lady, tiene 32 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos de 13, 9 y 6  años de edad  los mismos que estudian en colegio el mayor y en escuela los dos menores. El marido se dedica a la fabricación de ladrillos.

Nuestra socia se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta,  también vende artículos para el hogar como licuadoras, planchas, tostadoras, etc.  Esto los vende a través de cartillas. Trabaja  tres días a la semana unas seis horas por dia. Ella  deja a crédito los productos a sus clientes  y cobra cada quince días. Lo que es ropa la compra en Guayaquil y los productos para el hogar los recibe en una distribuidora en el centro de la ciudad de Portoviejo, nos cuenta que lleva 9 años que se dedica a esta actividad y que le ha ido más o menos bien.

Este crédito es para comprar pantalones, camisetas, blusas, ropa de niños, pero sobre todo ropa de temporada playera. Está en el Banco Comunal hace 4 años. Su sueño es tener su propio almacén.
texts.en:
Every two weeks the "Mujeres Organizadas" communal bank meets in the Rocafuente canton.  This location is well-known throughout the country for the delicious sweets made by the locals.

Here is where we meet Mrs. Lady who is 32 years old, has a common-law husband and three school-aged children, ages 13, 9 and 6.  Her husband works at a brick factory.

This member runs a door-to-door business selling all kinds of clothing and houshold items such as blenders, irons, toasters, etc.  She sells on a credit-based system, delivering the products and collecting payment every two weeks.  Her work hours are six a day, three days a week.  She buys clothing in Guayaquil and receives the other household merchandise from a distributor in downtown Portoviejo.  She has been active in this business for 9 years and says it has gone reasonably well.

The loan is to buy trousers, t-shirts, bloushes, children's clothing, especially for the beach season.  She's been in the communal bank for 4 years.  Her dream is to have her own store.

loans.use: To buy trousers, t-shirts, blouses and children's clothing for the beach season

loans.name: Maria Lucia

texts.es:
Maria de 42 años, tiene una tienda en su casa, es una mujer trabajadora que hace muchos años pudo tener su negocio. 
Comenzó con la tienda para poder mantener a su familia y ayudar a su esposo que es albañil, vendiendo en una carretilla recorriendo Duran completo el dinero para ubicar su pequeña tienda en su casa. Vende caramelos, cachitos, etc. Trabaja desde las 07h00am hasta las 19h00pm todos los días.  

Para poder seguir con su negocio quiere comprar arroz, azucar, lacteos, en el futuro quiere tener dinero para una tienda para su hijo.
texts.en:
Maria is 42 years old and runs a store out of her home.  She is a hard worker who has had her business for many years.

Originally, she set up the store to support her family and help her husband who is a bricklayer.  She began selling out of a cart throughout the streets in Duran and once she had enough money saved she established the store in her home.  She sells sweets, snacks, etc.  

She works from 7:00 a.m. to 7:00 p.m. every day.  In order to continue in her business she needs to buy rice, sugar and dairy products.  One of her goals for the future is to make enough money to set up a store for her son.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar and dairy products

loans.name: Froilan

texts.es:
Froilan es una madre de familia de 58 años de edad que reside junto a su familia en el distrito de Pacanga ubicado en la Provincia de Chepén zona agrícola  que pertenece a la Región de la Libertad ubicado a más de una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo. 

Ella cuenta con una pequeña bodega instalada en su domicilio. Allí ofrecen en venta a los vecinos y clientes de la zona diversos productos de consumo diario, entre productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes. El negocio cuenta con muy buena acogida, tiene una antigüedad de 6 años  por ello cuenta con clientela ya establecida.

La creciente demanda que la bodega de Froilan ha venido experimentando ha hecho que ella piense en ampliarla adquiriendo más productos. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.

Froilan es una mujer bastante trabajadora y de muy buen carácter, las personas que le conocen le tienen mucha estima y cariño.
texts.en:
Froilan is a 58 year-old mother who lives with her family in the district of Pacanga, in Chepén Province.  This is an agricultural area that belongs to the region of La Libertad, over an hour from the city of Chiclayo.

She has a small store set up in her home.  She sells basic goods and groceries to neighbors and customers in the area. The business is very popular, with an established customer base, and has been in existence for six years.

The growing demand that Froilan's store has been experiencing has made her think about expanding and stocking more products.  Therefore she decided to apply for a loan for 1500 PEN through Edpyme Alternativa.

Froilan is a very hard worker and has a good disposition.  People who know her hold her in very high esteem.

loans.use: To buy products

loans.name: Mercedes Esperanza

texts.es:
En el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Mujeres Organizadas. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños y que son reconocidos en todo el país.

La señora Mercedes  tiene 60 años de edad y hace varios años su compañero de toda su vida falleció y quedo viuda, pero de esta relación tuvo tres hijos que fueron su compañía y fortaleza en sus momentos difíciles. Uno de sus hijos aun vive con ella.

Ella tiene una pequeña tienda de productos de primera necesidad  en la que trabaja todos los días desde las 6am hasta las 19h00. También vende artículos de bazar y papelería.  Los productos de su tienda la compra en Portoviejo y Rocafuerte, también recibe en su local ciertos productos como gaseosas y otras bebidas. Nos dice que su tienda es herencia de sus padres que le dejaron cuando ellos fallecieron hace ya muchos años.

Este crédito lo va a invertir en comprar más productos para surtir su tienda. Está en el Banco Comunal hace ya tres años y le gusta por la ayuda que recibe con los créditos. Sus sueños son seguir trabajando y gozar de salud.
texts.en:
The "Mujeres Organizadas" communal bank meets every two weeks in the Rocafuerte canton.  This location is well-known throughout the country for the delicious sweets made by the locals.

Mrs. Mercedes is 60 years old.  Several years ago her partner of many years died, leaving her a widow.  But from this relationship she had three children who have accompanied her and given her strengh throughout the difficult times.  One son still lives with her.

She has a small grocery store in which she works every day from 6:00 a.m. to 7:00 p.m.  She also sells bazaar items and stationery materials.  She buys her products in Portoviejo and Rocafuerte.  Some of the products such as softdrinks and other beverages are delivered directly to her store.  She says she inherited the store from her parents when they died several years ago.

This loan will be used to buy more products for the store.  She's been a member of the communal bank for three years and likes it because of the help she receives through the loans.  Her dream is to continue working and staying healthy.

loans.use: To buy groceries, bazaar items and stationery goods

loans.name: Ivogne Mónica

texts.es:
En el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Mujeres Organizadas. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños y que son reconocidos en todo el país.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora Ivogne, tiene 46 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene una hija de 18 años de edad  la misma que este año espera ingresar a la universidad. El marido se dedica al comercio.

Se dedica junto a su esposo a la venta de mariscos, ellos muy de mañana se desplazan todos los días hasta las playas en Manta para comprar el mejor pescado y camarón para luego llevarlos al mercado de Rocafuerte para venderlos al por mayor a otros comerciantes y también o para vender al menudeo a los clientes que dia a dia asisten a este lugar para abastecerse para su alimentación diaria. Nos cuenta que llevan en esta actividad cerca a de 13 años y que les ha ido muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar pescado y camarón, para surtir a sus clientes. Está en el Banco Comunal hace 4 años y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos y por la ayuda que reciben  a través de estos créditos. Sus sueños son tener un carro para realizar mejor su negocio.
texts.en:
In the Rocafuerte canton the members of the Mujeres Organizadas [Organized Women] community bank meet every two weeks. This place is known for the delicious sweets prepared by the locals and are famous throughout the country.  

Here we find Ivogne. She is 46 years old and is in a common law marriage from which she has an 18 year old daughter, who is waiting to go to college. Her husband is a merchant.   

She and her husband sell seafood. Every morning they go to the beaches of Manta to buy the best fish and shrimp to then take them to the Rocafuerte market to sell them wholesale to other merchants and also to sell them retail to the customers who go their to get their daily food. She tells us that they have been doing this activity for close to 13 years and it has gone very well for her.

This loan is to buy fish and shrimp to supply her customers. She has been in the community bank for 4 years and she likes it because the loans are quick and because of the help they receive through these loans. Her dreams are to have a car and do her job better.

loans.use: To buy fish and shrimp

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “ALLIN MUJU”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac, provincia de Cusco, Departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Nelly; La socia tiene 42 años de edad, la socia es casada,  y tiene 2 hijos (19,5 años de edad); la socia tiene una unidad vehicular, ella tiene un bus que presta el servicio de transporte público, la socia tiene la ruta de Aeropuerto hacia el cementerio el Almudena, el bus pertenece a la empresa El Dorado; la socia desea el préstamo para poder invertir en la compra de piezas para el bus. La socia invertirá el préstamo en la compra piezas nuevas para el bus.

La socia está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the “ALLIN MUJU” community bank. The bank is located in the district of Huanchac, province and department of Cuzco.  

The member is named Nelly. She is 42 years old, married, and has 2 children, 19 and 5 years old.  The member has a public transportation bus. She has the route that goes from airport to the Almudena cementery. The bus belongs to the El Dorado business. The members wants the loan to invest in the purchase of new parts for the bus.

Nelly is happy with the loan and committed to making the payments according to schedule.

loans.use: The member will invest the loan in buying new parts for her bus.

loans.name: Iris Cecibel

texts.es:
En el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Mujeres Organizadas. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños y que son reconocidos en todo el país.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Iris, ella tiene 47 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene tres hijos, dos de ellos mayores que estudian en universidad y la menor de 17  años que estudian en colegio, todos aun viven con ella. Su esposo trabaja en una escuela en Higuerón.

Se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su casa cuando sus clientes necesitan algo. Trabaja tres días a la semana por las mañanas. Ella  deja a crédito los productos a sus clientes  y cobra cada fin de semana. Lo que es ropa la compra en Guayaquil, nos cuenta que lleva 1 año y seis meses y que empezó su negocio con el primer crédito y le ha ido bien.

Este crédito es para comprar ropa de temporada playera como trajes de baños de hombres y mujeres, camisetas, bermudas entre otras prendas. Está en el Banco Comunal hace 3 ciclos y le gusta porque a través de estos créditos empezó su negocio que le permite ganarse la vida honradamente. Sus sueños son tener su propio almacén.
texts.en:
The members of the Mujeres Organizadas Communal Bank meet every 15 days in the Rocafuerte Canton. This place is known for the delicious sweets that are prepared by the locals and are well-known throughout the country.

This is where we met Iris. She is 47 years old, married, and has three children from her marriage. The two older children are in college and the youngest is 17 years old and is in high school. They all still live with her. Her husband works at a school in Higuerón.

She works selling all types of clothing from door to door and from her house when her customers need something. She works three days each week in the mornings. She leaves the products with her customers on credit and collects the money each weekend. Iris buys the clothing in Guayaquil. She tells us that she has had the business for 1 year and 6 months, and she started her business with the first loan. It has gone well for her.

This loan is to purchase seasonal beach clothing like men’s and women’s bathing suits, T-shirts, Bermuda shorts, and other items. She has been with the communal bank for three loan cycles and she enjoys it because as a result of these loans, she started her business which allows her to earn a living honorably. Her dream is to have her own store.

loans.use: To buy bathing suits, T-shirts, Bermuda shorts, and other clothing items for the beach season.

loans.name: Angela

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Salud Y Vida. Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Angela, tiene 54 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual ha tenido dos hijos, los dos son mayores pero su hija  vive con ella, su marido es chofer.

Tiene un pequeño comedor en un local que es de su suegra que le dio para que instale su negocio sin cobrarle arriendo. Trabaja todos los días desde las 5am hasta las 14h00, solo preparar desayunos y almuerzos, su especialidad es el pescado apanado, nos cuenta que a sus clientes les encanta este plato tan delicioso, su hija le ayuda en su negocio, dice que ya son varios años y que le ha ido bien gracias a Dios.

Este crédito es para comprar productos que luego ella utiliza en la preparación de los alimentos. Como arroz, pescado, colas y otros ingredientes para la preparación de los alimentos. Es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal hace 13 años y le gusta porque los créditos le ayudan mucho.  Sus sueños son tener su propio local y un restaurante más grande.
texts.en:
The Banco Comunal Salud Y Vida (Health and Life Communal Bank) meets every fifteen days in the city of Charapoto. This locality is known for its traditional culture and also for being a few minutes from two of the province’s best beaches, San Jacinto and San Clemente.

Here, we become acquainted with señora Angela, age 54. She maintains a common law relationship in which she has had two children. Both are grown, but her daughter lives with her. Her husband works as a driver.

She has a small restaurant in a location belonging to her mother-in-law, who gave it to her without charging rent so that she could set up her business. She works every day from 5:00 a.m. until 2:00 p.m. preparing breakfasts and lunches only. Her specialty is fried fish. She tells us that her customers love this delicious dish. Her daughter helps her with the business. She says that they have been in business for several years and are doing well thanks to God.

This loan is for the purchase of products that she will use in the preparation of meals, such as rice, fish, colas and other ingredients. This member was one of the founders of the communal bank 13 years ago. She likes it because it has helped her a lot. Her dreams are to have her own place of business and a bigger restaurant.

loans.use: To purchase rice, fish, colas and more ingredients for the preparation of meals.

loans.name: Aida María

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Salud y Vida. Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora Aida, tiene 66 años de edad, está separada pero   de una relación que tuvo hace varios años  tiene cinco hijos todos mayores de edad, con ella vive uno de sus hijos que es un poco enfermo y es quien le acompaña.
 
Ella tiene una tienda de viveras de consumo en el mercado de Charapoto, en la cual vende todo tipo de productos  como: arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, etc. trabaja todos los días desde las 7am hasta las 20h00, nos cuenta que tiene su tienda ya por treinta años y que le encanta estar en ella. Los productos los compra en el centro de Portoviejo aunque la mayoría de sus productos los recibe en su local.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, embutidos y otros productos de primera necesidad. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio  y le gusta porque estos créditos son muy importantes para su negocio. Sus metas son seguir adelante y gozar de salud.
texts.en:
The members of the Salud y Vida Communal Bank meet every 15 days in the city of Charapoto. This place is known for its traditional culture and for being a few minutes from two of the best beaches in the province – San Jacinto and San Clemente.

This is where we met Aida. She is 66 years old and separated but she had five children from a marriage from several years ago. Her children are all adults and one of them lives with her, as he is a little sick and keeps her company.

She has a grocery store in the market of Charapoto where she sells all types of products like rice, sugar, oil, detergent, etc. She works every day from 7am to 8pm and tells us that she has had her store for thirty years and she loves being there. Aida buys her products in the center of Portoviejo, although she receives the majority of her products at her store.

She will use this loan to stock her store, buying rice, sugar, oil, detergents, cold cuts, and other basic needs products. She has been with the communal bank since the beginning and she likes it because these loans are very important for her business. Her goals are to continue getting ahead in life and to enjoy good health.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, oil, detergent, cold cuts, and other basic needs items.

loans.name: María

texts.es:
Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.

La señora María es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal y se desempeña como tesorera del mismo, nos cuenta que le gusta el Banco por la seriedad tanto de las socias que son responsables y de parte de la institución que siempre cumple con ellas. Tiene 42 años de edad, está casada y tiene dos hijos de 15 y 16 años que están en colegio, en la actualidad está en su quinto mes de embarazo de su tercer hijo. Su esposo es chofer de un tráiler.

Tiene un negocio de venta de tarjetas y cabinas telefónicas, además de brindar servicios de internet, el mismo que pudo poner gracias a un crédito anterior que le sirvió para comprar unas computadoras y poner este servicio. Trabaja todos los días desde las 8 am hasta las 20h00, dice que le va bien ya que por allí cerca no hay otro negocio como el suyo, también vende colas y helados Pingüino. Nos cuenta que son varios años que lleva con su negocio.

Es para esto que solicito este crédito para comprar tarjetas telefónicas y para pagar el mes de telefonía e internet para seguir brindando sus servicios. Sus metas seguir creciendo con su negocio, que sus hijos sean profesionales y que su bebe nazca sano.
texts.en:
This location is known for its traditional culture and for being just a few minutes from two of the province’s best beaches: San Jacinto and San Clemente.

María is a founding member of the communal bank and is its Treasurer.  She comments that she likes the bank because of the seriousness both of the members, who are responsible, and of the institution which always follows through with them.  

She is 42 years old, married and has two children who are 15 and 16 years of age and in school.  She is five months pregnant with her third child.  Her husband drives a semi truck.

She has a business selling phone cards and has phone booths and she also provides Internet access services.  She was able to open this business thanks to a prior loan that was used to buy computers and to set up the business.  She works every day from 8am until 8pm.  She says she does well because there is no other similar business in the area.  She also sells soft drinks and Pingüino brand ice cream treats.  She tells us that she’s been in business several years.

She asked for the loan to buy phone cards and to pay the monthly telephone and Internet fees in order to continue providing services.  Her goals are to continue growing in the business and that her children become professionals and that her baby is born healthy.

loans.use: To buy phone cards and to pay phone and Internet fees.

loans.name: Betty Cesilia

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Salud y Vida. Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora Betty, tiene 30 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos de 8, 4 y de 1 años el mayor  estudia en escuela. El marido trabaja en una piladora de arroz.

Tiene un negocio de venta de CD y de repuestos de carros, venden desde llantas hasta repuestos eléctricos, su negocio lo tiene en su casa desde hace tres años. Trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 18h00, trabaja sola ya que hasta la fecha ella se basta sola para atender a sus clientes. Los repuestos los compra en Portoviejo a una distribuidora que le venden a buen precio.

Este crédito lo va a emplear para comprar repuestos de todo tipo. Está en el Banco Comunal hace cuatro años y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos y sin tantos requisitos. Sus sueños son tener su casa propia ya que vive en casa de los suegros.
texts.en:
The members of the Salud y Vida Communal Bank meet every 15 days in the city of Charapoto. This place is known for its traditional culture and for being a few minutes from two of the best beaches in the province – San Jacinto and San Clemente.

This is where we met Betty. She is 30 years old and has a common-law marriage from which she has three children who are 8, 4, and 1. The oldest goes to school. Her husband works at a rice peeling business.

She has a business selling CDs and spare car parts and they sell things from tires to electric parts. She has had her business in her house for the past three years. Betty works every day from 8am to 6pm and she works alone, as she can manage to tend to her customers. She buys the spare parts in Portoviejo at a distributor that sells to her at a good price.

She will use this loan to purchase all types of spare parts. She has been with the communal bank for four years and she likes it because the loans are quick and have few requirements. Her dream is to have her own house, as she lives with her in-laws.

loans.use: To buy spare car parts

loans.name: Mercedes Elvira

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Salud y Vida. Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora Mercedes, tiene 41 años de edad y es madre soltera de  una hija de 8 años la misma que estudia en escuela, ella vive en casa de los padres.
 
Es una gran madre que para obtener sus propios recursos y darle a su hija lo mejor  se dedica a la venta de ropa por catalogo. Además de productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas).  También vende bebidas en un pequeño local que tiene en su casa. Trabaja todos los  días de la semana, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada semana o cada quince de acuerdo a lo que quieran sus clientes. Lleva con sus negocios cinco años, primero empezó con la venta de Yanbal y luego con los otros negocios los mismos que le han ayudado a salir adelante.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos, ropa y bebidas. Está en el Banco Comunal hace 10 años y le gusta porque estos créditos le han ayudado mucho en sus neghocios. Sus sueños son seguir adelante.
texts.en:
Every fortnight the 'Salud y Vida' (Health and Life) community bank meets in the city of Charapoto.  This city is known for its traditional culture and for the fact that it is located just a few minutes from two of the best beaches in the province: San Jacinto and San Clemente.

Here we meet 41 year-old Mercedes who is a single mother.  She has one daughter, aged 8, who is in school.  Mercedes lives in her parents' home.

Mercedes is a great mother who, in order to make her own money and provide her daughter with the best, has a business selling clothes and Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and ladies' accessories) through catalogs.  She also sells drinks from small premises located in her home.  Mercedes works every day of the week.  She leaves her products with her customers on credit and collects payment every week or fortnight, according to her customers' preference.  She has been in her businesses for five years.  She first started out selling Yanbal products and then added the other businesses which have helped her to get ahead in life.

Mercedes will use this loan to buy perfume, creams, cosmetics, clothes and drinks.  She has been a member of her community bank for 10 years and she likes being a member because the loans have helped her a lot in her businesses.  Her dream is to continue making progress.

loans.use: To buy perfume, creams, cosmetics, clothes and drinks

loans.name: María Dominga

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Salud y Vida. Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora María, tiene 56 años de edad, está separada pero   de una relación que tuvo hace varios años  tiene tres hijos todos mayores de edad, con ella vive la menor de sus hijas que es soltera sus otros hijos ya son casados.

Tiene un pequeño comedor en su casa, en el cual prepara deliciosos platos,  por el momento trabaja de lunes a sabados desde las 06h00 hasta las  a las 18h00, su hija le ayuda en su negocio, nos cuenta que su local recién lo abrió con el crédito que recibió el ciclo anterior, pero que siempre se ha dedicado a vender comida, antes lo hacía por pedidos pero ahora que ya puso su local espera que las cosas sean mucho mejores.

Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar arroz, carne, pescado y otros ingredientes para la preparación de los alimentos, además de ciertos utensilios que le hacían falta para su negocio. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio y le gusta porque los créditos le sacan de muchos apuros económicos.  Su sueño es tener un restaurante de lujo.
texts.en:
Every two weeks the “Salud y Vida“ communal bank meets in the city of Charapoto.  This area is known for its culture and tradition and also for being located only a few minutes from San Jacinto and San Clemente, two of the province’s major beaches.

Here we find 56 year old Maria.  She is separated but has three adult children from a relationship she had some years ago.  Her youngest daughter is single and lives with her and her other children are married.

She has a small restaurant in her home, where she prepares delicious dishes.  At the moment she works from Monday to Saturday from 6:00 am to 6:00 pm.  Her daughter helps her with her business.  [Maria] tells us that she recently opened her place with the help of the loan she received during the previous cycle, but that she has always sold food.  She used to do it to order, but now that she has opened her place, she expects things to get much better.

She will use the money from this loan to buy rice, meat, fish, and other ingredients that she will use to prepare her dishes.  She will also buy some utensils she needs for her business.  She’s been a member of the communal bank since the beginning and she enjoys it because the loans help her very much.  Her dream is to open a luxury restaurant someday.

loans.use: ingredients

loans.name: Ana Alexandra

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Salud y Vida. Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora Ana, tiene  30 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos de 8, 4 y 2 años, el mayor estudia en escuela. El marido tiene un taller de mecánica automotriz. Lleva en el Banco Comunal ya por 6 años y le gusta por la ayuda que recibe con los créditos.

Es una gran ama de casa que también se  dedica a la venta productos por catálogos de Avon y Yanbal (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas), trabaja todos los días ya sea en las mañanas o en las tardes cuando tenga tiempo libre ya que sus hijos están pequeños y a veces no hay con quien dejarlos, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y por pedidos deja a crédito y cobra semanalmente, lleva realizando esta actividad ya hace 11 años y le ha ido muy bien. Lo que más vende son los cosméticos y los perfumes.
 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar perfumes, bisutería, cosméticos, cremas y otros productos. Su sueño es tener su casa propia ya que donde vive es arrendado.
texts.en:
Every two weeks the “Salud y Vida“ communal bank meets in the city of Charapoto. This area is known for its culture and tradition and also for being located only a few minutes from San Jacinto and San Clemente, two of the province’s major beaches.

Here we find Ana 30 year old Ana.  She has three children, ages eight, four, and two.  The oldest attends school.  Her husband has an auto shop.  She has been part of the communal bank for six years and likes it because it helps her get loans.

She is a homemaker who also sells Avon and Yanbal products (beauty products, perfumes, and ladies accessories).  She works daily, whether in the mornings or evenings when she has some free time, since her children are still young and she has no one to leave them with.  She sells door to door and also takes orders.  She grants credit and collects weekly.  She's been doing this for 11 years and things are going well for her.  She sells mostly cosmetics and perfumes.

She will use the money from this loan to buy perfumes, costume jewelry, cosmetics, creams, and other products.  She dreams of having her own home one day because she currently rents.

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: María Teresa

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Salud y Vida. Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora María, tiene 60 años de edad, hace años su esposos falleció pero  de esa relación tuvo cinco hijos todos mayores de edad, con ella vive una hija con su esposo y dos hijos menores.

Nuestra amiga hace varios años trabajo en Pacifictel pero ya se jubilo, pero desde hace mucho se  dedica a la venta de productos de Avon y Yanbal (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas), trabaja tres  días a la semana en las mañanas, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y por pedidos deja a crédito y cobra cada quince días. Lo que más vende son los cosméticos y los perfumes.
 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar perfumes, bisutería, cosméticos, cremas y otros productos. Está en el Banco Comunal hace tres años y le gusta por la ayuda que recibe ella y sus compañeras a través de los créditos. Sus metas son tener un bazar.
texts.en:
Every two weeks the “Salud y Vida“ communal bank meets in the city of Charapoto. This area is known for its culture and tradition and also for being located only a few minutes from San Jacinto and San Clemente, two of the province’s major beaches.

Here we find 60 year old Maria.  Her husband passed away years ago, but she has five adult children from that relationship.  One of her daughters and her husband and two children live with her.

Our friend used to work for Pacifictel, but has since retired and now sells Avon and Yanabel (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and accessories for women).  She works three days a week in the morning, when she goes door to door and accepts orders.  She sells on credit and collects every two weeks.  Cosmetics and perfumes are her best sellers.

She will use the money from this loan to buy perfumes, costume jewelry, cosmetics, creams, and other products.  She has been part of the communal bank for three years and likes it because it helps her and her friends through the loan program.  Her goal is to open her own small store.

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Salud y Vida. Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.

La señora Nancy tiene 57 años de edad, está casada y tiene 4 hijos ya todos mayores de edad aunque todos viven con ella. Su esposo es agricultor.

Es modista desde muy joven, estudio corte y confección en la Academia Esperanza Sacoto. Donde aprendió a confeccionar todo tipo de ropa aunque lo que más le gusta es  hacer ropa de  mujer,  también hace camisas para hombre. Además tiene una tienda de víveres de consumo. Trabaja  todos los días cuando hay bastante trabajo  y una de sus hijas le ayuda. Su hijo también le ayuda más que todo con la tienda.
 
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar telas y productos para abastecer su tienda. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio y le gusta por los beneficios que recibe. Sus sueños son que sus negocios crezcan cada dia más y gozar de buena salud.
texts.en:
Every two weeks the “Salud y Vida“ communal bank meets in the city of Charapoto.  This area is known for its culture and tradition and also for being located only a few minutes from San Jacinto and San Clemente, two of the province’s major beaches.

Nancy is 57 years old.  She is married and has four adult children who all live with her.  Her husband is a farmer.

She’s been a fashion designer since she was a young lady, having studied clothes making at the Esperanza Sacoto Academy where she learned to make all kinds of clothing.  She mostly enjoys making women’s clothing, but also makes men’s shirts and also runs a grocery store.

She works every day and her daughter helps her when there is a lot of work to do.  Her son also helps, mostly with the store.

She will use the money from this loan to buy fabric and other products to stock her store.  She’s been part of the communal bank since the beginning and she enjoys it because of the benefits it gives her.  Her dream is to grow her business and enjoy the good life.

loans.use: to buy fabric and other products to stock her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Mudusu

texts.en:
Mudusu N. is 35 years old and lives in the town of Lugazi in the Mukono region of Uganda.  She is married and has two children.  One of her children is currently in school.  Mudusu  has a retail shop which she has had for less than one year.         

To help expand her business, Mudusu has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more sugar and soap for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Mudusu hopes to generate greater profits and buy food for the family.  In the future, Mudusu hopes to live a good life.

loans.use: to purchase more sugar and soap for resale

loans.name: Zuura's Group

texts.en:
Zuura J., 59, is a leader of this group. Her whole life was spent in a hometown of Balykchy, which is translated from Kyrgyz language as “fisherman”. The town used to be a major industrial and transportation center, but most of its activities stopped after the collapse of the Soviet Union. Zuura is one of 40 000 people, who stayed in a town regardless of the difficult economic times. Zuura pursued a major in medicine and has been curing people for a major portion of her life. She works in a diagnostic center of a local hospital, and gets paid 2,000 soms monthly, and receives additional help of 2,700 from social fund. Zuura lives with her husband and a 13 year old son. She applied for this loan to help push forward her husband’s business. It was started six years ago, when her husband invested all his return from driving a cab in acquisition of raw material for his new business. Zuura’s husband is very handy and makes various types of furniture, household appliances and trailers for trucks. Business is well-advanced now and the family already opened its own workshop. It made her husband’s work more comfortable and effective. The proceeded return of 8 000 soms unfortunately is not enough to accomplish all orders that he is receiving now. Therefore Zuura asks for a loan in order to purchase raw materials such as ironmongery, pipes, plywood and planks. 

       --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
								
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials

loans.name: Elmira's Group

texts.en:
Elmira T., 52, is a leader of this group. She lives in a village Bokonbaeva, named after a classical Kyrgyz writer. Elmira is married and has a seventeen-year-old son, who is getting ready to apply to college this year. This is a very important issue for Elmira, because she didn't have a chance to get a college degree and promised that it would never happen to her kids. Elmira believes that education will open new doors into the future for her son. She says she’s lucky to work at the same place as her husband. It allows her to spend more time with him and quickly solve various problems. She is employed as a janitor, while her husband is a security officer. Along with these jobs the family has livestock and resells them frequently. Four years of cattle resells has helped the family to make major repairs in the house and a shed. The revenue is usually spent on family needs and invested back in the business. Elmira and her group have know each other for a very long period, and are sure to repay the loan successfully. Elmira’s purpose for the loan is to invest these funds back in her business and buy some more cattle. She strongly hopes that she will soon be able to earn enough to pay her son’s tuition. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
								
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet N. is 25 years old and lives in the town of Lugazi in the Mukono region of Uganda.  She is married and has one child.  Her child is not currently in school.  Harriet has a business selling motor vehicle spare parts, which she has had for less than one year.         

To help expand her business, Harriet has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more spare parts for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Harriet hopes to generate greater profits and buy food.  In the future, Harriet hopes to be self-reliant and live a good life.

loans.use: to purchase more spare parts for resale

loans.name: Elnura's Group

texts.en:
Elnura B., 25, is the leader of this group.  Elnura is a young mother of two children ages 2 and 6 months. She and her husband have started cattle breeding and reselling 6 years ago.  A monthly salary from her husband was used to purchase a bull. Her husband’s family helps to takre care of cattle and resell it in a local farmyard, because Elnura stays busy with her kids. Her husband is a police officer and very committed to his work, and devotes all of his free time to looking after cattle. Elnura’s customer base is constantly increasing since she has a good reputation due to dedication and product quality.  She plans to use this loan to continue to meet customer demand and buy two more good healthy bulls. Elnura and her group thank the lenders for understanding her situation. She hopes to build a good working capital and become the most successful supplier of cattle in the region. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
								
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Festo

texts.en:
Festo M. is 40 years old and lives in the town of Kayunga in the Mukono region of Uganda.  He is married and has five children.  All of his children are currently in school.  Festo has a retail shop, which he has had for five years.         

To help expand his business, Festo has requested a loan of 1,600,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase soap for washing clothes and maize flour for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Festo hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children.  In the future, Festo hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase soap for washing clothes and maize flour for food for resale

loans.name: Odinakhon's Group

texts.en:
Odinakhon M., 20, is a leader of this group. Despite her young age, she managed to run the business for several years now. She found out about the loan from Kiva and was happy to tell her fellows about it. Odinakhon is single and lives with her parents, brother and a sister-in-law. Her mother is actively involved in agriculture, her father is a construction worker and her sister-in-law is a kindergarten teacher. Odinakhon says she inherited a strong and persistent personality from her mother. At the age of 17 she already knew best techniques for cultivating land and ways to get a rich harvest. At this moment Odinakhon is preparing the small piece of land that her family owns for sowing. She really hopes on good weather this year, because last year’s long winters and late spring destroyed most of her cultivation. The outcomes led to a poor harvest in fall, which raised only small amount of funds. She’s learned her lesson, and this year she will try to be more careful and follow the weather predictions. The history of the land goes far back to a period of fall of the Soviet Union back in 1991. During privatization, the family was given this land, which has become a major source of income for the entire family. This year she plans to sow seeds of cotton. Therefore she gathered her fellows and applied for this loan. 

       --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
								
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase seeds of cotton

loans.name: Sunday

texts.en: C. is currently in a business of selling alcohol.  She is 34 years old, a widow, and a mother to two children, one of which goes to school. C. is borrowing a loan to stock more alcohol to sell. She hopes to pay her children in school with extra profits from her business in the future.

loans.use: stock more alcohol to sell.

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en: N. is currently in the business of selling food in a hotel. She is 40 years old, a widow and has 3 children, none of whom go to school. N. is requesting a loan to increase her stock of food to sell in the hotel. She hopes to build a house with the extra profits from her business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more food to sell in a hotel

loans.name: Raisa's Group

texts.en:
Raisa B. is 50 years old and the leader of this group. She is a resident of a town called Karabalta, which lies on the Chu River in the northern part of Kyrgyzstan and has 70,000 residents. After Raisa got divorced several years ago, she was left with three children and a few heads of livestock that were the only source of income for the household. Now Raisa’s oldest daughter is 24 and lives separately with her own family. The second daughter found employment in a restaurant in the capital. Raisa also has a 14-year-old son who is financially dependent on her and helps with the livestock during his free time from studies. 

Raisa has a large household with a dry shed in the back yard. She provides her sheep and cows with as much hay and oat straw as they need. The town is rich with pastures, so the livestock has all it needs for a good health. Raisa inherited the cattle from her parents and plans to leave them to her children too. Recently she resold some of her cattle for a good deal and purchased some furniture for the house. She feels very lucky to have this business, because it helped her during the hardest financial period in her life. Raisa earns 6,800 soms monthly, which she invests back into her business. She gathered this group of entrepreneurs, because each of them needs financial assistance. She plans to spend her part of the loan on purchasing a good carpet for her house. 

       --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Kiva's partner, Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
								
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase a carpet for her house

loans.name: Ryskul's Group

texts.en:
Ryskul T., 24, is the leader of this group. Ryskul lives in a town called Karabalta with her husband and two children ages 5 and 3. Ryskul started her business career at a very young age and by this time has reached impressive outcomes. The couple has been involved in cattle breeding since they started living together. But three years ago they decided to quit this business and start something new. After reviewing the best options, and their own skills, Ryskul and her husband opened a small café.

The first challenge in making a business plan was choosing the location. There were too many cafes in their hometown, so they looked for a less competitive environment. The perfect spot was the busiest route in the country, connecting two major centers, Bishkek and Osh. Every day thousands of passenger buses and cars take this route. There are picturesque views and sightseeing, but the passengers complain of having a lack of places to stop for lunch. Ryskul and her husband sold all of their cattle and invested the revenue in building a café. It has been three years, and Ryskul’s expectations turned into reality. Ryskul is the chief cook and her husband is the manager and a caterer of all necessary supplies. The family was able to buy new furniture for their house and an automobile. The profits from the business have reached 40,000 monthly, but along with it the inflation and transportation costs have increased the café’s expenses. Ryskul is requesting a loan in order to buy some inputs and raw materials for running the café. If everything goes well, Ryskul dreams of opening another small shop near her café. 

       --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
								
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase inputs and raw materials for her cafe

loans.name: Wilberforce

texts.en:
Wilberforce M. is 38 years old and lives in the town of Kayunga in the Mukono region of Uganda. He is married and has four children. Three of his children are currently in school. Wilberforce has a butchery and sells meat. He has had the shop for less than one year.

To help expand his business, Wilberforce has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more meat for resale. With the help of a loan from BRAC, Wilberforce hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. In the future, Wilberforce hopes to improve on his business.

loans.use: To purchase more meat for resale

loans.name: Cholpon's Group

texts.en:
The most absorbing part of the “woman’s question” in the present time is the remedy for the varied sufferings of women who are without means of support. As yet, few are aware of how many sources of enterprise and industry lie open to women in areas directly connected with the family estate. 

Cholpon S., 37, is the leader of this group. She, like many other women in the country, was sure that there were very few employment opportunities for an uneducated women like her. The loan from Kiva helped her understand that she can invest needed funds in cattle breeding and qualify herself to superintend a dairy farm. Cholpon has small assets of cattle, but believes she is well trained for this business. She believes that the capital provided by Kiva lenders will be an investment that will become profitable with good management. She purchased some cattle two years ago for 3,000 soms because she knew it is the closest of all within reach for a woman with the proper abilities and training. She is also very interested in studying the care of domestic animals. She learned that cattle require great care especially when young, good food, warm and dry quarters, particularly in harsh wet winters. Cholpon is the mother of four children and satisfies their basic needs. Cholpon gathered and leads this group of like-minded fellows in order to request the loan for purchasing additional heads of livestock. 

       --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
								
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase additional livestock to grow her business

loans.name: Anna

texts.en: S. is currently in the business of selling biscuits, sweets and tea. She is 33 years old and married with 7 children, 3 of whom are in school. S. is requesting a loan to purchase more biscuits, sweets and tea to sell. She hopes to pay for her children's school fees with the extra profits from her business in the future.

loans.use: To increase her stock of biscuits, sweets and tea for sale

loans.name: Phiona

texts.en:
Phiona S. is 36 years old and lives in the town of Nakifuma in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is married and has three children. All of her children are currently in school. Phiona has had a retail shop for three years. She also has a second business of a motor bike.  

To help expand her business, Phiona has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase sugar and rice for resale. With the help of a loan from BRAC, Phiona hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. In the future, Phiona hopes to build a house.

loans.use: To purchase sugar and rice for resale

loans.name: Ihisa

texts.en: Ihisa is currently in a business of selling bed sheets. She is 19 years old and single. Ihisa borrowed a loan to stock more bed sheets to sell. In the future, she hopes to build a house for rent with extra profits from her business.

loans.use: To stock more bed sheets to sell

loans.name: Hafiza

texts.ru: Холманова Хафиза проживает в районе Шахринав. Возраст, 26 лет. Не замужем. Имеет среднее образование. Занимается животноводством.  Она разводит крупнорогатый скот в дальнейшем для продажи. Этим видом деятельности занимается уже два года. Кредит берет для закупа скота, чтобы увеличить их количество.
texts.en: Hafiza K. lives in the Shahrinav region. She is 26 years old. She is not married. Hafiza has secondary education and does animal husbandry. She breeds large cattle for future resale. She has been in this business for two years. She is taking out the loan to buy cattle and increase their headcount.

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Yangi

texts.en: Yangi is currently in a business of selling charcoal and peas. She is 28 years old, married to a soldier, with 5 children and 3 of them go to school. Yangi borrowed a loan to stock more charcoal and peas to sell. In the future, she hopes to build a house for rent with extra profits from her business.

loans.use: To stock more charcoal and peas to sell

loans.name: Diko

texts.en: Diko is currently in a business of selling food in a hotel. She is 29 years old, married to a businessman, with 4 children and all of them go to school. Diko borrowed a loan to stock more food to sell in a hotel. In the future, she hopes to build a house for rent with extra profits from her business.

loans.use: To stock more food to sell in a hotel

loans.name: Usufu

texts.en: K. is currently in a business of selling food stuffs like sugar, beans and maize. She is 45 years old, married, with 6 children and 3 of them go to school. K. borrowed a loan to stock more food stuffs to sell. In the future, she hopes to build a house for rent with extra profits from her business.

loans.use: To stock more food stuffs like sugar, beans and maize to sell

loans.name: Wasuk

texts.en: Wasuk is currently in a business of selling soft drinks and charcoal. She is 45 years old, married, with 5 children and all of them go to school. Wasuk borrowed a loan to stock more soft drinks and charcoal to sell. In the future, she hopes to pay for her children's schooling with extra profits from her business.

loans.use: To stock more soft drinks and charcoal to sell

loans.name: William

texts.en: R. is currently in a business of selling bed/pillow cases. She is 48 years old, divorced, with 7 children and 5 of them go to school. R. borrowed a loan to stock more bed/pillow cases to sell. In the future, she hopes to pay for her children's schooling with extra profits from her business.

loans.use: To stock more bed/pillow cases to sell

loans.name: Sarsembai

texts.ru:
Сарсембай Казыбеков родился в селе Акбашат (Жайылский район, Чуйская область, Кыргызстан). Женат и проживает с младшим сыном, снохой и внучкой.
Сарсембай родился в 1953 году, в простой и многодетной (5 сыновей) семье фермера. Отец занимался полеводством и животноводством, а мать была домохозяйкой. После окончания 10 классов Сарсембай поступил в училище на шофера грузовых автомашин и тракторов. Закончив учебу, устроился в родном колхозе на работу в качестве водителя. В 1973 году в возрасте 20 лет Сарсембай пошел служить в армию и, вернувшись, снова стал работать в родном колхозе. В 1977 году Сарсембай женился, а год спустя у него родилась дочь. Первое время Сарсембай с женой и дочкой жили у его родителей с братьями. Спустя некоторое время, колхоз, в котором он работал, выделил ему участок земли в родном селе под строительство дома, где со временем Сарсембай построил дом и все необходимые постройки. В 1980 году у него родилась еще одна дочь, пять лет спустя сын и еще через два года дочка. Семья росла, Сарсембай продолжал работать водителем,  а также, параллельно, он содержал скот и занимался полеводством. В 2006 году Сарсембаю удалось собрать немного денег и купить грузовую автомашину ЗИЛ, на которой он перевозит сельхоз продукцию и в свободное время предоставляет односельчанам услуги по перевозке грузов. К тому же, он ежегодно арендует около 10 гектаров земли, на которых выращивает сахарную свеклу, ячмень и клевер. Эта деятельность помогла Сарсембаю дать хорошее приданное для трех дочерей и женить сына. В данный момент, благодаря упорству и трудолюбию Сарсембая в хозяйстве имеется 2 дойных коровы, 1 бычок, 8 овец, а также грузовая автомашина ЗИЛ. Сарсембай планирует использовать кредит в 70,000 сом (KGS) для покупки удобрений и семян для посева.
В будущем, Сарсембай мечтает купить дом для сына, недалеко от своего дома. 
About Bai-Tushum and Partners Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population.
