loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more fresh fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more goods for his general store

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy some important items for her business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a shop for this business and improve it

loans.name: Malika

texts.en:
Malika K. is 31 and married. She was born and lived in the Republic of Tadjikistan and grew up in a large family of farmers. From early childhood she had to help her parents in the field where her family cultivated tomatoes, beets and peppers. At the age of 14, Malika’s family moved to Kyrgyzstan, where they continue the business of farming.
 
In 2002 Malika got married and soon became the mother of two children. In order to find a means of subsistence for her family, she decided to start her own business in cattle breeding. With the initial capital of 5,000 KGS, she managed to develop a farm with a monthly profit of 10,000 KGS from selling meat products. Being a very purposeful and positive person, Malika works hard to support her family.

Malika plans to use this loan of 100,000 KGS to increase the number of cattle. In the future, Malika is planning to give higher education to her children and purchase a car for her family.

Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading microfinance institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors. Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Raykan

texts.en:
Raykan T. is 47, married and has one child. She graduated as a seller and worked for a long time at the local consumer goods shop.

After privatization, she lost her job and decided to engage in her own business of selling socks. She started with the initial capital of only 500 KGS and managed to develop this activity into a monthly profit of 12,000 KGS. Today Raykan ‘s business includes  a wide assortment of socks and women and men’s footwear. 

Raykan has applied for a loan of 135,000 KGS to broaden the assortment of goods for sale. It will allow her to further develop her business and in the future, to give a higher education to her son.

Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading microfinance institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors. Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population.

loans.use: To broaden the assortment of footware for sale

loans.name: Darlina

texts.en:
Darlina is a rice farmer living in the town of Aurora, Agusan Del Sur with her family. She cultivates her land to plant and harvest rice crops. Darlina does her best to keep her crops healthy. She also wants to be able to sell the best kind of rice in her town. She works hard to sustain her family and have her own savings.

Darlina joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Darlina has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Darlina is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizer and other farm inputs.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and other farm inputs

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.en:
Ludmila is married, with a son and 2 daughters. She lives in the town of Privetnoye in the Kherson region. Ludmila owns several greenhouses where she grows cabbage, potatoes, radishes, squash and beets. She is an experienced farmer as she has been in this business for 15 years. Ludmila has invested about 100,000 grivnyas in the enterprise. Her average net profit amounts to 4,400 grivnyas a month.  

Ludmila is seeking a loan of 15,000 grivnyas to purchase seeds, wood, fertilizer and plastic film. She is planning ahead to make sure her greenhouses are equipped for the upcoming farming season to provide the proper environment for growing plants.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, polyethylene film, wood and fertilizer

loans.name: Yekaterina

texts.en:
Yekaterina is married, with 3 sons and 2 daughters. She lives in the small town of Privetnoye. Yekaterina grows early spring vegetables: Radishes, tomatoes, squash, cabbage, beets, onions and potatoes. She launched this enterprise 5 years ago.  She has already invested about 100,000 grivnyas in her business. Her net profit is about 4,000 grivnyas. 

Yekaterina is seeking a loan of 13,500 grivnyas to purchase seeds, wood, polyethylene film and fertilizer for her greenhouses. Yekaterina is planning to cover her greenhouses with new plastic film to keep them warm, which she relies on to nurture plants and help them thrive. She is hoping that the current loan will help her make a wise investment in her venture, and flourish in her endeavors.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, wood, polyethylene film and fertilizer

loans.name: Dieumbe

texts.fr: Madame Dieumbe D. est une femme de 38 ans qui évolue  activement dans le secteur  du commerce. Elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants dont l’âge  varie entre 5 et 17 ans. Elle voyage régulièrement  vers la Gambie ou vers la Mauritanie  pour  s’approvisionner  en  marchandises de toutes sortes  plus particulièrement  les tissus. Madame D.  a choisi cette activité dans le but de se procurer des revenus  et soutenir son mari dans la gestion des dépenses familiales. Elle  habite au quartier de la Médina mais est sociétaire de la caisse de Yoff depuis juillet 2008. Elle sollicite un crédit de 500 000 frs  prévu pour l’achat de marchandises en vue de renforcer son stock (achat de Bazin, thioub  et colliers). Son objectif est de développer son activité, augmenter ses bénéfices et compléter  son épargne en vue d’acquérir   un terrain.
texts.en: Mrs. Dieumbe D. is a 38 year-old woman who is actively involved in the retail sector. She is married and a mother of three children aged 5 to 17. She regularly travels  to Gambia or Mauritania to stock up on all sorts of goods, especially fabrics. Mrs. D. chose this activity to generate an income and support her husband in the management of the family's expenses. She lives in the Médina neighborhood, but has been a member of the Yoff branch since July 2008. She is requesting a loan for 500,000 XOF, earmarked to acquire merchandise and build up her stock (purchase of African brocade, thioub [an African traditional dyed fabric] and necklaces). Her objective is to expand her business, increase profits, and complement her savings in order to purchase some land.

loans.use: Merchandise purchase

loans.name: Las Americas (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Las Americas está formado por 6 mujeres y 1 hombre que son amigos y viven por distintas comunidades de la ciudad de Cuenca, lugares en donde se dedican a la agricultura y cría de animales, también laboran en la ciudad en diferentes actividades que las que les permiten aportar a la economía de sus hogares. Nuestras socias son mujeres trabajadoras, amables y carismáticas quienes en su lucha diaria ayudan a sus familias.

La Señora. Rosa Q. vive por la comunidad de Tutupali Chico, se encuentra en su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y fue invitada  por su prima quien  pertenece al grupo. Tiene 40 años, es casada y tiene 6 hijos de 19, 17, 16, 14, 12 y 11 años de edad, sus cuatro primeros hijos trabajan y ayudan en la economía del  hogar, sus 2 últimas hijas estudian en una escuela de la localidad. Su esposo labora como albañil, con el trabajo y sacrificio de los dos han logrado construir su casa propia. 
Doña Rosa se dedica a la agricultura, siembra verduras y hortalizas las que son para la venta y consumo, también cría animales como: gallinas, cuyes, chanchos, vacas y borregos que los vende cuando tiene alguna necesidad económica. El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos. Su meta es tener una tienda en su casa.

La Señora. Sandra A. vive por el sector del Cruce en la parroquia de Cumbe, tiene 19 años de edad, es soltera y tiene un bebé de 8 meses de edad. Vive en casa de su mamá con quien comparte los gastos del hogar, no tienen casa propia por lo que vive cuidando una casa.
La Señora Sandra hace 2 meses labora como empleada domestica y en su casa se dedica a la cría de cuyes. Se encuentra en su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y fue invitada por su prima, el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de más cuyes. Su sueño es  tener un taller para confeccionar ropa.
texts.en:
The communal bank Las Americas is made up of 6 women and 1 man, who are friends and live in different communities in Cuenca city. They work in agriculture and raise animals, and also work in the city in various activities which allow them to contribute to their household costs. These members are very hard working, friendly and charismatic women who strive each day to help their families. 

Señora Rosa Q. lives in the Tutupali Chico community. This is her first loan with the communal bank and she was invited by her cousin, who also belongs to the group. She is 40 years old, is married and has 6 children - 19, 17, 16, 14, 12 and 11 years old. Her four oldest children work and help with the household costs, and her two youngest study in a local school. Rosa's husband is a builder, and with both working and making sacrifices they have managed to build their own home.

Rosa works in agriculture, sowing vegetables and garden produce to sell and consume. She also breeds animals such as chickens, guinea pigs, pigs, cows and sheep, which she sells when she needs to. Rosa will use the money from this loan to purchase chickens. Her goal is to have a shop in her house. 

Sandra A. lives in the Cruce district in the Cumbe parish. She is 19, is single and has an 8 month old baby. She lives in her mother's house and they share the household costs. They don't have their own home as she looks after a house. Sandra has been working as a domestic employee for 2 months, and she also breeds guinea pigs in her house. This is her first loan with the communal bank, and she was invited to join by her cousin. The money from this loan will be used to purchase more guinea pigs. Her dream is to have a workshop where she makes clothes.

loans.use: To purchase chickens and guinea pigs.

loans.name: Pedrito

texts.en:
Pedrito C. is from the village of Nacional, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. He is 56 years old. Pedrito is married and has 2 adult-aged children. To make a living, Pedrito owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Pedrito has been engaged in his business for over 6 years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Pedrito joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Pedrito is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Pedrito from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: María Rosario

texts.es:
La Señora. María C. es socia del banco comunal Bankito Progresista, vive en el centro de la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad  fue nombrada patrimonio cultural de la humanidad en 1999 por su hermoso centro histórico, tiene muchos lugares en donde se puede admirar la naturaleza en todo su esplendor, su gente mantiene su cultura y tradiciones.

Doña María tiene 53 años, es viuda y tiene 5 hijos quienes son mayores de edad, casados e independientes. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.

La Señora María es comerciante, se dedica a la venta de verduras y hortalizas, esta actividad  la desempeña hace 18 años y trabaja de domingo a domingo desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche.

Su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de verduras para surtir más su negocio. Se encuentra en su cuarto crédito que realiza en el banco comunal. Su sueño es  conservar su salud para seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Mrs. María C. is a member of the Progresista communal bank.  She lives in downtown Cuenca, a city that was designated Cultural Heritage of Humanity in 1999 because of its beautiful, historic city center.  It has many places where nature’s beauty can be admired in its entire splendor; its residents keep its culture and traditions alive.

María is 53 years old, is a widow and has five adult children who are married and independent.  She does not own her house; she rents.

María is a merchant.  She sells vegetables and leafy green vegetables.  She’s been in this line of work for 18 years and works Sunday to Sunday from 6am until 8pm.

She will use her loan to buy vegetables to better stock her business.  She is in her 4th loan with the communal bank.  Her dream is to stay healthy to continue working.

loans.use: To buy vegetables.

loans.name: Manuela

texts.es:
La Señora. Manuela T. es socia del banco comunal Bankito Progresista, vive en el centro de la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad que fue nombrada patrimonio cultural de la humanidad en 1999 por su hermoso centro histórico, tiene muchos lugares en donde se puede admirar la naturaleza en todo su esplendor, su gente mantienen su cultura y tradiciones.

La Señora. Manuela tiene 32 años, es casada y tiene 3 hijos de 13, 9 y 5 años de edad, sus dos primeras hijas estudian en una escuela de la ciudad y su ultimo hijo en el jardín de infantes. Su esposo labora en una fábrica, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.
 
Doña Manuela es oriunda de la ciudad de Riobamba, llego a esta ciudad hace 15 años desde que se caso. Se dedica a la venta de frutas de temporada las mismas que vende ambulantemente.

El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de frutas para continuar con su negocio, se encuentra en su cuarto crédito que realiza en el banco comunal en el cual ha encontrado a muy buenas amigas con quienes comparte en cada reunión. Su sueño es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Manuela T. is a member of the Progresista communal bank.  She lives in downtown Cuenca, a city that was designated Cultural Heritage of Humanity in 1999 because of its beautiful, historic city center.  It has many places where nature can be admired in its entire splendor.  Its residents keep its culture and traditions alive.

Manuela is 32 years old, married and has three children who are 13, 9 and 5 years of age.  Her two oldest daughters go to school in the city and her youngest son is in Kindergarten.  Her husband is employed in a factory.  They do not own their house; they rent.

Manuela is originally from the city of Riobamba.  She arrived in Cuenca 15 years ago, since she married.  She’s a seasonal fruit vendor.

She will use the loan to buy fruit to stay in business.  She is in her 4th loan with the communal bank where she has made many friends with whom she shares at each meeting.  Her dream is to own a house.

loans.use: To buy fruit.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
La Señora Rosa C. es socia del banco comunal Bankito Progresista, vive en el centro de la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad que fue nombrada patrimonio cultural de la humanidad en 1999 por su hermoso centro histórico, tiene muchos lugares en donde se puede admirar la naturaleza en todo su esplendor, su gente mantienen su cultura y tradiciones.

La Señora Rosa tiene de 47 años, es casada y tiene un hijo de 20 años de edad quien trabaja y ayuda en la economía del hogar. Su esposo es comerciante, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.

Doña Rosa es oriunda de la provincia de Chimborazo, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca hace 12 años que se decidió venir por su negocio ya que al igual que su esposo se dedica a la venta ambulante  de ollas, gafas, sabanas, cobijas y muchos mas artículos, trabaja de domingo a domingo sin un horario fijo.

El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de más productos para ampliar su negocio. Es socia del banco comunal hace 2 años tiempo el que  ha hecho muy buenas amigas. Su meta es crecer en su negocio y  tener casa propia.
texts.en:
Rosa C. is a member of the 'Bankito Progresista' community bank.  She lives in Cuenca city center.  This city was named a World Heritage Site in 1999 for its beautiful historic center.  There are many places where you can admire its natural beauty in all its splendor.  The locals maintain their culture and traditions.  

Rosa is 47 years old.  She is married and has a 20 year-old son who works and helps with the household finances.  Her husgand is a salesman.  They don't own their own home and live in a rental home.

Rosa is originally from Chimborazo province.  She has lived in the city of Cuenca for 12 years.  She decided to come here for her business since, like her husband, she works selling pans, glasses, sheets, bedclothes and a lot of other products as an itinerant vendor.  She works from Sunday to Sunday and doesn't work regular hours.

Rosa will invest her loan money in buying more products to expand her business. She has been a member of her community bank for 2 years and has made some good friends.  Her goal is to grow in her business and to own her own home.

loans.use: To buy pans, sheets, bedclothes, glasses, etc.

loans.name: Marjorie Elena

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Soraya se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

La señora Marjorie es socia fundadora del Banco comunal, es la fisca de pagos del banco y le gusta por las facilidades para conseguir  los créditos. Tiene 31 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta  relación tiene una  hija de siete años la misma que  estudia en  escuela. Su marido está en el extranjero.

Trabaja de maestra por contrato en una escuela en Manta pero además de eso se dedica al comercio ya que  tiene un local en Montecristi donde vende de todo de acuerdo a la temporada, vende desde ropa, sabanas, juguetes, útiles escolares entre otras cosas, nos cuenta que ella aprovecha las épocas del año para vender sus productos. Trabaja todos los días en las tardes cuando está trabajando de maestra pero todo el dia en sus días libres ya que hay que aprovechar el mayor tiempo para ganar más clientela nos comenta. Algunas veces su papa le ayuda en su negocio.

Este crédito es para comprar ropa de temporada, además de útiles escolares ya que pronto se viene la época de entrada a clases. Sus sueños son tener un nombramiento del estado para  su cargo de maestra.
texts.en:
The Soraya communal bank meets every two weeks in Montecristi canton, renowned for its rich pre-colonial culture and its crafts that are famous both nationally and internationally.  It is a place famous for its Panama hats.

Marjorie is a founding member of the communal bank.  She is the bank’s Payments Overseer and she likes the bank because of the ease of getting loans.  She is 31 years old and is in a common law relationship.  She has a 7-year-old daughter who is in school.  Her husband is abroad.

She works as a contractual Teacher at a school in Manta but she’s also a merchant.  She has a locale in Montecristi where she sells all sorts of things according to the season.  She sells clothes, bed sheets, toys and school supplies, among others.  She tells us that she takes advantage of the seasons in a year to sell her items.  She works every day during the afternoon when she’s working as a teacher and all day on her days off because one has to take advantage of the most time to win over more customers, she tells us.  Sometimes her father helps her in the business.

This loan is to buy seasonal clothing as well as school supplies because the new school term is fast approaching.  Her dream is to secure a state teaching position.

loans.use: To buy seasonal clothing and school supplies.

loans.name: María Karina

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Soraya  se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía, que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

Aquí conocimos a María, tiene 27 años de edad y está  soltera. Ella alquila un departamento junto con su prima, estudia un diplomado en la ULEAN y además trabaja en un colegio particular. Lleva en el Banco Comunal ya cuatro ciclos y le gusta porque a través de estos créditos ella puede en cierta parte financiar su negocio y así poder salir adelante.

Se dedica a la venta productos Yanbal (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja todos los días desde las 8h30 hasta las 13h00 en su colegio y en las tardes recorre la ciudad para enseñar sus productos, entregar y realizar los cobros ya que deja a crédito y cobra semanalmente, lleva siete años que se dedica a esta actividad y lo que más vende son los cosméticos y los perfumes.
 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar perfumes, bisutería, cosméticos, cremas y otros productos. Sus sueños son  terminar sus estudios.
texts.en:
The Soraya Microfinance Group gets together every two weeks in the Montecristi canton, known for its rich, pre-colonial culture and for its world renown handicrafts, such as the famous toquilla straw (Panama) hats.

This is where we met Maria, a 27-year-old single woman who rents an apartment with her cousin and is currently earning a certificate from the Laica Eloy Alfaro de Manabí University while working at a private school. She has been in the group for four loan cycles, and she likes it because she is able to both finance her business and get ahead with these loans.

She sells Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, fragrances, and women's fashion jewelry). She works every day from 8:30am until 1:00pm at the school and in the afternoon, she walks around town selling and delivering products, as well as billing customers because she gives them credit and gets paid weekly. She has been in business for seven years, and her most popular products are cosmetics and fragrances.

She will use this loan to purchase fragrances, fashion jewelry, cosmetics, lotions, and other products. She dreams of finishing her studies.

loans.use: Purchase fragrances, lotions, cosmetics, fashion jewelry, etc.

loans.name: Deici Vicenta

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Soraya  se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía, que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

La señora Deici es socia fundadora de éste banco Comunal y le gusta por las comodidades para los pagos. Tiene  55 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene siete hijos, seis de los cuales ya son mayores de edad y el menor de 14 años, tres de sus hijos aun viven con ella y el menor estudia en el colegio. Su esposo es maestro de una escuela de la localidad.

Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo en su casa donde tiene un pequeño local, nos cuenta que la mayor parte de sus ventas son a través de pedidos que sus clientes realizan con anticipación. Trabaja todos los días, deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada quince días. Su mercadería se la traen desde Perú o Colombia y nos cuenta que son 15 años que se dedica a esta actividad.

Este crédito es para comprar pantalones, camisetas, blusas, ropa de niños, interiores, entre otras prendas. Sus sueños son tener un gran almacén.
texts.en:
The Soraya Microfinance Group gets together every two weeks in the Montecristi canton, known for its rich, pre-colonial culture and for its world renowned handicrafts, such as the famous toquilla straw (Panama) hats.
Ms. Deici is a founding member of the group, and she likes it for the ease with which one can make payments. She is a 55-year-old married mother of seven children, six of whom are grown up, and one is 14 years old. Three of her children still live with her, while the youngest is currently in school. Her husband is a teacher at a local school. 
She sells all types of apparel from home, where she has a small business space. She states that most of her sales are done by special pre-order. She works every day, accepting credit from her customers and billing them bi-weekly. Her merchandise is brought over from Peru or Colombia, and she states that she has been in the business for 15 years. 
This loan will be used to purchase pants, shirts, blouses, children's apparel, underwear, and other garments. She dreams of owning a big warehouse.

loans.use: To purchase pants, shirts, blouses, children's apparel, and undergarmets

loans.name: Rosa Esperanza

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Soraya se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía, que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora Rosa, tiene 45 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cuatro hijos,  dos mayores, uno de 16 que estudia en el colegio y una bebé de 1año y 8 meses. El marido es comerciante de mariscos.

Se dedica al comercio de artículos de bazar, juguetes, ropa entre otras cosas, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta para lo cual recorre toda la ciudad de Montecristi. Trabaja los días viernes, sabados y domingos desde las 8h00   hasta las 14h00, deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra todos los miércoles. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Guayaquil. Ya son dos años que se dedica a esta actividad y  le ha ido bien en su negocio.

Este crédito es para comprar ropa, artículos de bazar y juguetes. Lleva en el Banco Comunal ya por cuatro ciclos y le gusta por la facilidad que brinda la institución. Sus sueños son que sus hijos estén bien y gozar de buena salud.
texts.en:
The Soraya Microfinance Group gets together every two weeks in the Montecristi canton, known for its rich, pre-colonial culture and for its world renown handicrafts, such as the famous toquilla straw (Panama) hats.

This is where we met Ms. Rosa, a 45-year-old woman with a live-in partner and 4 children: 2 adults, a 16-year-old in high school, and a baby of a year and eight months. Her partner is a seafood merchant.

She sells general goods, toys, and apparel, among other products, for a living. She sells her merchandise door-to-door in the city of Montecristi. She works Fridays, Saturdays, and Sundays from 8:00am until 2:00pm, accepting credit from her customers and billing them every Wednesday. She obtains her merchandise in Guayaquil. She has been in business for two years, and she has prospered so far.

This loan is for purchasing clothing, general goods, and toys. She has been in this microfinance group for four loan cycles, and she likes it because it is easy to qualify. She wishes for her children's well-being and for good health.

loans.use: to purchase clothing, general goods, and toys

loans.name: Ricsy Monserrate

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Soraya  se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía, que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

La señora Ricsy es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta porque los créditos son seguros y puntuales, es la presidenta del banco. Tiene 33 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre  y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 12 y 9 años los mismos que  estudian en  escuela y colegio. Su marido está en el extranjero.

Nuestra socia tiene un local en el cual presta el servicio de cabinas telefónicas donde vende tarjetas y recargas, además de esto también tiene unas vitrinas en las cuales vende ropa de todo tipo, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y también en su local. Trabaja todos los días en sus cabinas desde las 8h00 hasta las 22h00, deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada quince días. Su mercadería  la va a compra a Guayaquil cada vez que necesita, nos cuenta que son 4 años que se dedica a esta actividad.

Este crédito es para comprar pantalones, camisetas, blusas, tarjetas y recargas telefónicas. Sus metas son tener un karaoke.
texts.en:
The Soraya Microfinance Group gets together every two weeks in the Montecristi canton, known for its rich, pre-colonial culture and for its world renown handicrafts, such as the famous toquilla straw (Panama) hats.

Ms. Ricsy is the founding member and president of the group. She likes this group because one is sure to get a loan punctually. She is 33 years of age and has a two school age children, ages 12 and 9, with her live-in partner, who lives abroad.

Our client owns a shop in which she provides telephone services, and sells calling cards and phone minutes. She also has some display cases to sell all types of clothing, both at this shop and door-to-door. She runs the shop from 8:00am until 10:00pm every day, accepting credit from her customers and billing them bi-weekly. She purchases merchandise in Guayaquil when she needs to. She states that she has been in business for 4 years.

She will use this loan to purchase pants, shirts, blouses, phone cards, and phone minutes. Her goal is to one day open a karaoke bar.

loans.use: to purchase pants, shirts, blouses, phone cards, and phone minutes

loans.name: Jonaldine

texts.en:
Jonaldine B. is from the village of Palilan, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 31 years old. Jonaldine is single. To make a living, Jonaldine owns & operates a business venture selling fish in the market. Jonaldine has been engaged in her business for over 13 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Jonaldine joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jonaldine has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for her business. Jonaldine is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase additional fish to sell. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Jonaldine from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma P. is from the village of Estrella, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 45 years old. Gemma is married and has six adult-aged children. To make a living, Gemma owns & operates a business planting & harvesting a variety of vegetables for sale. Gemma has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Gemma joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gemma is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Gemma from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Luna Maria

texts.en:
Luna Maria U. is from the village of Estrella, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 39 years old. Luna Maria is married and has 8 school-aged children. To make a living, Luna Maria owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising cows for sale. Luna Maria is just starting this business.

In 2008, Luna Maria joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Luna Maria has successfully repaid a previous loan  from GDMPC.  Luna Maria is requesting a new loan of 12000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Luna Maria from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita M. is from the village of Sinonoc, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 70 years old. Lolita is married and has 7 adult-aged children. To make a living, Lolita owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting  a variety of vegetables for sale. Lolita has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2007, Lolita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lolita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for her business. Lolita is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Lolita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Eliada

texts.en:
Eliada L. is from the village of San Juan, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is 46 years old. Eliada is married and has 4 adult-aged children. To make a living, Eliada owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables for sale. Eliada has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Eliada joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Eliada has successfully repaid a previous loan from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds for her farm. Eliada is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Eliada from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Enkhbold

texts.en:
Enkhbold is 53 years old. He lives with his wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. They live in a house that they built recently on their plot of land.  Enkhbold runs a taxi business with his own car. He enjoys transporting people and has good communication skills. His business is very important to him as it allows him to provide for his family. 

Enkhbold successfully repaid his first loan from Kiva. Now he is requesting a second loan to complete improvements on his house.

loans.use: to complete improvements on his house

loans.name: Bekhbayar

texts.en: Bekhbayar is 37 years old and lives with his wife and three children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. They all live together in a ger (a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent) on his brother-in-law’s plot of land. His two eldest children attend a local secondary school and the youngest daughter is just one year old and stays at home with his wife. Bekhbayar has been operating a taxi business in the city for the last one and a half years. He is an energetic and enthusiastic person who says, “I would like to be financially able to provide a good education and cover other expenses for my children.” The loan that he is asking for is to increase his working capital to buy some spare parts for his car.

loans.use: To increase his working capital

loans.name: Saroeurn

texts.en:
Mrs. Saroeurn P., 43, and her husband, Mr. Nhoeurn Uy, 48, live in a suburb of Phnom Penh. They have been married since 1986 and have six children - five sons and one daughter. One of their children is married, one is a construction worker, three are garment factory workers, and another is still young.    

Saroeurn was hired to guard a farm. Her husband is a construction worker. She is requesting her first loan of $1,000 to repair her house.

loans.use: to repair her house

loans.name: Sokhon

texts.en:
Mr. Sokhon H., 27, and his wife, Mrs. Sarat Chhorn, 29, live in a village about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 2007 and have two young sons. 

Sokhon is a motorbike and bicycle repairman. His wife is a garment factory worker. He is requesting his first loan of $500 to purchase spare motorcycle parts for his business.

loans.use: to purchase materials for his business

loans.name: Srey

texts.en:
Mrs. Srey S., 44, and her husband, Mr. Thon Chim, 51, live across the Mekong River about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have three children - two sons and one daughter. One of their children is married (and lives outside of the family home) and other two attend school. 

As a farmer, Mr. Thon Chim grows rice and vegetables. He also buys surplus rice from fellow villagers to resell to a middleman.  Mrs. Srey S. sells beef at the local market and assists her husband with his farming business. Mrs. Srey S. is asking for her first loan of $700.  The loan will be used in her husband's business of purchasing surplus rice for resale.

loans.use: to purchase surplus rice for resale

loans.name: Mao

texts.en:
Mrs. Mao H. (in the photo) and her husband, Mr. Sophea Chea, have four children: one son and three daughters. One has full-time employment in Phnom Penh, two are in school and the other one is still young.

Mao sells fruits. She also has a new farming business. Her husband has been a chef for seven years. Mao asked for a Kiva loan once before. She is now asking for another loan of $1,000 to purchase seed fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her farm.

loans.use: To use for farming

loans.name: Yut

texts.en: Mr. Yut C. (pictured here) is 36 years old and his wife, Mrs. Thuon You, is 32 years old. They have been married since 2003 and have two young children: one son and one daughter. The family lives about 18 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. Yut is a motor taxi driver, while his wife is a garment factory worker. He is asking for a loan of $1,000 to repair the house where he lives because it has broken in some places.

loans.use: To repair the house where he lives

loans.name: Khashbat

texts.en: Khashbat is 27 years old and lives with his parents and younger sister in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. They live in a small wooden house on their own plot of land. His younger sister attends a university. Khashbat used to produce a variety of wooden furniture products including chairs, tables, sofas and wardrobes. Currently he is operating a taxi business in the city using his own car. Khashbat is planning to go to Korea to work under a labor contract. He is requesting a loan to increase his business capital by purchasing some spare parts for his car.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for his car.

loans.name: Khursheed's Group

texts.en:
Khursheed resides in a small city in Punjab, Pakistan called Kot Radha Kishen. Kot Radha Kishen is known for its dairy industry. She owns a three-room house there in the area of the Ghandian Road and has been living there with her family for the past 18 years.

She is married to A. R. who has a business selling engine oil. He buys the engine oil from different companies and sells to different shops and customers. He has been doing this business for the past 10 years and has a good reputation among his customers.

Khursheed has given birth to 2 sons and 2 daughters. Her sons work in a factory for a low income while her daughters stay at home and help her finish the household chores. Khursheed couldn’t educate them due to poor financial circumstances.

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband who wants to buy engine oil to resell. This will help him make more sales and earn more profits.

Khursheed is hopeful that after investing the loan money into his business, her husband will be able to improve his business. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her third loan application. She is a responsible loan user and always maintained a good credit behavior with every loan.

Note: In the photo, the lady holding a book (an Asasah Passbook) is Khursheed.

loans.use: To buy engine oil for selling

loans.name: Chhem

texts.en:
Mrs. Chhem M. (pictured with her daughter), 59, is a widow with one son and four daughters. Three are married, two attend school and another one is a car repairman. The family lives along National Road Number One about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Chhem is a rice farmer. In addition, she also raises pigs at home. She is applying for her first loan in the amount of $1,000 to purchase a Tuk Tuk (motorcycle-based taxi) for her son-in-law.

loans.use: To purchase a Tuk Tuk for her son-in-law.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her son-in-law to get to work.

loans.name: Begum's Group

texts.en:
Begum is a housewife and prefers to stay at home and do her household work. She is 55 years old but still very active and does her work very well. Her husband’s name is K. and he is a mason by profession. He is very good at his work and builds homes and buildings with great skill.

Begum gave birth to a son, Adil, and he is involved in a business selling fruits and vegetables. He couldn’t get an education due to the poor financial conditions of his parents, so he started this work in his early teens. His shop is located near his home and he offers quality fruits and vegetables to his clients at cheaper rates.

Begum has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her son who wants to buy more seasonal vegetables and fruits for selling through his shop. He has been operating this business for more than 10 years and Begum is hopeful that an investment will help her son to improve his business and increase his income.

She a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her second loan application. In previous loans, she never gave a cause to complain and met her responsibilities effectively. She is a resident of a small city called Kot Radha Kishen in Pakistan. She has been living there in a three-room brick house with her family for past 20 years.

loans.use: To buy seasonal fruits and vegetables for selling

loans.name: Maritess

texts.en: Maritess Q. is from the village of Santa Clara Aritao, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 37 years old, married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Maritess owns and operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. Maritess has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 35,000 PHP per harvest. In 2011, Maritess joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maritess is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Maritess from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Mario

texts.en:
Mario B. is from the village of Sta. Clara Aritao, Nueva Vizcaya. He is 43 years old. Mario is married and has 4 adult-aged children. To make a living, Mario owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Mario has been engaged in his business for over 20 years and earns approximately 30,000 PHP a month average net income every harvest from these activities.

In 2011, Mario joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mario is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Mario from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of his family.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 21 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Umnotho Group

texts.en:
Bongekile is 49 years old and a single mother with 4 children between the ages of 2 and 14 years old. She cares for 4 children. She runs a retail business in Nkandla in Kwa Zulu Natal, South Africa. In the photo she is in the center raising her hand. 

She hs been in this business for 10 months and sells chicken in farm villages and pension spots. She says that the main challenge to her business is customers who buy on credit and fail to pay on time. She requested this loan through Women’s Development Businesses to buy clothes. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her profit, add more stock, support her family and allow her to build a house. In future, she would like to see her business grow.

loans.use: To buy clothes for resale

loans.name: Umbonomuhle Group

texts.en:
Nikeziwe is 40 years old and single, with 4 children between the ages of 7 and 18 years old. She cares for 4 children. She runs a retail business in Nkandla in Kwa Zulu Natal, South Africa. In the photo she is standing on the far left in grey.

She has been in this business for a year.  She sells livestock chickens, clothes, shoes, skirts and shirts at her home and pension spots.  She says that the main challenges to her business are customers who are not paying on time and the death of chickens when it is hot.

She requested this loan through Women’s Development Businesses to buy more chickens and clothes to grow her stock. She says that this loan will take her to another level, because she will be able to support her children through higher education and give them a better life. In the future, she would like to see her business grow and sell electricity vouchers and airtime.  

She thanks WBD and Kiva for giving her this chance of improving her life.

loans.use: To buy more chickens and clothes to grow her business

loans.name: Bambisanani Group

texts.en:
Fikile is 28 years old and single, with 3 children between the ages of 1 and 7 years old. She cares for one relative. She runs a retail business at her home in Nkandla in Kwa Zulu Natal, South Africa. In the photo she is raising her right hand.

She sells chickens at her home and has been in this business for 2 years. She also receives income from the government's child support grant. She says that the main challenge to her business is customers who buy on credit and fail to pay on time.  She requested this loan through Women’s Development Businesses to buy chickens. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her make more profit and support her children. In the future, she hopes to make more profit and have employees to help her.

She adds that she does not have a shelter to sell her stock, and would like to know if WDB and Kiva can help her build her own shelter because now she is selling on the streets.

loans.use: To buy chickens

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en: Mahmoud is a 46-year-old married man who lives in Bint Jbeil with his wife and six children. He works in construction, specializing in cement work. His work is very professional and most of his customers recommend him to others. Mahmoud works hard to provide for his family members. He hopes to give them the perfect education they deserve, in addition to a healthy and relaxing standard of living. Mahmoud is requesting a loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua, for the second time in order to buy wood for his business. His previous loan was very helpful for his business and he was a good borrower too. In the future, Mahmoud hopes to expand his business and buy professional tools.

loans.use: To buy wood for his business

loans.name: Kubra Muhammad Siddiq's Group

texts.en:
Kubra lives in a small city in Punjab, Pakistan, called Kot Radha Kishan, which is known for its dairy industry. Her home is in the area of Judgawala and it consists of two rooms. She is married to M. S. who is a welder by profession. He is good at his work and provides good quality services to his customers.
Kubra has five sons and a daughter. Her eldest son works with his father. Three of the children are getting an education at the local school while the others remain at home. Kubra is a housewife who stays at home to carry out her household responsibilities. She makes the utmost effort to provide comfort to her family by fulfilling their needs.
Kubra has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for her husband who wants to buy another welding machine. He will also hire an assistant who will help him to provide better services to his customers and earn a good income. Kubra is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her sixth loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained good credit behavior and never missed a meeting.

loans.use: To buy another welding machine

loans.name: Sophea

texts.en:
Mrs. Sophea H. (pictured with her young daughter) is 37 years old. She lives in a suburb of Phnom Penh with her husband, Mr. Nhoeurn Uy, who is 48 years old. They have been married since 1986 and have six children – five sons and one daughter. One is married, three are garment factory workers, one is a construction worker and the other is still young.
Sophea sells meatballs in her village. Her husband is a construction worker. She is asking for her first loan of $1,000 to purchase construction materials for her husband’s business.

loans.use: To purchase materials for her husband’s construction business

loans.name: Munkhgerel

texts.en: Munkhgerel is 41 years old and lives with her husband and a daughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. They live in a one-bedroom studio apartment which they rent. Her husband is Japanese, who recently married her. Her daughter attends a Raffles International Institute. Munkhgerel has been operating a body- stocking (garment) retail business since 2005 by renting a stall at the Narlag market and selling a variety of socks and tights for the last seven years, and she has gained much experience. She is one of our reliable customers and a very hardworking person who is responsible for paying her daughter’s tuition fee.  This is her second loan through Credit Mongol, and this time she is asking for a loan to increase her business profits by purchasing more products.

loans.use: to increase her business profits by purchasing more products such as socks and tights for sale

loans.name: Jovita Antolin's Group

texts.en:
Jovita A. is from the village of Siempre, Viva Norte. She is the leader of an eight-member group loan offered by Kiva partner, ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Jovita A.'s Group.
Jovita is 51 years old, married and has three adult-aged children. To make a living, Jovita owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store selling a variety of different products in the local community. Jovita has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 9,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2006, Jovita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from ASKI. This loan was used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. Jovita is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her eleventh from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family.

About ASKI
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a 30-year-old businessman who runs a cafeteria to earn a living. He also sells second-hand shoes to supplement his income. Most of his time he spends on selling shoes so he has employed four people to help him run the cafeteria. Prior to this, he was selling second-hand clothes. He hopes that someday, he will open a hotel.
Charles is very grateful to Kiva partner, Faulu Kenya, because he has received training in customer care from them. This has meant that he has been able to attract many customers to his business and his income has increased. He has requested a loan of 80,000 KES to buy a freezer, utensils and cooking ingredients and to install electricity in his business premises.

loans.use: To buy a freezer, utensils and cooking ingredients, plus install electricity in business premises

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her inventory

loans.name: Jessica Len Javier's Group

texts.en:
Jessica Len J. is from the village of San Pablo, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is the leader of an eight-member group loan offered by Kiva partner, ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.
 Jessica Len is 29 years old, married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising pigs for fattening and sale. Jessica Len has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP whenever she sells one of her raised pigs.
In 2010, Jessica Len joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from ASKI. This loan was used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. Jessica Len is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be her third from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Patriciah

texts.en: Patriciah is a 37-year-old widowed lady with four children. To make a living and provide for her children, she runs a taxi business and also operates a retail shop to earn extra income. She was previously a farmer. Being the breadwinner in her family, she works hard to meet her children's basic needs, including education. Patriciah has been running her business for 11 years and it has grown since she joined Kiva partner, Faulu Kenya. Her living standards have improved as a result. Patriciah dreams of owning more taxi cars in the future. She has requested a loan of 60,000 KES to buy a gearbox.

loans.use: To buy a gearbox

loans.name: Olga Cudog's Group

texts.en:
Olga C. is from the village of Buyon, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is the group leader of an eight-member group loan offered by Kiva partner, ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.
Olga is 34 years old, married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a general store selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Olga has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2010, Olga joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from ASKI. This loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Olga is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This loan will be her second from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

About ASKI
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en: Catherine is 36 years old and married with three children. She has been running a salon for 13 years and also does livestock farming to boost her income. Catherine has witnessed a lot of growth in her business since she joined Kiva partner, Faulu Kenya. This is because she has been saving her money with Faulu Kenya and has previously taken out a loan that she used to boost her business. In the future, she hopes to expand her salon and start to employ people. She has requested a loan of 40,000 KES to buy hair oil, hair gel and shampoo.

loans.use: To buy hair oil, hair gel and shampoo

loans.name: Siyazama Group

texts.en:
Zibalile is 48 years of age, single and has one child aged 24 who is still in education. She also has four relatives that she lives with and takes care of. In the photo above, she is in the red dress raising her hand.
Zibalile sells chickens from her home and has been in this business for one year. She does not have any other sources of income. She says her main business challenge is when chickens die and she doesn't get any profit. Zibalile requested this loan through Kiva partner, WDB, to buy more live chickens. In the next five years, she would like to increase her stock of chickens and grow her business. She hopes to use any additional profit to support her family. Zibalile hopes that WDB will continue to help her and others.

loans.use: To buy live chickens

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida C. is from the village of Siti Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 34 years old and married, with 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Leonida raises cows for sale. Leonida has been engaged in her business for more than 10 years and earns approximately 500 PHP a month.

In 2010, Leonida joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Leonida has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from GDMPC, which was used to raise cattle. Leonida is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Leonida from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishers and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Concepcion's Group

texts.en:
Concepcion G. is from the village of San Luis, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 43 years old and the group leader of a five-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Concepcion is married and has four adult-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a general store, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately $94 a month for these activities.

In 2006, she joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. 

Concepcion is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which again will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be her 2nd loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is 35 years old and married and with three children.  She does tailoring to earn a living.  She has been running her tailoring business in the slums for eleven years, hence most of her customers are low-income earners.  She left her employment and decided to run her business full time.  Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has learned how to save her money and has been able to increase her business stock.  She hopes to expand her business into wholesale in the future.  She has requested 40,000 KES to buy fabric, thread and zippers.

loans.use: To buy fabric, thread and zippers

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda D. is from the village of Migcanaway in Tangub City. She is 34 years old and married with two school-aged children. To make a living, she raises fish for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately $71 a month for this activity.

In 2008, Merlinda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from GDMPC. 

Merlinda is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be her 7th loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a 28-year-old married lady with three children who are in school.  She does tailoring for a living.  She has nine years of experience in running the business.  She has employed two people to help her in her tasks.  Her business is located in the slum area, hence most of her customers are low-income earners.  

Since she became a member of Faulu Kenya, she has managed to get loans that she has used to grow her business. She has also learned how to manage her business through keeping business records.  She has requested 20,000 KES to buy fabric, scissors, thread and zippers.

loans.use: To buy fabric, scissors, thread and zippers.

loans.name: Filomina

texts.en:
Filomina T. is from the village of Katipunan, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 63 years old, married, and has six adult-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a manufacturing business, making and selling wood products to local businesses and community members. She has been engaged in her business for over twenty-six years and earns approximately $47 a month for these activities.

In 2008, Filomina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for her business. 

Filomina is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. This will be her 5th loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products

loans.name: Moris

texts.en: Moris is a thirty-three-year-old married man with three children, renting a house in Kasese, Uganda. He has been selling produce for the last four years. His hardships are poor growing seasons, leading to low supply and changes in the market price. His vision is business expansion, building a house and educating his children. Moris needs the loan to buy beans and groundnuts to sell.

loans.use: To buy beans and groundnuts to sell.

loans.name: Khursheed's Group

texts.en:
Khursheed is a housewife who stays at home and does her housework. She is 51 years old but she is still very active and does her work very well.  She is a resident of a small city located in the Punjab province of Pakistan called Kot Radha Kishan. She moved after her marriage and lives there in a three-room brick house with her family. She is the mother of two sons and a daughter. She couldn’t give them an education due to poor financial resources. Her sons work in a factory for a low income while her daughter stays at home and helps her with the household tasks.

Her husband’s name is M. M., and he sells crushed wood. Crushed wood is normally used to start fires and as wood filling for furniture. He has been operating this business for the past eight years and has a good number of clients in his area. 

Khursheed has applied for a loan from the Kiva partner, Asasah, for her husband, who wants to improve his business. With the loan, he will buy crushed wood in bulk quantities which will help him to fulfill larger orders on time and to make more profits. She is very hopeful that her husband’s business will go in a positive direction after receiving the loan.
  
She is a regular user of Asasah and this is her 6th loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained good credit behavior and never missed any meeting.

loans.use: To buy crushed woods for selling

loans.name: Retchel's Group

texts.en:
Retchel F. is from the village of Baringin Sur, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 27 years old and the group leader of a five-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Retchel is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a general store, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately $71 a month for these activities.

In 2010, she joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. 

Retchel is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 3rd loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Violita

texts.en:
Violita P. is from the village of Lapinig, Kapatagan, Alnao Del Norte. She is 31 years old. Violita is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a general store, selling products such as canned goods, noodles, sugar, coffee, milk, spices, shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately $63 a month for these activities.

In 2011, Violita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be her 1st loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.
