loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 35 years old, married, and has three children who are in school.  For ten years, she has been operating a tailoring business.  She has employed one person in her business.  

She joined Faulu Kenya so that she could save her money and get loans more easily.  She previously took out a loan from Faulu Kenya which she used to boost her business.  She hopes to stock more fabric for resale and will use some of it to make clothes.  She has requested another loan of 10,000 KES to buy fabric, thread and zippers.

loans.use: To buy fabric, thread and zippers.

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en: Vincent is a thirty-eight-year-old married man with eight children, owning a house in Kasese, Uganda. He has been in farming for the last ten years starting with soy beans and diversifing to bananas, eggplants and maize plus rearing goats. His hardships are poor climatic changes, price fluctuations, and high transport costs. His vision is a well-established dairy farm and a well-educated family. Vincent intends to use the loan to buy seeds and for clearing land.

loans.use: Buying seeds and clearing land

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a thirty-year-old married female with four children, living in her own house in Kasese, Uganda. She has been dealing in cassava flour for the last seven years starting with a capital of 500,000 shillings. She now has 1,000,000 shillings. Her goal is to own a food store and her challenge is prolonged drought that leads to low yields of cassava. Mary needs the loan to buy cassava flour.

loans.use: Buying cassava flour

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 31-year-old single man from Lebanon. He lives with his parents. He has operated a van service for students and summer trips in his village as well as neighboring towns for over 7 years. In parallel, he has worked as a sport coach in a local school for 10 years. It’s very common in Lebanon to have multiple jobs to be able to handle weighty life expenses. He helps his father to satisfy the family needs.  

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to perform much needed maintenance on his van. In the future, he is planning to purchase a new van and employ a part-time employee to work on it. This will be his second Kiva loan.

loans.use: to perform much needed maintenance on his van

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en: Godfrey is a thirty-five-year-old married man with six children, living in his own house in Kasese, Uganda. He has been dealing in produce for the last eight years starting with a capital of 1,000,000 shillings and later expanding to 5,000,000 shillings. His hardship is price fluctuation and little capital and his vision is business expansion, constructing another house, and educating the children. Godfrey needs the loan to buy rice for sale.

loans.use: Buying bags of rice

loans.name: Paul

texts.en: Paul, a 50-year-old married man with eight children, lives in his own house in Kasese, Uganda.  A farmer for the last 20 years, he started by growing mangoes and later expanded to bananas and oranges. His hardships include climatic changes and high costs for pesticides, labour and transport. Paul's vision is to have a well-established crop farm and be able to fully educate his children. He needs this loan to pay for labour, pesticides, and mulch for his  banana plantation.

loans.use: To pay for labour, pesticides, and mulching.

loans.name: Felicisima

texts.en:
Felicisima M., from Labuyo Tangub City, is 53 years old, married and has three grown children. To make a living, Felicisima owns and operates a business venture providing motor transport services. Engaged in her venture for over 15 years, she earns approximately 3,000 PHP per month.

In 2009, Felicisima joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan from GDMPC, she is now requesting her third loan for 15,000 PHP to repair a vehicle for better service. Felicisima plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair vehicle for better service

loans.name: Anna Ruby

texts.en:
Anna Ruby R. is from Labuyo Tangub City. She is 43 years old. Anna Ruby is married and has four adult children. To make a living, Anna Ruby owns and operates a general store. Anna Ruby has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. 

In 2008, Anna Ruby joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Anna Ruby has successfully repaid a previous loan from GDMPC. Anna Ruby is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the second loan taken out by Anna Ruby from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches  covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice I. is a 42-year-old widow with  three children aged between 7 and 14 years old. She also cares for an orphan who is 18 years old. 

Beatrice sells clothing and runs a well-organized and well-known clothing store, which she has had for 15 years.

Beatrice will use this loan to buy new clothing to sell. She will use any profits she makes to reinvest in more clothing and continue to grow her business.

loans.use: To purchase new clothes to sell

loans.name: Bassel

texts.en:
Bassel is a 42-year-old married man, living in Bint Jbeil with his wife and two children. 

Bassel owns a wood factory since 2000, and he has 21 years of experience in this field. In his factory, Bassel works on wood logs and changes them into useful wood sheets, boards and pillars necessary for construction and furniture designs. 

Bassel is a well known man in his neighborhood. Most of his clients are friends, neighbors and relatives. He works hard on improving his business in different ways. Bassel hopes to expand his business by gaining clients from other regions. 

Bassel is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua in order to increase his wood capital and to pay for what's still owed on his wife's car. This is his second loan from Al Majmoua. With his previous loan, he was a very good borrower.

loans.use: To increase his lumber inventory

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen R. is from Labuyo Tangub City. She is 41 years old. Helen is married and has four school-aged children. 

To make a living, Helen prepares and sells cooked food for daily meals. Helen has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Helen joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from GDMPC. Helen is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make food products for sale. This will be the third loan taken out by Helen from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches  covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand his business and buy more seeds for his land

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce W. M. is 29 years old and married with two children. 

She earns a living from dairy farming. She has been in the business for over five years. She is able to run her business well because the climate for Kiambu is suitable for farming. 

Through Faulu Kenya, she has managed to grow her financial status. She hopes to go into large-scale farming in the future. She has requested 10,000 KES to buy a dairy cow.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Edwin's Group

texts.en:
Edwin P. is from the village of Duminit, Cauayan City, Isabela. He is 37 years old. Edwin is the leader of a five-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Edwin is single. To make a living, Edwin plants and harvests  a variety of vegetables for sale. Edwin has been engaged in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Edwin joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his business and living situation. Edwin has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. 

Edwin is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. This will be the third loan taken out by Edwin from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand his business. 

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase the important things to make his garden more productive

loans.name: Anastacia

texts.en:
Anastacia M. K. is 32 years old and a single mother of one child.  

She runs a salon to earn a living. She has been in the business for five years. She also runs a grocer shop to earn extra income.  

Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to improve her living standards. She hopes to grow her business so that she can employ more people in the future. 

She has requested 10,000 KES to buy spinach, kale and oranges for her grocery store.

loans.use: To buy spinach, kale and oranges

loans.name: Riyad

texts.en:
Riyad is a 45-year-old married man, living in Bint Jbeil with his wife and two children. Riyad has worked as a car repairer for 22 years, and he opened his own business in 2002. 

He is a hard worker. He loves his job a lot and seeks to improve it and to be up to date with the new professional tools so that he can do certain new types of maintenance for his current clients and attract new ones. 

Riyad is requesting  a loan from Al Majmoua in order to buy new professional tools necessary for his business. He hopes to improve his business more and to afford a relaxing vacation with his family.

loans.use: To buy new professional tools for his business

loans.name: Fatmeh

texts.en: Fatmeh is 28 years old and single.  She lives in Bint Jbeil and owns a perfume and artificial flowers shop, which she has had since 2004. Fatmeh is well known in her area and her business is improving every day. Most of her clients are friends, neighbors, and relatives. Fatmeh is a hard worker and seeks the best for her business.  She was helped by her family members because she has good taste in making perfumes of her own.  She makes special blends and sells them for a good price so they can be affordable to all of her clients. Fatmeh is requesting a loan for the first time from Al Majmoua in order to increase her business capital. Fatmeh is a responsible woman, who struggles with her business and takes care of her parents as much as she can. Fatmeh hopes she can expand her perfume sales in the region.

loans.use: To increase her business capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase high quality wheat seed and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase a shop and progress his business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To expand his business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy new tools for a car-repair shop

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 29-year-old married man living with his wife. He is from Lebanon. He has owned a metal shop for the past 10 years. He makes alumni designs, motors etc. (all metal-related work). Over the years, he has built a good business reputation and he works closely with some metal companies. He took advantage of his first Kiva loan and he has been a reliable client and paid on his scheduled date. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,500 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase metal needed for his work to proceed in his operation properly. He is looking to expand his business further in the coming year and he is optimistic about the future.

loans.use: To purchase metal needed for his work

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy supplies for her business and help her family live a better life.

loans.name: Balimaya Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Balimaya, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 42 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Welabougou, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le maraîchage, le commerce de poissons, de condiments et d’habillements.                                                                                           
Les femmes du groupe Balimaya sont à leur premier prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter des semences, des condiments, des poissons et des habillements.                                                                         
DJENEBA D. compte acheter des semences destinées au maraîchage, auprès des revendeurs du marché de Fana. Elle fait le maraîchage sur place au village et au moment de la récolte, elle approvisionnera sa clientèle sur place au village et dans les environnants, au comptant et à crédit. Sa clientèle est composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 60 000F CFA au cours du cycle qui sera utilisé pour prendre en charge les dépenses relatives à la santé de ses enfants et les frais scolaire, le reste sera  réinvesti dans son activité de maraîchage.
texts.en:
The members of the Balimaya group are married women who average 42 years of age and four children each. They all live in extended traditional families in the village of Welabougou, prefecture of Dioïla, in the Koulikoro region (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They know one another as neighbors, and through ties of kinship and friendship. Their activities are market gardening, and selling fish, condiments and clothing.

The Balimaya women are on their first group loan, which will be used to buy seeds, condiments, fish and clothing. Djeneba D. intends to buy seeds for market gardening from resellers at the Fana market. The market gardening is done on location in the village, and at harvest time, she will supply her clients locally and in surrounding villages, for cash or credit. Her clientele consists of both men and women.

She expects to make an average profit of 60,000 F CFA during the cycle, which she will use to pay for her children’s health care and tuition. The remainder will be reinvested in her market gardening activity.

loans.use: To buy seeds

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a scanner machine and additional tools

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine, cloth and different kinds of needles and threads

loans.name: Nazmia

texts.en: Nazmia is 40 years old, married and lives in the town of Chtoura with her husband and two children. She makes a living producing and selling curtains, furniture covers and blankets. Nazmia is applying for this loan from Al Majmoua to improve her business by buying more patterns. This is her fifth loan from Al Majmoua, and she has used all of the previous ones to improve her financial situation. She is also very good about making payments on time. Nazmia plans to use the additional income made possible by this loan to continue expanding her business and care for her family.

loans.use: To buy patterns for a tailoring business.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Benkadi, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 43 ans, 5 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Belekonobougou, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de tubercules, condiments, de beurre de karité et de galettes                                                                                                      
Les femmes du groupe Benkadi sont à leur premier prêt solidaire avec Soro Yiriwaso.
DJENEBA C. compte acheter des tubercules auprès des revendeurs au niveau du village. Elle effectue ses ventes quotidiennement à la maison, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 20 000F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer les échéances du prêt, payer les contributions des cérémonies sociales et le reste sera  réinvesti dans son activité de commerce.
texts.en:
The members of the Benkadi group, all married women, are on the average 43 years old, with five children. They all live in traditional extended families in the village of Belekonobougou, Dioïla Prefecture, Koulikoro Region (the second administrative region of Mali).
They know each other as relatives, neighbors and friends. They sell yams, condiments, shea butter and cookies. The members of the Benkadi group are on their first solidarity group with Soro Yiriwaso. 

Djeneba C. plans to buy yams from resellers in her village. She sells daily out of her house, for cash and on credit, to a customer base composed of both men and women. She plans to achieve an average monthly income of 20,000 West African francs, which will be used to pay off the loan and cover her contribution to major social events, with the rest reinvested in her business.

loans.use: Purchasing yams

loans.name: Philippe

texts.en: Philippe is 32 years old, married and has three children. He makes a living by running a small shop where he sells a variety of goods such as juice, soaps, body lotion and cooking oil. He has been in this business for two years, is doing quite well and now has one employee. He has applied for this loan to expand his business by buying food items such as rice, beans, peas, and Irish potatoes. With these additional items to sell, Philippe hopes that his profits will increase and he will be able to better care for his family. He expresses his sincerest thanks to Kiva and Vision Finance for supporting his business.

loans.use: To buy a variety of new goods to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Danaya, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 25 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Belekonobougou, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de tubercules, de savon, d’articles divers et de céréales.                                                                                                                                    
Les femmes du groupe Danaya sont à leur premier prêt solidaire. FATOUMATA C. compte acheter des tubercules avec les grossistes du village et environnants. Elle effectue ses ventes quotidiennement sur place au village, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 10 000F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer les trousseaux de mariage, payer les contributions des cérémonies sociales et le reste sera  réinvesti dans son activité de commerce.
texts.en:
The members of the Danaya group, all married women, are on the average  25 years old, with three children. They all live in traditional extended families in the village of Belekonobougou, Dioïla Prefecture, Koulikoro Region (the second administrative region of Mali). They know each other as relatives, neighbors and friends. They sell yams, soap, cereals and miscellaneous articles. The members of the Danaya group are on their first solidarity group with Soro Yiriwaso. 

Fatoumata C. plans to buy yams from wholesalers in her village and nearby areas. She sells daily out of her home, for cash and on credit, to a customer base composed of both men and women. She plans to achieve an average monthly income of 10,000 West African francs, which will be used to pay for wedding trousseaux and cover her contribution to major social events, with the rest reinvested in her business.

loans.use: Purchasing yams

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase a big shop in a good location

loans.name: Hunan

texts.en: Hunan G. was born in 1975. He lives in Tsav village, in the area of Kapan, with his wife and his newborn son.  Hunan works at Tsav village administration as an accountant and at the same time, he engages in animal breeding and land cultivation. He raises cows, sheep, goats and pigs, and Hunan grows potatoes at his farm as well. Hunan’s wife helps him and so they support their young family’s needs. Hunan is asking for a 600,000 AMD loan to buy potato seedling and fodder for his farm animals. This is Hunan’s fourth loan from Nor Horizon and he has never delayed his repayments.

loans.use: To buy potato seedlings and fodder for his farm animals

loans.name: Kounkorota Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe KOUNKOROTA, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 42 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Welabougou, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce d’articles de boutique, de condiments, d’habillements et pratiquent le maraîchage.                                                                                                                          
Les femmes du groupe KOUNKOROTA sont à leur premier prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter divers articles de boutique, de condiments, de semences et des habillements.                                                                          FANTA D. compte acheter beaucoup d’articles de boutique avec les grossistes de Dioïla et souvent à Fana. Elle effectue ses ventes quotidiennement sur place à la maison et au marché, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de  40 000F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer les échéances du prêt, payer les contributions des cérémonies sociales et le reste sera  réinvesti dans son activité de commerce.
texts.en:
The members of the KOUNKOROTA group are married women who average 42 years of age and four children each. They all live in extended traditional families in the village of Welabougou, prefecture of Dioïla, in the Koulikoro region (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali). 

They know one another as neighbors and through ties of kinship and friendship. They sell dry goods, condiments and clothing, and they also keep market gardens.

The KOUNKOROTA members are on their first group loan, which they will use to purchase various dry goods, condiments, seeds and clothing. FANTA D. plans to buy a lot of dry goods from Dioïla wholesalers and also in Fana. She conducts her sales daily from her home and at the market, for cash and on credit, to a customer base consisting of both men and women.

She expects to earn an average monthly profit of 40,000 FCFA, which will be used to make loan repayments and contributions to social ceremonies. The remainder will be reinvested in her business activity.

loans.use: To purchase various dry goods

loans.name: Laîdou Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Laïdou, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 35 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Belekonobougou, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de bijoux, de poissons, d’arachides et de savons.                                                                                                                                    
Les femmes du groupe Laïdou sont à leur premier prêt solidaire avec Soro Yiriwaso.                                                                         
AMINATA F. compte acheter des bijoux avec les revendeurs  du village de Wakoro, hebdomadairement. Elle effectue ses ventes quotidiennement sur place à la maison, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de  10 000F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer les échéances du prêt et prendre en charge les dépenses de ses enfants.
texts.en:
The women of the Laïdou group, all married, average 35 years of age and 3 children. They all live in extended traditional families in the village of Belekonobougou, in Dioïla Prefecture (Koulikoro Region, second administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

They got acquainted through bonds of kinship, neighborhood, and friendship. They buy and sell jewelry, fish, peanuts and soap. They are seeking their first group loan from Kiva's partner, Soro Yiriwaso.

AMINATA F. intends to buy jewelry from resellers in Wakoro village on a weekly basis. She sells daily at her home, for cash and on credit, to a clientele comprising mostly women.

She foresees turning an average monthly profit of XOF 10'000 (ca US$ 20), to be used to pay the loan installments and her children's expenses.

loans.use: To buy and resell jewelry

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en: Nancy is a married lady with two school-aged children.  She has been operating a green grocery for over 10 years.  She also does dairy farming for extra income.  She joined Faulu Kenya so that she could easily access financial resources.  With her previous loan from Faulu Kenya, she has improved her business. Hence, she improved her standard of living.  She hopes to expand her business in the future.  She has requested 50,000 Kes to buy two dairy cows.

loans.use: To buy two dairy cows

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
The Kiva borrower is a 30-year-old single woman living with her parents and three siblings. She is from Lebanon. She has owned a CD, gift and perfume shop since 2005. In parallel, she works as a sports coach in a local school. Her work is very important because she helps her father with the family expenses. She obtained her first Kiva loan and she has been an excellent client with prompt payments. 

Today, she is requesting to borrow $2,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to increase her shop’s inventory, as she wants to purchase the new perfume collections in addition to some original gifts. In the future, she is planning to expand her business and enlarge her store.

loans.use: To increase her shop’s inventory

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en: Hellen, who is currently in the business of selling bread, is 40 years old, married, and has six children, four of whom go to school. Requesting a loan to stock more bread to sell, she hopes to open a big shop with extra profits from her business in the future.

loans.use: To stock more bread to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy construction supplies for his house

loans.name: Sebeke Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Sebeke, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 43 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Welabougou, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le                                                                                                                                     
Les femmes du groupe Sebeke sont à leur premier prêt solidaire avec Soro Yiriwaso.                                                                         
AMINATA D. compte acheter deux sacs de 100 Kg de céréales avec les producteurs du village et des villages environnants, hebdomadairement. Elle effectue ses ventes quotidiennement sur place à la maison et au marché, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 40 000F CFA qui sera utilisé pour les dépenses de ses enfants à savoir la santé, la nourriture et les frais scolaire et une partie pour son activité.
texts.en:
The members of the Sebeke group, all married women, are on the overage 43 years old, with three children. They all live in traditional extended families in the village of Welabougou, Diola pPefecture, Koulikoro Region (the second administrative region of Mali).

They know each other as relatives, neighbors, and friends. Their business is […text missing—Translator’s note].

The members of the Sebeke group are on their first solidarity laon with Soro Yiriwaso.

Aminata D. plans to use her loan to purchase two 100-kg bags of cereals from local farmers as well as from nearby villages, on a weekly basis. She sells daily out of her home and at the marketplace, for cash and on credit, to a customer base composed of men and women. She plans to achieve an average monthly income of 40,000 West African Frabcs, which will be used to cover healthcare, food, and school expenses for her children, with part of the money set aside for her business.

loans.use: To purchase cereals

loans.name: Galust

texts.en:
43-year-old Galust S. lives in Ddmashen village, near Sevan. He is married and has 3 children. Galust’s elder daughter and his son are students, and his younger daughter is a schoolgirl.

Galust is a motor mechanic who has had his own garage for 22 years. He buys crashed cars, then repairs and sells them. He currently needs a loan of 1,000,000 AMD to buy a crashed car. 

With the income he will make from fixing it up and selling it, Galust intends to pay for his children’s education. This is Galust’s fifth loan from Nor Horizon and second loan from Kiva. Galust spent his first Kiva loan  to buy a crashed car, plus materials and tools for auto repair.

loans.use: To buy a crashed car

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy belts, handbags and wallets

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
The Kiva borrower is a 54-year-old married man from Lebanon. He lives with his wife and two school-aged children. He has been running a clothing store since 1998. He has 20 years of experience in the same field. He always presents new collections to attract more customers to his shop. He cooperates with his wife who works as a tailor to satisfy the family needs. He has obtained his first Kiva loan and was a very good client with payments on time.

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1100 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to expand his store’s inventory and buy new clothing collections. He’s certain that the loan will help him diversify his merchandise selection. In the future, he is hoping to also sell shoes from his store. Currently, he mostly sells clothes.

loans.use: to expand his store’s inventory

loans.name: Adolphe Alphath

texts.fr:
Homme marié de 33ans et  père de 3 enfants dont l’âge varie de 02 à 18 ans et ayant 2 personnes à sa charge dont 2 enfants vont à l’école. Après la fin de sa formation d’une école de menuiserie, il se lance dans la menuiserie en 2003 avec un capital de 700.000frs et s’approvisionne dans le département de la Likouala. Ses ventes sont de 18.000frs par jour.

Avec le prêt, il compte acheter des planches qui été transformées en meubles, peinture.

Sa vision s’est de racheté sa propre machine qui lui a été pillée lors des événements derniers. Il aimera aussi devenir entrepreneur et avoir sa propre exposition.

Pour sa famille il souhaite léguer tout son héritage à ses enfants. Il jouit d’une bonne moralité.
texts.en:
A married man, 33 years old, he is the father of three children, from 2 to 18 years of age. He has two dependent children who go to school. After finishing his training as a carpenter, he has launched his own shop in 2003, with a starting capital of 700,000 West African francs. He stocks up in the Likouala Department. His daily receipts are about 18,000 francs.

With this loan, he plans to purchase wood planks to be used for making furniture as well as paint. His goal is to be able to buy a new woodworking machine, as his old one was looted during the recent events. He would like to become an entrepreneur and have his own showroom. As to his family, he would like to leave a good legacy to his children. He is of good moral character.

loans.use: Purchasing wood and paint

loans.name: Matondo Plus Group

texts.en:
Suzanne is the leader of the Community Bank named “Matondo Plus". It is composed of 11 members united in solidarity to receive Kiva loans with the goal of developing their businesses.

Suzanne is 55 years old and single. She is a mother of four children aged between 7 and 26 years old. She sells miscellaneous goods. She has been active in her business since 1987. She began her business selling second-hand clothing. She joined one of Hope’s groups (a DRCongo Microfinance Program) in 2009, and has received seven loans. 

Thanks to Hope’s loans, Suzanne’s business has prospered and it generates a profit of $60 per week. Suzanne intends with the next loan to buy more goods to resell at a profit in order to increase her capital. Her ambition is to open a larger store in her area. She works hard in order to achieve her dream.

loans.use: increasing her stock to resell at a profit

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Moses

texts.en: Moses is 40 years old, married and blessed with two children aged 14 and 16.  He has been operating a "boda boda" (motorbike) transport business to earn his daily bread.  He has been in the business for over two years.  He also runs a retail shop so as to supplement his income.  He hopes to transform his business into wholesale in future.  He says that since he joined Faulu Kenya, his financial status has improved.  He has requested 25,000 Kes to add stock of maize flour and sodas.

loans.use: To add stock of maize flour and crates of sodas

loans.name: Alice  Kemunto

texts.en:
Alice Kemunto M., aged 42 years, is married to Charles M.. She has been operating her business for four years and earns an income of thirty thousand shillings per month.

Alice joined KADET LTD because of KADET  marketing events. She is servicing her third loan and will use it to purchase different types of cereals to increase her stock.She repaid the previous loans well and in good time

She  will use the anticipated profits to open another cereals shop. She hopes to have a big cereal shop in the future. Alice describes herself as active and hard-working.

loans.use: to increase stock of cereals in her shop

loans.name: Mildren

texts.en:
Mildren A. is 31 years old, married to Charles who is a businessman, and they are blessed with two children. 

Mildren has a little restaurant that she has been running for the past three years in Migori. She experienced a few problems in her restaurant that is situated by the roadside as it was demolished and this forced her to run her business from the house. She has put up a tent beside her house that serves as a restaurant. She is applying for her second loan that she wants to use to buy furniture such as tables and seats for her restaurant and also enable her to build another structure.

Her future dream is to be able to open up another restaurant in the neighbouring town.

loans.use: Buy seats and tables for her business

loans.name: Musyoki

texts.en:
Musyoki M., aged 38, runs a quarry business in Lukenya. He is married to Penninah Musyoki, aged 32, who is a businesswoman, and together they have three children who are Mutheu 18 years old, Monica 16 years old, and Mwalimu 14 years old. Musyoki was introduced to KADET LTD by an existing customer.

Musyoki’s business is located in Lukenya and it has been in operation for the last eight years. The business earns him a monthly profit of Kshs 12,500. He intends to purchase another plot of quarry land with the loan of Kshs 30,000.

If the loan boosts his business, he will buy a plot of land and build commercial houses. He hopes to have a big quarry land and purchase a lorry to be delivering materials to customers. He describes himself as hard-working and focused.

loans.use: Purchase another quarry land

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy shoes, handbags and clothes

loans.name: Joseph Muhari

texts.en:
Joseph has practised farming in Olkalou town for the last 10 years.  He is 63 years old, married to Margaret Wangeci, and they have seven children.  

He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend and this will be his second loan. He repaid his previous loans well and in good time.  He plans to use the loan amount to buy 10 merino sheep to rear and sell later at a profit

In future, Joseph hopes to buy his own truck which he will be using to transport the sheep to the marketplace.

loans.use: To buy 10 merino sheep

loans.name: Pasile

texts.en: Pasile is 52 years old, married and a father of five.  For five years, he has been selling belts, key holders and handbags to earn a living.  He is also a dairy farmer.  Through farming, he is able to earn extra income for his family.  Currently, he does not have a permanent business premise.  Hence, he is looking forward to owning a business premise.  He has requested 20,000 Kes to buy belts, key holders and handbags.

loans.use: To buy belts, key holders and handbags

loans.name: Florence Wambui

texts.en:
Florence, who has practised tailoring in Olkalou town for the last 10 years, is 39 years old, married to John N., and the mother of one child. Florence was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field staff, and this will be her first loan with which she plans to buy more cloth material and a modern sewing machine.

In the future, Florence hopes to grow her business and clientelle to become a leading tailor in Olkalou.

loans.use: To buy more cloth material fand a modern sewing machine for making dresses

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: John Muriithi

texts.en:
John Muriithi is 27 years old and married to Alice Muthoni who is a housewife. He is a horticulture farmer and has been running the business for a period of about 10 years with an income of KES. 15,000 per month.

This is his third loan from KADET LTD after successfully repaying the previous loans well and in good time. He intends to use the loan to hire labor for his farm.

He hopes to build a better house for his family and expand his business in future.

loans.use: To hire labor for his farm

loans.name: Jane Wanjiru

texts.en: Jane Wanjiru M. is 46 years old, married, and has four children.  She has been a farmer in Olkalou town for the last five years. Jane was introduced to KADET LTD by one of the field staff.  She paid back her previous loan of 11,000 KES on time.  She plans to use her second loan from KADET to buy fertilizer and potato seedlings. In the future, Jane plans to buy more land and practice large-scale farming.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and potato seedlings

loans.name: Pauline Wanjala

texts.en:
Pauline Wanjala M. is a 32 year old lady. She is married to Meshack and they have been blessed with two children.

Pauline owns a boutique and has been in this business for the last six years. This marks her third loan from KADET LTD, and she plans to purchase clothes, bags and shoes for her business.

The anticipated profits will be directed into the repayment of the loan and expansion of her business. Her future dream is to open another boutique.

loans.use: Purchase clothes, bags, and shoes

loans.name: Irene Wanjiku

texts.en:
Irene is a 48 year old single lady with one independent child, age 23 years old. She runs a dairy and a tea farm. She has been in this business for a period of ten years with an income of KES 5,000 per month.

Irene has never borrowed from any other MFI. This is her first loan from KADET LTD and she intends to buy dairy meals for her cows. She hopes to be a leading farmer in the area and to see her grandchildren excel in life through education.

loans.use: To buy dairy meals for her cows

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Regina Nzilani

texts.en:
Regina B. is 57 years old and married to Kitheka who contributes to the family income.  She runs a retail shop and does farming. She has been in the business for a period of three years with an income of about KES. 5,000 per month.

This is her first loan from KADET LTD and she intends to use it to buy potatoes, maize and bean seedlings. She hopes to be a leading farmer in the future and improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: To buy potatoes, maize and bean seedlings

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 45-year-old married man living with his wife and three school-age children. He has built a good experience working as a construction worker for 25 years. In 1990, he started working independently, taking home/construction projects. He has a good number of clients asking for his services. His income is important to help with the household expenses.  

Today, he is requesting to borrow $800 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to increase his business capital and invest in purchasing an engine for his cement mixer in order to continue expansion of his business and to increase his productivity further. He expects that his business will continue to be successful in the coming year.

loans.use: To purchase an engine for his cement mixer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Joyce Fondo

texts.en:
Joyce Fondo N. is 68 years old. She is married to Charles and they have been blessed with four children.

Joyce runs a food kiosk and has been in this business for the last two years. This being her first loan from KADET LTD she plans to purchase maize, beans for cooking a local dish known as "Githeri" — a corn and bean stew — and also buy maize flour, salt and cooking oil.

The anticipated profits will be directed into the expansion of her food kiosk business. In future Joyce hopes to own a restaurant.

loans.use: to purchase maize, beans for cooking "Githeri" — a local stew — and maize flour, salt and cooking oil

loans.name: Twezimbe  Women's Group-Buikwe,lugazi

texts.en: Florence N. is a 40-year-old business lady who has operated a restaurant in Lweru-Lugazi for 15 years. It is a business that this buoyant and happily married mother of seven says generates KES80,000 in weekly profits. Florence also does some farming and tailoring on the side. She says diligence is what has gotten her this far in her business and she will use this loan to purchase more food for her restaurant. Florence belongs to Twezimbe Women's group, Lugazi.

loans.use: The purchase of more food for her restaurant

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy pigs and food for the pigs

loans.name: Davy  Kusdael Evrard

texts.fr:
homme de 31ans  célibataire et père d'un enfant de 6ans. après le décès de son père il se lance dans la vente des sandales homme, enfant et femme en 2007 avec un capital de 120.000 francs cfa.
avec ce prêt il va renforcer son activité en achetant sandales hommes.
il s'approvisionne auprès des grossistes qui ne garantisse l'achat des marchandises.
malgré les difficultés de non garantie il s'efforce à épargner chaque semaine afin de pouvoir sa fillette. il aimerai devenir grossiste dans les jours futur.
texts.en: [This borrower] is a 31-year old man, single and the father of a 6-year old child. After the death of his father in 2007, he launched a business selling men’s women’s and children’s sandals. He buys his stock from wholesalers and has no guarantee that he would be able to resell his merchandise. In spite of the risk of not being able to sell his inventory, he tries to save a bit every week in order to [support] his daughter. He would like to become a wholesaler in the future.

loans.use: To purchase men's and women's sandals

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Zamokuhle Group

texts.en:
Bongokuwe is 53 years old and widowed with four children aged 21, 24, 27 and 31. She runs a small business in Mandini. She lives with two other relatives who she takes care of. She is standing on the right hand side of the photo above, folding her hands.

She's been in this business for 10 years and sells cold drinks, breads, and canned foods from her home. She also earns income from the government’s child support grant. She says that the main challenge to her business is that the customers do not pay on time.

She requested this loan through Women’s Development Business and KIVA to buy cold drinks, bread, maize, meal, flour, rice and paraffin. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her send her children to the university. In five years time, she would like to have a supermarket. 

She also appreciated WDB and KIVA for being so helpful to her.

loans.use: To buy cold drinks, breads, maize meal, flour, rice and paraffin

loans.name: Benard

texts.en:
Benard has a mixed farm in the town of Nyamira in western Kenya that produces cabbages, onions, bananas, tea and coffee. He has been in the farming business for three years now and sells his products locally. He also earns income from his business of hawking in the same town.

Benard is 27 years old and married with two children ages 1 and 2.

He has requested for a loan of 40,000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says that with the dairy cow he will acquire with this loan, his family will be guaranteed enough milk for domestic consumption and sale. He plans to acquire an additional piece of land in the future to enable him expand his farming activities.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Doña Mercedes, de 56 años de edad, reside en Jucuapa departamento de Usulután, vive con su esposo y tiene 4 hijos de las edades 33, 28, 24, 21 años de edad, los dos hijos mayores viven fuera en sus propios hogares y los últimos dos dependen aun de sus ingresos.
Doña Mercedes tiene un negocio de granja y comercialización de pollos de engorde, está pendiente de ellos todos los días de la semana y a cualquier hora, por el momento solicita un préstamo para la compra de concentrado, vacunas y más pollos, esta inversión le ayudara a fortalecer la granja, aumentando su número de pollos y manteniéndoles la alimentación necesaria.
Ella aspira continuar en esta labor, poder tener otra granja al mismo tiempo para albergar más pollos y tener la oportunidad de ser mayorista en un futuro.
texts.en:
Mercedes is 56 years old.  She lives in Jucuapa, in Usulután department, with her husband.  She has 4 children aged 33, 28, 24 and 21.  Her two eldest children live in their own homes and the youngest two are still dependent on her income.

Mercedes has a business raising and selling chickens.  She works with them every day of the week.  Mercedes is currently requesting a loan to buy concentrated animal feed, vaccines and more chickens.  This investment will help her to strengthen her farm, increase her number of chickens and provide them with the necessary feed.

Mercedes aspires to continue in this business.  She hopes to have another farm and house more chickens.  She hopes to become a wholesaler in the future.

loans.use: To buy concentrated animal feed, vaccines and more chickens.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “ALLIN MUJU”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac, provincia de Cusco, Departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Maria; La socia tiene 36 años de edad, la socia es casada,  y tiene 3 hijos (17,10,9 años de edad); la socia se dedica a l comercio minorista, ella cría animales menores (cuyes, chanchos y aves de corral); la socia cada cierto tiempo realiza viajes a la provincia de Abancay en Apurimac, ella lleva los cuyes y los pollos para la venta, allá la socia tiene sus clientes que la esperan para comprarle al por mayor los pollos y cuyes, la socia desea invertir el préstamo en la compra de cuyes y pollos. La socia invertirá el préstamo en la compra de cuyes y pollos para la venta.

La socia está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
María, 36, is a member of the “ALLIN MUJU” communal bank located in Huanchac district, Cusco province, Cusco department.

She is married and has three children (ages: 17, 10 and 9).  She is a Retailer.  She raises small farm animals (guinea pigs, pigs and barnyard fowl). Every so often she travels to Abancay province in Apurimac and takes guinea pigs and chickens to sell.  She has customers there who wait for her to buy chickens and guinea pigs from her at wholesale.  She wants to use the loan to buy guinea pigs and chickens.  She will use the loan to buy guinea pigs and chickens to sell.

She is happy with the granted loan and commits to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: To buy guinea pigs and chickens to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Milagro Del Carmen

texts.es:
Doña Milagro, tiene 42 años D. edad, resiD. en Mercedes Umaña, departamento D. Usulután, vive con su familia y dos hijos D. 18 y 22 años D. edad, ella tiene un taller D. sastrería, trabaja D. lunes a domingo, la confección que ella prepara son en su mayoría uniformes para los centros escolares.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra D. materiales D. costura, como hilos, ciper, brochas, telas D. diferentes colores, agujas, esta compra le ayudara a contar con todo lo necesario para la ejecución D. su trabajo, además que así será capaz D. realizar cualquier pedido D. sastrería, dándole una mejor estabilidad al negocio y su economía.
Las aspiraciones D. doña Milagro es continuar incrementando el negocio, trabajar con financiamientos y mejorar la calidad D. vida D. su familia.
texts.en:
Milagro, 42, lives in Mercedes Umaña, Usulután department with her family and two children who are 18 and 22 years of age.  She has a tailor shop.  She works from Monday to Sunday.  The items she manufactures the most are school uniforms.

She is asking for a loan to buy sewing supplies like: thread, zippers, clasps, fabric in assorted colors and needles.  This purchase will help her have everything she needs to do her work in addition to making it possible for her to accomplish whatever tailoring job might arise providing her business with more stability and income.

Milagro’s hopes are to continue growing in business, to work with loans and to improve her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To buy sewing supplies like: thread, zippers and fabric in assorted colores.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Siyathokoza Group

texts.en:
Sphiwe is 40 years old, single, and has 3 children between 6 and 12, all of whom attend school. She has been in business for 3 years, and earns additional income from the government’s child support grant. She says that the main challenge to her business is acquiring stock, because she does not have transport. In the photo above she is standing on the far right hand side in front of the group. 

Sphiwe requested this loan through Women’s Development Business and KIVA to buy airtime, clothes, cold drinks and chips. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her send her kids to better schools and have a good life. In five years time she would like to have a factory and more employees.  She appreciates WDB and Kiva very much because her business is going to be seen on the website.

loans.use: to buy clothes, airtime, cold drinks and chips

loans.name: Silvia Lorena

texts.es:
Silvia de 29 años de edad, reside en El Transito departamento de San Miguel, posee una panadería, vive con sus padres y es madre soltera de un hijo de 4 años de edad, él depende económicamente de Silvia.
El negocio comenzó con el apoyo de sus padres, la panadería la tiene instalada en su propia casa, tiene 14 empleados, no tiene un horario fijo de trabajo y necesita de un préstamo para invertir en la panadería, comprando harina, sal, azúcar todo al por mayor, esta compra le será de mucha ayuda porque tendrá los materiales necesarios para la ejecución del trabajo y realizar el pan.
El objetivo de Silvia es mejorar su producción, aumentarla y que aumente la clientela, con este avance las condiciones de vida de ella y su familia serán más estables.
texts.en:
Silvia, 29, lives in El Transito, San Miguel department.  She has a bakery.  She lives with her parents and is a single mother of a 4-year-old son who depends economically on her.

The business started with help from her parents.  The bakery is located in her house.  She has 14 employees.  She does not have a fixed work schedule and needs the loan to invest in the bakery buying flour, salt and sugar at wholesale.  This purchase will be of much help because she’ll have all the necessary materials to do the work and make bread.

Silvia’s objective is to improve production, increase it and get more customers.  This advance will lead to improved, more stable living conditions for her and her family.

loans.use: To buy flour, salt and sugar at wholesale.

loans.name: Melissa Rosario

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “ALLIN MUJU”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac, provincia de Cusco, Departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Melissa; La socia tiene 28 años de edad, la socia es conviviente,  y esta esperando su primer bebe; la socia se dedica a elaborar todo tipo de materiales, la socia hace manualidades, la socia tiene sus productos expuestos por internet y también vende en ferias locales, ella desea incrementar sus ventas y tener un capital para hacer manualidades y exhibir sus trabajos recientes y los que tiene pendientes para lo cual requiere comprar materiales. La socia invertirá el préstamo en la compra de materiales como hilos, soguillas, hebillas, argollas, mostacillas.

La socia está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Melissa, 28, is a member of the “ALLIN MUJU” communal bank located in Huanchac district, Cusco province, Cusco department.

She has a live-in partner and is expecting her first baby.  She makes all kinds of crafts.  She displays them on the Internet and also sells them in local markets.  She’d like to increase sales and have capital to make more crafts and to display her more recent creations and to make the ones she has pending for which she needs to buy materials and supplies.  She will use the loan to buy materials like: thread, braided cords, buckles, hoops and beads.

She is happy with the granted loan and commits to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: To buy supplies like: thread, braided cord, buckles, hoops and beads.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase supplies for growing corn and animal feed for his livestock.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 46 years old, married, and has 5 children who all attend school.  She is a farmer from the town of Kitale in western Kenya. She has been in the farming business for five years now and employs one farmhand. Her farm produces maize, beans, milk and bananas, which are all sold locally. She also runs a hotel business in the same town.

She has requested a loan of 46,800 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The proceeds from this loan will help her in educating her children and providing for the basic needs of her family. Her major challenges have been unpredictable weather conditions and poor prices for her farm produce. She hopes to own at least five quality dairy cows in the future.

loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Jorge Miguel

texts.es:
Jorge es un joven de 23 años de edad, reside en San Miguel, se dedica a la venta y reparación de celulares, vive con su esposa y el negocio lo tiene ubicado en San Francisco Gotera, el kiosco de venta ofrece celulares, recarga de saldo, reparación y venta de accesorios.
El solicita un préstamo para la compra de una cortina metálica, para instalarla en el local y tener más seguridad. Este préstamo hará posible que Jorge tenga en mejores condiciones el negocio y que su puerta sea hoy más segura que antes.
La aspiración de él es continuar mejorando el negocio, tener una mejor estabilidad a largo plazo y vivir bien con su esposa.
texts.en:
Jorge is a young man who is 23 years of age. He lives with his wife in San Miguel. Jorge sells and repairs mobile phones. He has a sales kiosk in San Francisco Gotera where he offers mobile phones, rechargeable calling cards, repairs, and phone accessories.

The loan he is requesting will be used to buy a metal curtain to install in his store to provide more security. This loan will provide Jorge with better conditions for his business and his entrance will be more secure than before.

His aspirations include continuing to improve his business, having better stability in the long term, and living well with his wife.

loans.use: To purchase a metal security gate for his shop.

loans.name: Eldephonse

texts.en: Eldephonse is 42 years old, and he has 4 children who are between the ages of 6 and 13 years. Eldephonse sells beans and sorghum and has done this business for 15 years. He is requesting a loan in order to buy more sorghum and beans in bulk so he can earn greater profits. With the savings, together with the profits, he plans to build himself a house.

loans.use: buy additional sorghum and beans to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Candida Del Carmen

texts.es:
Doña Cándida de 54 años de edad, reside en la Ciudad de San Miguel, se dedica a la venta de tortillas, vive con sus hijos David de 28 años y Carmen de 18 años de edad, ellos trabajan y ayudan a doña Cándida en los gastos del  hogar. 
El negocio de las tortillas lo realiza en su casa junto a su hija Carmen y comienzan a vender de 10:00am a 2:00pm, este negocio lo administran las dos, y actualmente solicita un préstamo para comprar maíz, esta es su principal material para preparar la venta y realizar las tortillas, ella piensa hacer la compra al por mayor ya que de esta manera tendrá a mejor precio el quintal de maíz y se ahorrara mayores gastos, teniendo suficiente para un periodo.
Su objetivo es mejorar cada día el negocio y aumentar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Doña Cándida is 54 years old and resides in the city of San Miguel with her children, David (age 28) and Carmen (age 18). Both of her children work and help with the household expenses.

Doña Cándida sells tortillas and manages her business from her home. She and her daughter Carmen begin selling at 10am and continue until 2pm. They both operate the business. Cándida is currently requesting a loan to buy corn, the main ingredient used for preparing tortillas to sell. She plans to buy in bulk so that she can get the best price for a quintal of corn (1 quintal = 46kg). This will help her save on her expenses, which will help build sufficient capital over time.

Her goals include improving her business each day and increasing her earnings.

loans.use: To purchase corn for preparing tortillas.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Operating capital to buy bags, fruit, sugar, shirts, trousers, suits, and other items

loans.name: Ernesto Porfirio

texts.es:
Don Porfirio de 53 años de edad, reside en la Ciudad de San Miguel, es viudo y vive solo, se dedica al servicio de taxi, este trabajo lo realiza todos los días de la semana desde muy temprano recorriendo las colonias y barrios de San Miguel.
Don Porfirio está solicitando un préstamo para usarlo en gastos médicos ya que una de sus hermanas tiene apendicitis y necesita una cirugía, para este proceso ella no cuenta con los fondos suficientes, por lo que él quiere ayudarla con los fondos de este préstamo.
Él tiene como objetivo trabajar arduamente para pagar las cuotas de este préstamo, y que la operación de su hermana espera que sea exitosa y que su apoyo sea importante.
texts.en:
Don Porfirio, age 53, resides in the city of San Miguel. He is a widower and lives alone. Porfirio provides taxi services and works every day of the week. From the early morning hours, he travels through the different sections and neighborhoods of San Miguel.

Don Porfirio is requesting a loan to use for medical expenses. One of his sisters has appendicitis and needs an operation. She does not have sufficient funds to pay for this procedure, so Porfirio wants to help her by using the proceeds from this loan.

He aims to work hard so that he can repay this loan. His sister’s operation is expected to be successful, so this support is important.

loans.use: Pay for his sister's operation

loans.name: Las Animas Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama "Las Animas", porque asi se llama el pueblo. Esta ubicado en el Estado D. Mexico. El grupo esta conformado por 9 integrantes. Gabina Nancy P. es integrante del grupo. Tiene 27 años, estudio hasta L. secundaria, es comerciantes, tiene en total 3 hijos, 1 mujer y 2 hombres. ElL. se dedica a L. venta D. tortillas, negocio que inicio hace 1 año. Solicita el prestamo para comprar maiz por tonelas. Sus clientes son sus propias vecinas, ellas argumentan que L. tortilL. que les venD. esta bien hecha y estan muy sabrosa.Al momento D. solicitar este prestamo se siente feliz y aliviada porque con el credito podra invertir en su negocio, asi le resulta más barato que comprar por bultos. Con las ganancias que obtendra espera en un futuro no muy lejano tener su propio local porque en estos momentos renta y así tendrá mayores ganancias para ofrecerles una mejor vida y educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
This group is called "Las Animas", named after the village. which is located in Mexico. The group is maD. up of nine members. Gabina Nancy P. is a member of the group. She is 27 years old, attended school through secondary school, and has three children, one girl and two boys.  

Gabina sells tortillas. She started her business a year ago and is requesting a loan to buy maize in bulk. Her customers are her neighbors, and say that the tortillas Gabina sells are well maD. and delicious. Gabina is happy and relieved to have the loan to invest in her business because buying in bulk will allow her to lower her costs. With the business profit she obtains, she hopes to have her own store in the near future. Gabina currently rents and with the money saved she will be able to offer a better life and education to her children.

loans.use: To purchase maize.

loans.name: Edwin Alexander

texts.es:
Edwin de 28 años de edad, reside en San Miguel, vive con su esposa y su pequeña hija Alexandra de 11 meses de nacida, él es empleado de un comercial donde trabaja como vendedor de productos alimenticios de la canasta básica, trabaja desde hace 5 años.
Él solicita un préstamo para gastos personales, ya que se le presentan unos gastos y el recurre a un préstamo para solventar la situación.
El objetivo de Edwin es proveer para su hogar lo necesario, estabilizar las condiciones actuales de su hogar.
texts.en:
Edwin is 28 years old and lives in San Miguel with his wife and eleven month old daughter named Alexandra. He is an employee for a business that sells basic food products and has worked there for five years.

Edwin is a requesting a loan to use for personal expenses. He needs these funds to resolve his situation. His goals include providing for the necessities of his family and stabilizing his current household conditions.

loans.use: To pay for family expenses.

loans.name: Esperance

texts.en: Esperance is 34 years old, and she has 5 children between the ages of 2-15 years old. Esperance sells cattle, and she works together with her husband. Esperance is requesting a loan to buy more cattle in order to make more profits. She plans to save her profits.

loans.use: Buying cattle.

loans.name: Guillermo De Jesus

texts.es: Guillermo De Jesús se dedica a una pulpería. Tiene más de 5 años que tiene este negocio, pues ha sido una persona muy responsable. El inicio este medio de vida para sobrevivir con su esposa e hijos. Guillermo tiene 2 hijos que están a su cargo, el es un padre que busca la forma de enseñarles a sus hijos como ganarse la vida de una manera humilde. Este crédito es para la compra de  golosinas, refrescos, granos básicos, pan, detergentes entre otros productos que sus clientes llegan a solicitarle.
texts.en:
Guillermo De Jesús has a store that he has managed for more than five years. He is a very responsible person. Guillermo started to earn a living in this manner in order to support his wife and two dependent children. He is a father who teaches his children how to live in a humble manner.

This loan will be used to buy candy, soft drinks, basic grains, bread, detergents, and other products that his customers request.

loans.use: Operating capital to buy candy, soft drinks, basic grains, bread, detergents, and other products

loans.name: Paz

texts.es:
Doña Paz D. 56 años D. edad, resiD. en Guatajiagua, departamento D. Morazán, D. sus hijos solo tiene la más pequeña a su cargo, ya que los hijos mayores están casados y tienen sus propios hogares, su hija menor se llama Joseline tiene 17 años D. edad, doña Paz se dedica a la elaboración D. loza, este oficio lo aprendió muy pequeña, trabaja durante el día y en ocasiones cuando su demanda es mayor le dedica mayor tiempo.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para comprar leña, barro, nacazcol, zacate, todo esto es necesario para el proceso D. elaboración D. ollas y comales. Esto será D. mucha ayuda, ya que el dinero le servirá para adquirir todos los materiales y poder continuar con su trabajo.
El sueño D. doña Paz y ver realizada a su hija con una carrera universitaria, que con su esfuerzo esta joven pueda tener un futuro diferente; en cuanto al negocio pues también desea ser progresiva y aumentar cada día la producción.
texts.en:
Doña Paz is 56 years old and lives in Guatajiagua in the Department of Morazán. She has children, but only the youngest is still a dependent. Her adult children are married and have their own households. Her youngest daughter, named Joseline, is 17 years old. Doña Paz makes earthenware, a traD. she learned as a young girl. She works throughout the day, and when demand is high for her products, she devotes more time to her traD..

She is requesting a loan to buy firewood, clay, “nacazcol” (a natural dye), grasses, and necessary supplies for making pots and griddles. This will be a great help since the money will enable her to acquire all the materials she needs to continue with her work.

Doña Paz dreams of seeing her daughter with a university degree. Through her efforts, she hopes her daughter will have a different future. In addition, she wants to make progress in her business and increase her production each day.

loans.use: To purchase firewood, clay, natural dyes, and grasses for making earthenware.

loans.name: Luzmila

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “ALLIN MUJU”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac, provincia de Cusco, Departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Luzmila; La socia tiene 46 años de edad, la socia es conviviente,  y tiene 3 hijos (25,22,12); la socia se dedica a la elaboración de repostería, la socia realiza pasteles, tortas, empanadas y bocaditos para fiestas, y también ella confecciona uniformes y en esta época que los alumnos vuelven a clases la socia desea tener un capital para invertir en la compra de materiales para confeccionar uniformes, telas, botones, cierres, y otros, la socia ahora que es campaña escolar está muy interesada en invertir en este negocio. La socia invertirá el préstamo en la compra de materiales para la confección escolar.

La socia está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Sra. Luzmila is a member of the Communal Bank “Allin Muju” which is located in the District of Huanchac, Province and Department of Cusco.

She is 46 years old, in a common law marriage, and has three children (ages 25, 22, and 12). Luzmila makes desserts such as pastries, cakes, turnovers, and snacks for parties. She also manufactures uniforms since students are currently returning to classes. Luzmila wants to secure capital to invest in the purchase of materials to make uniforms such as fabrics, buttons, zippers, and other items. She is very interested in investing in her business because of the school year. Luzmila will invest her loan in the purchase of these materials for making school uniforms.

She is happy with the loan that was provided and promises to complete her payments on time.

loans.use: Purchase materials for making school uniforms

loans.name: Agripina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “ALLIN MUJU”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac, provincia de Cusco, Departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Agripina; La socia tiene 34 años de edad, la socia es conviviente,  y tiene 4 hijos; (18,14,10,8); la socia se dedica al comercio minorista, la socia compra y vende cuyes, gallinas y todo tipo de ave de corral los cría engorda reproducen y los vende, ella trabaja los sábados y domingos en el baratillo, y de lunes a viernes entrega los pedidos que tiene para toda la semana, la socia desea contar con este capital de trabajo para comprar cuyes y gallinas específicamente al por mayor, ella está en espera de este capital para lograr sus metas de crecer y dar mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos. La socia invertirá el préstamo en la compra de gallinas y cuyes para la venta.

La socia está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Sra. Agripina is a member of the Communal Bank “Allin Muju” which is located in the District of Huanchac, Province and Department of Cusco.

She is 34 years old, in a common law marriage, and has four children (ages 18, 14, 10, and 8). Agripina is a small businesswoman who buys and sells guinea pigs, hens, and all types of poultry. She raises and fattens these animals for breeding and resale. On Saturdays and Sundays, she works at a secondhand shop. From Monday through Friday, she delivers the orders that she receives throughout the week. Agripina wants to have operating capital to buy guinea pigs and hens at wholesale. She hopes this capital will help her reach her goals of growing and providing a better quality of life for her children. This loan will be invested in the purchase of hens and guinea pigs to sell.

Agripina is happy with the loan that was provided and promises to complete her payments on time.

loans.use: Purchase hens & guinea pigs to sell

loans.name: Domitila

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “ALLIN MUJU”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito D. Huanchac, provincia D. Cusco, Departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Domitila; La socia tiene 60 años D. edad, la socia es conviviente,  y tiene 2 hijos (40,39 ); la socia se dedica a las manualidades, ella realiza bellos trabajos en macramé, bordados, tejidos y otros, la socia es una persona muy adorable, y tiene un trato muy dulce, ella nos comenta que debido a las lluvias desD. el mes D. diciembre a la fecha remojaron los cimientos D. su vivienda y necesita reparar toda la base y reforzar la primera planta D. su casa, la socia desea el crédito con el fin D. reforzar sus vivienda y comprar materiales y contratar personal para arreglar su vivienda ya que las lluvias aún continúan y ella teme que se remoje tanto el cimiento y podría ocurrir una tragedia debido a que su casita queda en la margen derecha cerca al río. La socia solicita el préstamo para reforzar los cimientos D. su vivienda.
 
La socia está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Domitila, 60, is a member of the “ALLIN MUJU” communal bank located in Huanchac district, Cusco province, Cusco department.

She has a common law spouse and two children (ages: 40 and 39).  She makes crafts.  She makes beautiful macramé items, embroidery, woven items and others.  She is an adorable person, very kind and sweet.  

She tells us that due to the rains from December to the present her house’s foundation got soaked and the entire base of her house needs to be repaired and the first floor needs to be reinforced.  She needs the loan to reinforce her house, to buy materials and to hire personnel to repair her house because the rain is continuing and she fears that the foundation will become so soaked that a tragedy could occur because her house is located on the right bank near the river.  She requests the loan to reinforce her house’s foundation.

She is happy with the granted loan and commits to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: She will use the loan to reinforce the foundations of her house.

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.en:
Jeanne is 35 years old, married, and has 4 children.  Her husband is also a businessman.  Jeanne has had her boutique for 3 years and employs 1 person to help her.

Jeanne will use this loan to purchase more bags to sell.  If she is successful and able to make a profit from the use of her loan, she would like to buy a house.

loans.use: To buy more bags to sell

loans.name: Mirna Del Socorro

texts.es: Mirna Del Socorro tiene 40, su actividad económica es la venta de piñata y elaboración, por lo que tiene 4 años de dedicarse a este negocio. Por lo que es la primera experiencia que obtiene con los financiamientos, ella distribuye sus productos por encargos pues es así que obtiene más clientes. Ya que sus inicios fueron muy difíciles porque no tenía el capital suficiente. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de papeles, globos, tinajas, cintas entre otras cosas necesarias para la elaboración de sus piñatas.
texts.en:
Mirna Del Socorro, 40, makes piñatas to sell.  She’s been in this business for four years.  This is her first experience with loans.  She sells her items based on prior orders since that’s the way she gets more customers.  At the beginning it was very difficult because she lacked sufficient capital.

The loan she’s requesting is to buy paper, balloons, clay pots and streamers, among other things needed to make piñatas.

loans.use: To buy piñata-making materials and supplies.

loans.name: Veronica De Los Angeles

texts.es: Verónica tiene 27 años. Tiene la actividad económica de una pulpería a pesar de ser tan joven tiene una amplia experiencia en su negocio. Hace más de 2 años que se dedica a esta actividad, por lo que ella no tenía ningún medio de ingreso ya sus padres al no poseer suficientes recurso, le enseñaron a trabajar a temprana edad, así es que ella incursiona en este negocio. Es una persona sencilla y respetuosa que día a día se preocupa por mejorar sus ingresos. El dinero que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de golosinas, detergentes, jabón, granos básicos, pan, leche entre otros productos. En sus deseos esta el seguir manteniendo este negocio ya que es su único medio de vida.
texts.en:
Verónica is 27 years old.  She has a grocery store.  Despite being so young she has vast experience in her business.  She’s been in business over two years because she had no source of income because her parents did not have enough resources.  They taught her how to work from a very early age.  This is how she went into this business.

She is an unassuming, respectful person who tries to improve her income every day.  The money she’s requesting will be used as working capital to buy snacks, detergent, soap, basic grains, bread and milk, among other products.  Her wish is to stay in business since it’s her only source of livelihood.

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Vincent

texts.fr:
Commerçant de 48ans célibataire et père de 5 enfants dont l’âge varie de 10 à 21 ans, et ayant 1 personne en charge. En 2008 il débute son commerce de boucherie avec un capital de 200000 francs. Sa vente journalière est de 20000 à 50000 francs cfa. 
Ce prêt lui  permettra d’acheter des vivres frais tels que de la viande, du poulet, du poisson.
Il aimerait avoir sa propre chambre froide dans un super marché afin de mieux assuré ses responsabilité familiale. 
Dans son entourage il est reconnu comme un chrétien car il est très intéressé au spirituel.
texts.en:
Vincent is 48, single and father of 5 children between 10 and 21 years of age; he is also responsible for another person. 
In 2008 he began his butcher business with a capital of 200,000 francs. His daily sales achieve between 20,000 and 50,000 francs CFA. 
This loan will allow him to buy fresh products such as meat, chicken and fish. 
He would like to have his own cold room in a super market to better take care of his family needs.People around him consider him a Christian and a spiritual person.

loans.use: Purchase of meat, fish and chicken.

loans.name: Callixte
